loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara K. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high. Sara sells plastic products such as plastic plates, bowls and containers in Abotoase.  She has been doing this business for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. Sara uses her income to pay for utility bills and school fees for the children. Sara will use the loan to purchase more of the plastic wares for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Sara plans to save for the future!

loans.use: to purchase more of the plastic wares for sale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. C. C. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Srey Hen, helps her. Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough money to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. C. C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to improve their living conditions after she sells this cow.

Mrs. C. C. is a villager in Prey Meas village in Takeo province. She is the mother of a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is 32 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She is a very hard-working woman whose hard effort provides for the children, all of whom are in school. She trades in food stuffs like maize and gari grains. She sells maize in bulk in the market. Gari is prepared from milled cassava. She takes delivery of stock from the nearby communities, and distributes or treks them during market days. She has a large customer base but her problem is inadequate funds to buy stock. With the loan assistance, she believes she can be fully resourced to realize her dream of providing better education for her children. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy cereals like gari and maize grains.

loans.name: Kudiratu

texts.en: Kudiratu is 45 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is 20 and her youngest is 13. Her husband is a commercial driver, and Kudiratu contibutes to the family income by selling colorful shoes and bags at retail prices to customers in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. This is the high season for sales and this loan will help her increase her income by allowing her to buy more shoes and bags to sell. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina B. is from the village of Yumbing, in Mambajao Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old. Rina is single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rina owns and operates a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling AVON products in the local community. Rina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rina is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline G. is from the village of Alindahaw in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old. Evangeline is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline sells bread and other food snacks in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She used her previous loan to purchase additional products to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Evangeline's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 12 años tiene una fábrica de ladrillos donde labora junto a su esposo. Ellos trabajan todos los días, sin descanso, para lograr producir ladrillos en la cantidad y calidad necesaria para su comercialización. Su trabajo es muy duro, ya que requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico y tiempo, puesto que cada madrugada su esposo se levanta para calentar el horno y por la mañana  Zenaida ayuda en la preparación de la masa de arcilla que es depositada en los moldes y dejada secar en el sol por un día entero; una vez secos se depositan en el horno para cocinarse durante 24 horas.

Este es su 13avo crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy comprometida con su banco comunal, por lo que seguirá trabajando por la unidad de su grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de ladrillos; como arena fina, aserrín y cal.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 41, lives with her husband and their 5 children in a house they own. For 12 years, she has had a brick factory where she and her husband work together. They work every day, with little rest, to make enough good bricks to sell. The work is very hard because it requires a lot of physical effort and many long hours. Her husband gets up early every morning to fire a kiln while Zenaida helps make the clay mix that is then molded and left to dry in the sun all day. Once the mix dries, they put the bricks in the kiln to bake for 24 hours.

This is Zenaida's 13th MFP loan. She is very committed to her community bank and she will continue working to strengthen the group. The loan that she is applying for now will be used to buy the materials necessary to make bricks: sand, wood chips and lime.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for brick manufacturing business.

loans.name: Clémence

texts.fr: T. Clémence est née en 1979 à Houègbo dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Clémence est mariée à ANGO Nicaise, un employé à la Société Béninoise de Brasserie au Bénin, et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Clémence vit depuis une dizaine d’année au quartier Enagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Clémence a très peu fréquenté et a appris ensuite la coiffure. C’est cette activité que Clémence exerce depuis 15 ans, pour faire face à ses différents besoins. A côté de cette activité, Clémence vend également divers produits de coiffure et également des tissus dans son atelier situé au quartier Enagnon. Clémence est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bénéficié antérieurement de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés.  Cependant, Clémence a rencontré de difficultés financières depuis qu’elle a été victime d’un accident à son troisième crédit. Clémence voudrait rehausser le niveau de son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire plus de revenu. C’est ce qui a amené Clémence à solliciter un quatrième prêt auprès de ALDé.
texts.en:
T. Clémence was born in 1979 in Houègbo in Atlantique province in Bénin. Clémence is married to ANGO Nicaise, an employee at the Benin Brewing Company in Bénin, and is the mother of two children, both enrolled in school. She has been living with her family for some 10 years in the Enagnon district of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. The couple both participate in supporting the family.

Clémence was not enrolled in school for long and later learned hairdressing. This is the business she has been in for 15 years, in order to earn a living. Besides this business, she also sells various hairdressing products and lengths of cloth in her beauty shop, located in the Enagnon district. Clémence is a long-time client of ALIDé and has previously received three loans from ALIDé, all correctly reimbursed. However, she has encountered financial difficulties since she had an accident during her third loan period. She would like to boost her business to better satisfy her clientele and earn more money. This is what brings her to request a fourth loan from ALDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hairdressing products (hair extensions, pomades, hair oil, etc.) and lengths of cloth to sell

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Celia, pertenece al banco comunal  “CAPAC QOYA”, nuestra socia está ubicada en el distrito de Coya- Pisac a 50 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 77 años de edad Nuestra socia es viuda y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales ella tiene viviendo en su casa a su hijo el menor de ellos que tiene 53 años de edad, nuestra socia es una mujer muy cariñosa y dedicada a su hogar, ella tiene un espíritu optimista y es muy dulce, nuestra socia tiene su pequeño negocio en su casa, ella vende chicha de jora, es la bebida de los inkas, (elaborada a base de maíz fermentado), también la socia teje chompas muy lindas y las vende a sus amigas y a los parientes de sus amigas, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y lana para hacer chompas que tiene pedidas.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Celia is a member of the Communal Bank “Capac Qoya” and lives in the District of Coya-Pisac, which is located 50 minutes outside of the city of Cusco.

She is 77 years old, widowed, and has eight children. Celia lives in the home of her youngest son, who is 53 years old. She possesses an optimistic and extremely sweet spirit. She manages a small business from home selling “chicha de jora”, which is an Incan beverage made of fermented corn. Celia also knits beautiful sweaters and sells them to friends and their relatives. She is requesting a loan to buy corn and wool for making sweaters that have been requested.

Celia is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool for knitting sweaters & corn for making "chicha"

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.
Maria es casada, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además tiene otra tienda en la casa de su mama que esta administrada por un personal.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Maria es aumentar su negocio y tener tiendas mas grandes.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Primavera communal bank. Maria is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. Maria has a store in her house where she sells general groceries. She also has another store in her mother's house that is run by an employee. Maria needs a 2000 soles loan. The money will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Maria's dreams are to grow her business and have larger stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Marie Angèle

texts.fr: H. Marie Angèle vit depuis 20 ans à Gbèdjromédé, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marie Angèle est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Marie Angèle ne vit plus avec son mari. Elle vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs charges respectives. Marie Angèle n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Marie Angèle mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (maïs, huile de palme, huile d'arachide, charbon de bois, etc.) et aussi des cartes de recharges téléphoniques à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Marie Angèle achète ses articles. Marie Angèle est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Marie Angèle souhaite faire un approvisionnement en quantité suffisante pour pouvoir dégager une marge de bénéfice plus importante, mais est limitée par les moyens financiers. C’est la raison pour laquelle Marie Angèle désire obtenir un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Marie Angèle H. has lived for 20 years in Gbèdjromédé, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Marie Angèle is mother to two children who are both at school. She no longer lives with her husband but lives alone with her children and covers their respective expenses. Marie Angèle went to primary school only. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, she sells various products (corn, palm oil, peanut oil, charcoal, etc.) and also telephone recharge cards, all from her home. She buys her products at Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin. Marie Angèle is an old client of ALIDé who repays her loans without incident. She would like to get sufficient supplies in order to make a higher profit margin but has limited financial means. It is for this reason that she would like to have another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn, cans of palm oil and peanut oil, and telephone recharge cards

loans.name: Sabina Gladys

texts.es:
Sabina tiene 41 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, un distrito de la zona norte de la provincia de Lambayeque caracterizado por su accidentada geografía y porque tiene a la mayoría de su población dispersa en zonas rurales, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de agenciarse de ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos la llevó a instalar en su vivienda una bodega hace ocho años, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de consumo diario y abarrotes. La calidad de productos que ofrece y el buen trato que brinda a sus clientes han hecho que se gane la preferencia de sus clientes y su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco, esta es su unica fuente de ingreso por lo que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para sacar su bodega adelante.

Sabina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de abarrotes y golosinas de modo que pueda seguir satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Sabina es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que ha sabido ganarse el sustento y progresar mediante un continuo esfuerzo diario. Su mas grande anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos la posibilidad de estudiar una carrera superior y brindarles un mejor futuro. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriomente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Sabina, 41, is separated and lives with her children in Olmos, a district in the north of Lambayeque province famous for its rugged landscape and because most of its population lives in rural settings; it is located an hour and half from the city of Chiclayo. Eight years ago she set up a grocery store in her home because she needed to earn income to support her children; she stocks all kinds of daily use articles and groceries. The quality of her inventory and the good customer service she offers customers makes them prefer her over the competition and her business has gradually grown. This is her only source of income so she always makes the best effort to help it succeed. Sabina hopes to expand her stock of groceries and snacks so that she can continue to satisfy customer demand. This has motivated her to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to help her reach this goal. Sabina is quite dedicated to her family and has learned to earn her daily support and to make progress through sustained daily effort. Her greatest wish is to offer her children the possibility to study higher education to have a career that will provide them with a better future. She has collaborated with our institution previously and has shown punctuality and responsibility with respect to her loan installment repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and snacks.

loans.name: Glenda Siomara

texts.es:
la sra. Glenda Siomara M. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion. doña Glenda es muy dedicada a su negocio y a sus 2 hijos, los cuales los tiene en la escuela de la comunidad en donde viven.
doña Glenda se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar a sus hijos para enviarlos a la escuela y luego atiende a sus clientes.
doña glenda utilizara el prestamo para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Glenda Siomara M. sells everyday products. She has a general store in her home. Doña Glenda is very dedicated to her business and to her two children, who go to school in the community where they live. Doña Glenda gets up at 4 in the morning to get her children ready for school and then attend to her customers. Doña Glenda will use the loan to buy more merchandise and thus stock her store. She needs the earnings to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, lard, rice, sugar, tortillas, bread, crackers, soups, churros, soft drinks, juice, milk, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, batteries, wheat flour, cornmeal, oil, sardines, peppers, sweets, and sauces

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Душанова Муслима проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 30 лет. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается торговлей. В основном продает ткани. Муслима хочет расширить свой бизнес. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Muslima D. lives near Vose. She is 30 years old. Married with one child. She has finished secondary school. She has been in sales for over eight years. She mostly sells fabrics. Muslima would like to expand her business. She is taking out a loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the inventory

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia D. is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children.

Denia owns and operates a business raising and selling "tilapia" (St. Peter's fish) to the market. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years already.

Denia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Denia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds and additional fish to sell. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To buy feeds and additional fish to sell

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es casada, tiene 9 hijos y 8 nietos. Delfina tiene un negocio D. venta D. abarrotes en su casa, ella ha sido negociante desD. pequeña, viajaba acompañando a su padre a Cangallo para traer productos, así aprendió a ser negociante, actualmente ella maneja su negocio con el apoyo D. sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en un instituto pedagógico, ambos aportan para el hogar.
Delfina tiene 18 años aproximadamente en FINCA Perú, gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido pudo abrir su negocio e ir aumentando sus ventas, con sus ahorros ha podido construir su casa D. material noble, su sueño es terminar su segundo piso.
Delfina solicita un préstamo D. 2600 soles para invertir en la compra D. arroz, azúcar por sacos, comprando al por mayor.
texts.en:
Delfina belongs to the Paloma Village Bank. She's married and has nine children and eight grandchildren. She has a grocery store in her house. She's been a businesswoman since she was small, having learned the business when she used to travel with her father to Cangallo delivering products. At present she runs her business with the help of her children. Her husband works at a teachers' institute, and they both support the home. Delfina has been with FINCA Perú for around eighteen years. Thanks to the loans she has received she was able to open her business and continue to grow her sales. With her savings she has been able to build her house out of good materials. Her dream is to complete the second floor. She's seeking a loan for 2600 soles to buy rice and sacks of sugar wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sacks of sugar

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es:
Doña Camila es madre de tres hijos, vive en un barrio de la capital Villa Venezuela, su negocio es la venta de ropa y venta de electrodomésticos de segunda mano, el cual estos los  vende por encargo, pues ella tiene sus conecte de compra favorables.
Este negocio lo inicio hace muchos años, con dinero prestado en otra institución lo que logro capitalizar, con una pulpería  pero luego le resulto la ropa por que era una mejor inversión y que vendía en los departamentos, con las ganancias y los prestamos hizo su casa de concreto, ayudo  a sus hijos con sus estudios como madre soltera por que no tuvo el apoyo de su compañero.
Con este financiamiento invertirá en la compra de ropa interior, una docena de biquinis, de dama, una docena de bóxer para caballero, calcetas, cosméticos productos Avon, y electrodomésticos, con el objetivo de atraer al cliente mediante sus productos y lograr mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Ms. Camila is the mother of three children and lives in Villa Venezuela, a neighborhood located in the capital city. She sells second hand clothing and small appliances by request. She has good connections for purchasing them. She started this business as a general store many years ago, with money that she borrowed through another institution, but eventually settled on clothing sales because it turned out to be a better investment because she had better sales within the surrounding areas (departments). She used her earnings and loans to have her concrete home built. As a single mother, she also helped her children with their education, because she did not have her partner’s support. She will use the money from this loan to invest in undergarments; a dozen ladies’ bikini bottoms, a dozen pairs of men’s boxer shorts, socks, cosmetics, Avon products, and small appliances. Her goal is to attract more customers and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Jose Vinicio

texts.en:
Jose Vinicio A. R., 40 years old, is in a common law relationship and has 2 children, aged 7 and 8. He lives in the province of Bolivar.

Jose is a member of a rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. The 14 group members are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Jose cultivates blackberries, corn and beans. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas,” in corn, that endanger the harvest.

Jose is asking for a loan to invest in agriculture: seeds, compost and fertilizers and for his house. He thinks the loan will impact his work, his family, and his whole life positively.

Jose's dream is to enable his children to study. He likes to play sports: volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: To invest in agriculture: seeds, compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El Señor Jaime Masías Alanís, es soltero y trabaja para mantener a su familia, su madre y sus dos hermanos menores ya que su padre los abandono cuando el tenia sus 10 años y desde entonces él ayuda a sostener a su familia.

Jaime Masías Alanís es un joven trabajador, el se dedica al servicio de moto taxis en el sindicato de moto taxis “2 de Agosto” día tras día el se levanta a muy tempranas horas para cumplir con su labor cotidiano para ayudar a su familia y sus hermanos, su madre se dedica a la venta de comida ambulante que apenas le alcanza para comer,  es por eso que  Jaime Masías se dedico al trabajo como moto taxista.

El señor Jaime Masías Alanís tiene una motocicleta ya un poco deteriorada y quería renovar la suya y se aproximo a las Oficinas de CIDRE para solicitar un crédito y así poder renovar su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Jaime Masías Alanís is single and works to support his family; his mother and two younger brothers; because their father abandoned them when he was 10. Since then her has helped to maintain his family. Jaime Masías Alanís is a hard working young man. He drives moto taxis as is part of the “2 de Agosto” moto taxi union. Every day he rises very early in order to perform his daily work to help his family and brothers. His mother sells food on foot. She barely earns enough to feed the family, so Jaime Masías began driving moto taxis. [He] also has a motorcycle of his own that is bad shape and he wants to repair it. He came to the CIDRE office to request a loan, so that he can repair the tools of his trade.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle repair

loans.name: Daysi Rosalvina

texts.es:
Daysi nació en la ciudad de Arequipa y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. (La ciudad de Urubamba se encuentra ubicada a una hora diez de la ciudad del Cusco). 
 
Daysi se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa a pedido del cliente. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que le pone en su trabajo.
       
Con el próximo préstamo, Daysi que espera recibir S/. 3000 nuevo soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo en comprar mercadería como por ejemplo zapatos de marca. 

Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal “Vilcanota” de la asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a la confianza de sus compañeros y a la puntualidad de los pagos de las cuotas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Daysi was born in Arequipa and now lives in the city of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. (Urumbamba is located one hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco.) Daysi sells shoes and clothes on request from her customers. She has been doing this for many years and has been successful, thanks to the effort she puts in her work. With this next loan, Daysi is asking for 3000 new soles ($1075). She wants to use this money to buy merchandise, such as brand-name shoes. She has been a part of the Arariwa Association's "Vilcanota" community bank for a number of years and has done well, thanks to her comrades' trust and her punctual payments. Daysi would like to thank you for the opportunity provided by these loans, and she promises to meet her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, such as brand-name shoes.

loans.name: María Vilma

texts.es: María Vilma S. V. de 55 años de edad, cuenta con un negocio de comida rápida adonde brinda el servicio de bebidas y comida, ubicado en el municipio de Soyapango, en el mismo lugar adonde reside con una hija, siendo ella su única ayuda, ya que es divorciada no cuenta con más ayuda financiera además del ya mencionado. El préstamo ha sido solicitado, para poder invertir  en el negocio y así hacerlo crecer, comprando vegetales, verduras granos básicos y otros más para la elaboración de la comida, además de cancelar un crédito actual, María Vilma es una mujer emprendedora que ha utilizado sus habilidades en la cocina para ayudar a su hija y poder suplir sus necesidades básicas, es conocida por dar un buen servicio, además de su deliciosa comida.
texts.en:
55-year old María Vilma S. V. runs a fast food and drinks stall located in the municipality of Soyapango, where she lives with her daughter. She is the only support for her daughter as she is divorced and gets no financial help except from the business she runs. María would use the loan she is seeking to invest in the business and make it grow. She would buy vegetables, grains, and other ingredients to make food and pay off a debt she has currently. María is an enterprising woman who has used her cooking skills to provide her daughter with the basic necessities. She is known for providing good service as well as delicious food.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie D. S. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 49 years old. Virgie is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing 'motorela' or 'habal-habal' (motorcycle transport) services to local community members with her husband as the driver. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virgie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virgie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TANTAMARCA”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Chicon en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Andres;  El socio tiene 42 años de edad;  el es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio  trabaja vendiendo y comprando animales menores, el socio tiene una pequeña granja en su terreno y el se dedica a la crianza de animales menores para la venta. El socio tiene patos, gallinas, pollos, gallos, chanchos, cuyes. E lo socio desea mejorar su granja e implementar algunas aves también. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunas aves de corral y mejorar su granja.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Our partner belongs to the "SR. DE TANTAMARCA" communal bank; this bank is in the Chicon district of the Urubamba provincia and the Cuzco administrative district.  His name is Andres; he is 42 years old, married and has 4 children.  He buys and sells small animals.  He has a little farm on his land and raises small animals for sale.  He has ducks, hens, roosters, pigs, and guinea pigs.  He'd like to improve his farm and add some birds as well.  He is requesting this loan to buy some poultry and make improvements to his farm.  He appreciates and values the loan recieved through this channel and, at the same time, commits to making his repayments according to the established timeline.

loans.use: To buy poultry and make farm improvements

loans.name: Las Amigas De Tlanepantla Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama "Las amigas de Tlanepantla", esta ubicado en la comunidad de Tlalnepantla, en el estado de Morelos, México. Esta conformado por 6 integrantes que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Felipa C. R. va a comprar con su prestamo mercancía aguacate, manzana, durazno, guayaba, mísero, para surtir su negocio, la señora Anabel Z. C. va a comprar abono químico para fertilizar su nopal y tener producción, la señora Alberta Aragón N. va a  comprar abono químico para fertilizar su producción y aumentar su producción, Martha Graciela Martínez M. va a comprar medicina para aplicarlo al nopal y pueda producir mas, La señora Benita V. V. va a comprar aguacate por caja y compra de medicamento para las plantas, fumigar y produzcan mas, la señora Gudelia Chávez G. va a reparar moto sierras, darle mantenimiento, cambio de cadena, bujías, aceite, gasolina etc. La señora Martha Graciela Martínez M. es integrante del grupo las amigas de Tlane. Ella Tiene 40 años de edad estudio hasta el 3er. Año de secundaria obteniendo su certificado, ella tiene 7 hijos Sandy Paulina tiene 21 años estudia el 1er. Semestre en Lic. De educación física, Roberto tiene 20 años estudia el 5º. Semestre de Lic. En economía, Brian tiene 18 años de edad estudia el 1er. Semestre de licenciado en economía, Brandon tiene 14 años de edad estudia el 3er. Año de la secundaria, Guadalupe tiene 12 años de edad estudia el 3er. Año de secundaria, Hugo tiene 6 años estudia el 2º. Año de primaria y Argelia tiene 5 años esta en el Jardín de niños. Ella solicito su préstamo para comprar productos nopales, aguacates, durazno, limón chirimoya, tomates, guayaba y esta muy emocionada con este préstamo es el primero que solicita. Ella tiene su negocio de comercio venta de nopales, aguacates, duraznos, chirimoya, tomate, guayaba  y también siembra el nopal, La señora Martha es casada su esposo trabaja 3 días ala semana como chofer de ruta de combi y los otro cuatro días trabaja en el sembradío de nopal, deshierba, azadonar, a despencar. Ella inicio su negocio del comercio hace 10 años por necesidad como los niños fueron creciendo y la escuela, fue creciendo la necesidad económica y los niños si son buenos estudiantes, también cultiva el nopal este negocio es bueno pero termina la temporada son 5 meses los buenos después bajan los precios. Su negocio esta en el mercado de Xochimilco viaja 1 hora en transporte de la ruta, ella se va a surtir en Tétela del Volcán el durazno y el aguacate y en la Central de Abastos Cuautla. Su negocio es importante por que es una fuente de ingresos, otra alternativa para entrar recursos, también conoce a la gente que le compra sus productos frescos del campo a su casa, a ella le da gran satisfacción que el nopal ellos lo cultivan y que sus hijos también participan y están mas unidos los sábados y domingos también van a trabajar, sus hijos le ayudan a cortar el limón el aguacate y la guayaba, se siente orgullosa porque de ahí compraron las 2 computadoras 1 para los pequeños de la primaria y la otra para los de la prepa que ahora ya están en la universidad. Sus clientes son bastantes la buscan porque les lleva nopales preparados en escabeche que están muy sabrosos porque los prepara con mucho amor, atiende como a 60 clientes por día. Su negocio es popular por el sabor de los nopales en escabeche. Los desafíos que enfrenta es el clima cuando granizo el nopal se hecho a perder se tiro todo, su negocio enfrenta la competencia que en el mercado de Xochimilco hay mas vendedoras que venden los mismo productos, las ganancias las va distribuyendo va ahorrando, para los trasportes de sus hijos a la escuela, para su vestido y zapatos, ella quiere ampliar el negocio de las ganancias ir apartando un poco para ampliarlo meter mas productos, lechuga, papalo, cilantro, sus sueños y esperanzas son ver a sus hijos unos triunfadores para que no sufran de andar en el campo las mejoras que desea para sus hijos son que terminen su carrera y encuentren trabajo y este préstamo va ayudar porque compro los fertilizantes para la siembra del nopal Hidracum para la mancha el nopal. A ella le gusta Tlalnepantla porque es bonito, tranquilo, por sus cerros y su historia se comenta que por estos cerros hay un ojo de agua cubierta con una tapa donde venia Pancho Villa y tomaban agua ellos y sus animales. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “darles las gracias y el día de mañana presentarles a mis hijos ya hechos unos licenciados y que no le vamos a quedar mal y pedirles sigan apoyando a la gente que se acerque a tocar su puerta. Y le pido mucho a dios que esto siga adelante para que haya mas gente que se beneficie con los créditos porque si son necesarias las ayudas”.
texts.en:
This tight-knit group, “Las Amigas de Tlanepantla” (The Friends of  Tlanepantla), is located in the community of  Tlanepantla, in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  It includes six members, who know each other and are neighbors: Felipa C. R. plans to use her loan to buy merchandise, including avocados, apples, peaches, guava, and loquat fruit to stock her store; Anabel Z. C. will buy chemical fertilizer for her nopal [prickly pear] to get it to grow; Alberta Aragón Noriea will buy chemicals to fertilize her crops and increase production; Martha Graciela Martínez M. will buy products to make her nopal grow better; Benita V. will buy boxes of avocados, and spray to increase the plants' production; and Gudelia Chávez G. will repair her chainsaw by changing the chain, spark plugs, oil, gas, etc. 

Martha Graciela Martínez M. is a member of the group.  She is forty-years-old and completed the third year of secondary school to get her certificate.  She has seven children: Sandy Paulina, twenty-one,  is in her first semester of a degree program in physical education; Roberto, twenty, is in his fifth year of a degree program in economics; Brian, eighteen, is in his first semester of a degree program in economics; Brandon, fourteen, is in his third year of secondary school; Guadalupe, twelve, is in her third year of secondary school;  Hugo, six, is in his second year of elementary school; and Argelia, five, is in kindergarten.

The loan Martha is seeking is to buy produce, including nopal, avocados, peaches, lemons, custard apples, tomatoes, and guava.  She is very excited about this loan because it's the first one she has requested.  She's in business selling nopal, avocados, peaches, custard apples, tomatoes, and guava, and she also grows the nopal.  Martha is married; her husband works three days a week as a van driver, and the other four days growing nopal, weeding, hoeing, and spreading seeds.

Martha started her business ten years ago out of necessity.  Between the kids growing and their education, there was a growing financial need.  Plus, the kids sure are good students.  Martha also grows nopal.  It's a good business, but the season is ending, and after five good months, prices are dropping.  She sells in the  Xochimilco market, traveling an hour to get there.  She stocks up on peaches and avocados at the Abastos Cuautla Central Market in Tétela del Volcán.  Her business is important because it's a source of income, another means of support. In addition, she knows the people who come to her house from the country to buy her fresh produce.  She gets great satisfaction with the nopal she and her children grow; they participate, too, and everyone works together Saturdays and Sundays.  Her children help her cut lemons, avocados, and guava. She feels very proud that she has been able to buy two computers: one for the little ones in grade school, and one for the high schoolers who have now gone to college.  

Martha has plenty of customers; they seek her out because she's got pickled nopals that are delicious because she makes them with so much love.  She gets about sixty customers per day.  Her business is popular for the tastiness of the pickled nopal.  The challenge is that in the Xochimilco market there are other vendors selling the same products.  She spends her profits on transporting her kids to school, and for their clothing and shoes.  She would like to expand her business.  She's saving a bit of the profits to add some new products like lettuce, papalo herb, and cilantro.  Her hopes and dreams include seeing her children win out so they don't suffer and wind up in the countryside.  The goal is for them to finish their studies and find work.  This loan will  help because she bought fertilizer for her nopal seed, and bacteriacide to fight spots on the nopal.

Martha likes Tlalnepantla because it's beautiful and serene, and also for its hills and history.  She says that Pancho Villa came and drank with his animals from an underground spring that runs through the hills.  Regarding Kiva and Fundación Realidad she says, “Thank them, and tomorrow introduce my children who have their degrees already, so we don't come across poorly.  Ask them to keep supporting all the people who come knocking at their door.  And I'm really asking God to keep this going, so that more people can benefit from loans because the help is really needed.”

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for their nopal so they can produce more.

loans.name: Alba Nidia

texts.es: Alba Nidia tiene 3 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente. Esta no es la primera vez que realizaba financiamientos con Fundación. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esto les ayudo como un ingreso adicional en su familia, poco a poco ella invirtió sus ahorros en arroz, pan, sopas y vitrinas para hacer más grande la tienda. Fue incrementando su capital y comprando más productos. El dinero que solicita será destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Pues todos los días busca la forma de darse apoyo para mejorar más.
texts.en: Alba Nidia has 3 children who all work. This is not the first loan which she has had with Fundación León.  Her business is running a small grocery store.  She has been in this business for 14 years.  It has helped her family by providing an additional income.  Little by little she has invested her savings in rice, bread, soup and display cases to make make her store bigger.  She has increased her capital and bought more products.  The money she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy supplies.  Every day she looks for ways in which to support herself in order to improve.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Leila Maria

texts.es:
Doña Leila es una mujer de 52 años de edad.  Ella vive con su esposor y tiene dos hijos ambos son mayores de edad.  Su hija vive en la parte trasera de la casa con su esposo y sus hijos . Doña Leila  es una mujer ,muy trabajadora, responsable, honrada,con grandes metas para el futuro. Es el primer crédito que solicita desde que se dedica al comercio .     
Ella empezo a vender desde hace 20 años con un capital de 5,000.00 colones, los cuales fuerón prestados por su esposo y e con ese dinero compro 5 docenas de calcetas por motivo de que su esposo trabaja en construcción y se habia quedado sin trabajo y la solicitante tomo la decisión de ponerse a vender para seguir adelante y sacar su familia.
La clienta  solicita crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderia como ropa,zapatos,perfumes, medias,y todo lo que pueda vender, Ella dice que es una actividad muy rentable ya que su clientela es fija y es desde hace 20 años. Este crédito servira para cubrir las necesidades por el mes de dicembre ya que es un mes bueno y se requiere bastante demanda 
Doña Leila dice que su meta es ver el negocio ya establecido en su casa y poner un bazar en varios sectores de coronada ya que por ese sitio casi no hay tiendas ni bazares
texts.en:
Ms. Leila is a 52-year old woman.  She lives with her husband, and has two grown children.  Her daughter lives in the rear portion of the house, with her husband and children.  Ms. Leila is a very hard-working, responsible, and honorable woman, with great goals for the future.  This is the first loan that she has requested since she dedicated herself to commerce.

She started in sales about 20 years ago, with working capital of 5,000 colones borrowed by her husband, with which she bought 5-dozen pairs of socks.  Her reason for doing this was that her husband worked in construction and had become unemployed; therefore she made the decision to go into sales in order to help the family get ahead.  

The client requests credit to invest into merchandise such as clothing, shoes, perfumes, socks, and everything she might be able to sell.  She states that it is a very profitable business because the customer base is solid, and has been for 20 years.  The loan will help her cover her needs for the month of December, as it is a good month with a lot of demand.  Ms. Leila says that her goal is to open several branches of her business in various sectors of Coronada, since in this area there are no stores or bazaars.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 27-year-old married lady who is blessed with one child.  She has been selling clothes for a living for seven years.  Most of her customers are people in her local area.  In addition, she farms in order to earn extra income.  

Ann is hardworking and hopes to become a successful business-lady in the future.  She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her to save her money.  

She has requested for 35, 000 Kes to buy shirts and blouses.

loans.use: To buy shirts and blouses

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en:
Jeanne is 37 years old and is married.  She sells a variety of goods in her general store.  These include items used in daily life, such as body lotion, sugar, soap, biscuits, etc. She has been running this small store for one year.

Jeanne has requested a loan to purchase foodstuffs, such as rice, sugar, Irish potatoes and beans for her shop.  Jeanne would like to use the profit to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, Irish potatoes and beans

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo R. Z.  tiene 33 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Juan Pablo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y un carro.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo R. Z. is 33 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He has 2 children.

The members of the SAN JACINTO community bank are located in Campo Alegre precinct, in Guare parish, in Baba canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.  They have been in this business for many years.

Juan Pablo is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa shopping areas and sells his products in the López shopping area.

He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a plot of land and a car.

Juan Pablo likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Glenda Yadira

texts.es:
Glenda Yadira A. C., tiene 31 años, es soltera vive con los padres y los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Glenda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa.

Le gusta mirar la televisión.
texts.en:
Glenda Yadira A. C. is 31 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and children in the Ventanas canton in Los Rios province. She has two children.

The members of Valle Alto Communal Bank live in the precincts of Voluntad de Dios, within the Ventanas canton. This communal bank’s members work in short cycle agricultural work, planting corn and rice.

Glenda works in agriculture, planting corn and rice. She buys and sells her products at the Peña market in Ventanas. She sells from home or at the Ventanas market every day.

Glenda is applying for this loan in order to plant corn: to buy input materials and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to provide for her needs. She faces challenges like pest infestations, illnesses and climate variation. Her dream is to buy a home.

She likes to watch television.

loans.use: Purchase of input materials and seeds

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys N. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Gladys has a business selling cold drinks, which she has run for three years. Gladys also has a second business selling clothes.
To help expand her business, Gladys has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase drinks and clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Gladys hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own a salon.
Gladys is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her the opportunity to learn to sing and dance.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and clothes for resale

loans.name: Christ Roi Plus Group

texts.en:
Evelyne is the president of the community bank “Christ Roi Plus”, which is composed of 16 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Evelyne sells soft drinks. She started her business in 1994 selling palm oil. With the profit generated and good management, she increased her working capital and extended her business by adding beverages and purified water. Evelyne decided to join one of Hope DRC’s groups in order to achieve her dream of building a facility for storing soft drinks. 

After joining the Christ Roi Plus group, Evelyne started selling mineral water which generates $82 of profit per week. The monthly income generated from her business and the six different loans she received from Hope have helped her to build up her working capital. Evelyne intends to use the next loan to increase her inventory by buying mineral water and some crates of beverages to resell at a profit. She is 42 years old and the mother of seven children whose ages are between 6 and 25 years old.

loans.use: to buy mineral water and beverages

loans.name: William Klever

texts.es:
William de 26 años, empezó a vender cilindros de gas desde muy joven ya que nunca le gusto depender de un empleador para ganar dinero. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido surtir su negocio con otras ventas como agua en botellones. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando vendiendo cilindros de gas y botellones de agua a las personas que viven por su sector. Trabaja desde muy temprano en su negocio. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro por eso quiere ahora comprar con el préstamo cilindros de gas y botellones de agua para ganar mas dinero.
texts.en:
William, 26, started selling gas cylinders when he was very young since he never liked to depend on an employer to earn money.  Gradually with much effort and dedication he’s managed to stock his business with other things to sell, like large bottles of water.

He has a lot of hopes for his business and wants to continue selling gas cylinders and bottles of water to people who live around his neighborhood.  He starts work very early.  He has many hopes for the future so wants to use the loan to buy gas cylinders and bottles of water to earn more money.

loans.use: Gas cilinders and large bottles of water.

loans.name: Rolando Patricio

texts.es:
Rolando Patricio C. G. tiene 35 años,  es soltero vive con el padre y la madre Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Rolando Patricio  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de corral. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir la casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Rolando Patricio C. G. is 35 years old.  He is single and lives with his mother and father in the Bolivar province.  He has no children.  

The members of V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO live nearby in the town of el Calzado, Cantón San Miguel; these 12 farmers grow corn, potatoes, beans and raise domestic animals.

Jorge makes his living from agriculture and grows corn, potatoes, beans and has farm animals as well. He buys products in the market of San Miguel each week and brings his products for sale on Thursdays in the same market.

Jorge requests a loan in order to buy crop seed and feed for farm animals. This loan will help him economically to meet expenses, and to confront difficulties such as insects, disease and climate unpredictability. He hopes to be able to build his house.

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase crop seeds and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Jazmin Belgica

texts.es:
Jazmín de 22 años, una joven emprendedora que inicio trabajando como empleada en una boutique en el centro de la ciudad, después su padre mediante un préstamo que hizo abrió una pequeña tienda que poco a poco fue creciendo.

En la actualidad trabaja diariamente desde las 6:00 am hasta la noche en la tienda de sus padres. Lo que le afecta en su negocio es la delincuencia ya que es muy frecuente por su sector y la policía muy poca veces pasa haciendo operativos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, confitería para mejorar la productividad de su tienda. En un futuro lo que más desea es terminar de construir su casa, poner una papelería y ver a su hijo terminar en sus estudios
texts.en:
Jazmín is 22 years old, an enterprising young woman who started working as an employee in a boutique downtown, until her father received a loan that enabled him to open a small shop that has been slowly growing.

She currently works every day in her parents' shop, starting at 6 a.m. The biggest problem for the business is the amount of crime in the neighborhood, since the police don't patrol very often. She intends to use this loan to purchase rice, sugar, and snacks to increase sales in the store. Her greatest wish for the future is to one day build a house, set up a stationery shop, and see her son complete his studies.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, and snacks for her shop.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander V. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 27 years old. Alexander is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, he provides motorela or habal-habal services (motorcycle transportation) to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Alexander joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools and supplies needed to provide his service. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies needed to provide his service

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward N. is 33 years old, married and the father of two. His wife, Pola, is a business lady.
 
Edward runs a retail shop in Mariakani and he gets additional income from his motorcycle transport business. Edward has been in this business for the last three years.

This marks his first loan from KADET Ltd., and he plans to add more stock of sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and  wheat flour and to buy a dust board for his motorcycle. 

The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of the loan. Edward’s dream is to become a successful entrepreneur

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and wheat flour and to buy a dust board for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Xiomara is the coordinator of Con Dios Adelante (With God in the Lead) 1, 2 & 3, a group made up of fifteen micro-entrepreneurs. This group is located in the city of  La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugar cane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. San Pedro de Macoris in one of the rural villages surrounding the main city. 

Xiomara lives with her long-term partner and three children, and operates a miscellaneous sales business by selling cosmetics, shoes, clothes, and other items. She will use her loan to purchase many items to increase her business’ inventory. She is excited to received her 4th loan with Esperanza and her group, as with each loan she has been able to improve her business, making it possible for her to provide for her family’s needs and introduce different products to her children.  She says that her most difficult challenge is to continue improving her business and to provide change for her family. She enjoys working and cooking for her family.  She thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, accessories, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 53, is married and has seven children. Two are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts, gasoline and engine oil.

 In the future, Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts, gasoline and engine oil.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz is a 45 years old, married and has three children. For the last eight years, he has made a living by running a butcher shop where he provides local markets with meat and his family with food. He is applying for a loan for 1,200 AZN, an amount we believe is justified by the profitability of his business and his experience in this line of work. This is his busy season, and he wants to increase his supplies to take advantage of it to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one has graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity nor piped water.

For the past four years, Fatuma has operated a vegetable stall business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. Fatuma dreams of expanding her business and selling wholesale in the future. She plans on using this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of vegetables for sale. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Shahlokhon

texts.en:
Shahlokhon runs her own business selling fabrics to be sewn into traditional women's dresses in the central city market. There are few other businesses selling similar items in the market where Shahlokhon has her kiosk. Because of this, customer demand continues to grow all the time. Shahlokhon has established a reputation as an entrepreneur with integrity. 

Shahlokhon is requesting a loan for 5000 TJS to re-stock her inventory before the fall season. Compelling prices, along with a wide range of fashion and fabric choices to suit every taste and lifestyle, will attract many new female clients to her business. An increase in sales will help her generate more profit and expand her trade even more.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase fabric to sell

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se organizó gracias a que una de las miembros del grupo, contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el grupo en dicha zona. Ellas se consideran mujeres sencillas, responsables, honestas y muy luchadoras. Actualmente el grupo cuenta con 24 integrantes, todas ellas están en el segundo ciclo dentro del Programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Todas trabajan en un ambiente de cooperación y respeto.
La Señora Jazmery es casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de utensilios de plásticos. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido generar un poco más de ingresos y así poder paliar los gastos que surgen dentro de la casa. Ella está contenta con lo que hace pues es un trabajo muy honesto y digno. Se define como una mujer muy innovadora y con mucha capacidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los utensilios de plásticos que vende, para que de esa forma pueda tener siempre bien surtido su stock de mercaderías
texts.en:
The current committee was organized thanks to one of the group members. She contacted her neighbours and friends to form a group in this zone. They are unassuming, responsible, honest and very hard-working women. There are currently 24 members in the group, all of whom are in the second cycle with the Fundacion.

Mrs. Jazmery is married, has two children, and lives in her own home. She sells plastic utensils. Thanks to this work she has been able to generate a little more income and thus cover some of her household's costs. She is happy with what she is doing, as it is a very honest work. She describes herself as a very innovative woman, with a great deal of ability.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of the plastic utensils that she sells. This way, she will always be well-stocked.

loans.use: compra de utensilios de plásticos para la posterior venta

loans.name: Gabi

texts.es: Gabi tiene 19 años, es una joven  madre de familia que tiene todos los deseos de trabajar, vive al lado de su esposo y su hijo en casa que heredaron. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de animales menores, dicho animales que ella misma cría en su granja, asimismo compra otros tantos para tener mayor capital de trabajo. Dichos animales son transportados a la feria ganadera que le permite  tener mayores ganancias. Su esposo la ayuda en toda esta tarea de trabajo y siempre esta al pendiente en mejorar su negocio, que durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy rentable. Ahora con las ganancias adquiridas tuvo la oportunidad de ahorrar y con ello mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Para el futuro su deseo es aumentar su capital de trabajo, que es el de comprar más animales. Decidió trabajar con MFP por medio de una invitación personal que recibió  con un folleto informativo, se entero de las condiciones de crédito y vio que era muy conveniente para el desarrollo de su negocio. En esta ocasión el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de más animales y aprovechar esta temporada del año donde tiene más ventas.
texts.en:
Gabi, 19, is a young mother who very much wants to work.  She lives with her husband and her son in a house they inherited.  She’s been raising small farm animals for the last four years.  She raises said animals in her own farm and she also buys others in order to have more working capital.  The animals are then taken to the local livestock markets in order to generate higher profits.  Her husband helps her with every phase of work and she is always watchful to improve the business which has been quite profitable all this time.

Now, with profits earned she was able to set aside some savings that she wants to use to do some home improvements.  She decided to work with MFP thanks to a personal invitation she got in an information pamphlet.  She leaned about the credit possibilities and she saw that it would be very conducive to her business’ development.  On this occasion, the money will be used to buy more animals taking advantage of this season of the year when her sales are higher.

loans.use: to buy sheep and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Necefora

texts.en:
Necefora, a 50-year-old married mother of five children, one of whom is attending school, has been farming corn and sugarcane in the Philippines for 28 years now. Having borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business, she has requested a new loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Necefora would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 33 years old and is the owner of sari-sari (variety) store. She has had this business for four years and earns about P2,800 a month. Aside from this home-based store, she is also engaged in a direct selling business in which she sells cosmetic products, shoes, blouses and lotions.  She is a married woman with two school-aged childrenl. According to Marissa, she utilizes her profit for their daily needs and school supplies for her children.

Marissa would like to ask for a loan amounting to P25,000, which will be used to buy groceries such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, snack foods and ingredients for her retail shop business.  With her determination in life, she believes that she can fulfill her dream by continuing to actively maintain her business for a longer period of time.  In this regard, she will be able to put up a stall for her direct selling business and give her children a good quality of life.

loans.use: buy groceries items

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has four children.

Fares has been an owner of a shop since 1998, where he repairs electric mixers and household appliances. He has more than 15 years experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting $600 to rebuild and fix his shop’s ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits to expand his work and to hire some workers so that he can provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To rebuild and fix his shop’s ceiling.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia  is a farmer in Nkubu, Western Kenya. She is a widow with three children aged 16, 11 and 6 and all schooling. She has been in mixed farming for the last 10 years and her produce of bananas and milk goes to the local market. She gets additional income from her employment as a caretaker.

Anastasia has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming. She says this will help her improve her income and the living standard of her children since the returns in poultry are faster. She says she will use part of the income to buy better breeds of cows for better returns.

 She laments poor markets for the produce but reiterates that Juhudi Kilimo loans have made a turn-around in many farmers' lives. She had previously acquired 30,000 KES and 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, cabbage, and tomatoes for making her dishes and trinkets to sell.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es: Luisa Emilia de 49 años labora como docente en una secundaria impartiendo el pan de la enseñanza en la especialidad de Español, desde hace 28 años, ella recibe el apoyo económico de sus dos hijas que también labora como docente para solventar juntos los gastos del hogar; Luisa solicita su crédito el que invertirá en reparación de su vivienda ya que algunas paredes se le estan deteriorando y desea repararlas para darle a su casa mayor seguridad. Se caracteriza por ser una persona con gran expeciencia y capacidad, honesta y trabajadora, querida por sus estudiantes y compañeros de trabajo. Sueña con seguir apoyando a su familia para que estos salgan adelante,  y quiere heredarles una casa con buena infraestructura.
texts.en:
Luisa Emilia is 49 years old and works as a teacher in a high school.  She gives Spanish classes and has been in this job for 28 years.  She receives financial support from her two daughters, who also work as teachers, to cover the household expenses.

Luisa is requesting her ninth loan which she will invest in repairing her home as some of her walls are in a bad state of repair and she would like to fix them up in order to make her home safer.  Luisa is noted as being a woman with a lot of experience and skill.  She is honest and hard working, and well liked by her students and work colleagues.  She dreams of continuing to support her family so that they can get ahead in life.  She would like to leave them a house with good infrastructure.

loans.use: to repair the walls in her home.

loans.name: Irene Elmilia

texts.es:
Irene pertenece al banco comunal “San José de Urubamba” de la ciudad de Urubamba. Las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Irene vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Irene es la venta de pasto al por mayor. Ella reparte sus productos a diferentes clientes de distintas ciudades como por ejemplo Cusco, Calca, Pisaq y otras. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Irene requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como pasto y otra parte lo invertirá en el negocio de su esposo que consiste en la venta de materiales de construcción. 

Irene agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Irene belongs to the San José de Urubamba communal bank in the city of Urubamba.  The members of the bank meet every month in the city of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

Irene lives in the city of Urubamba, where she works.  Irene's principal job is selling grass wholesale.  She distributes her products to different customers in different cities, such as, for example, Cusco, Calca, Pisaq, and others.  She has been doing this work for several years and it's going very well for her, thanks to her dedication to her work.

Irene needs the loan now to buy more merchandise such as grass, and she will invest another part of it in her husband's business selling construction materials.

Irene is grateful for and values the loan, and she is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as grass and construction materials

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir is 33, married with two sons. He has six years of experience in cattle breeding. He usually buys small calves, fattens them and sells for meat purposes in next 5-6 months.  His monthly income is 300 AZN.  Meat is in very high demand in Azerbiajan, and people here use meat in everyday cuisine. Nadir applied for 1300 AZN to purchase four calves and fodder. This will be his 2nd loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase three cattle and fodder

loans.name: Doung

texts.en:
Mrs. Doung is a diligent and responsible housewife who lives in the Baray district of Kompong Cham province. She cultivates rice during the rainy season and also raises hogs. She typically earns a profit of $4.00 per day from her hog-raising business. She’s very hardworking in order to support her children’s education. She wants them to finish high school.

Doung is taking out this loan to repair her plowing machine because it’s necessary for her farming business this year. In the future, she intends to open a small grocery store in the neighborhood to start serving meals, drinks and some types of Khmer traditional liquor (fermented sugar palm juice).

loans.use: to repair her plowing machine.

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.en:
Aquilino started to manage his rice field in 1984.  He is 53 years old, is married, and has four children. He plants and harvests rice for sale. His wife is engaged in a hog-raising business for additional income. They work hard to give their children a good quality of life. 

Aquilino would like to expand his rice plantation but he has inadequate capital. Therefore, he is asking for a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides and pay labor costs required to plant rice. He believes that this loan will help him improve the business and he hopes that he will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: buy rice seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor costs

loans.name: Twibumbirehamwe Rgrgr Group

texts.fr:
Marie  fait partie du groupe Twibumbirehamwe/Rgrgr. Elle a 30 ans et elle est mariée avec 5 enfants de 2 à 13 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Marie est cultivatrice de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Marie voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie, age 30, is a member of Twibumbirehamwe/Rgrgr Group. She has five children, age 2 to 13. Out of them, two attend school. Her own level of education amounts to six years of elementary school.

Marie is a rice cultivator. She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, ACB. She will use it to buy chemical fertilizers.

Her strategy for growing her business is to expand her rice cultivation area. In the forthcoming years, she would like to be the rice provider in his region.

She intends to use her profits to educate her children and send them to school.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son, age 35, is living with her husband and a lovely child in Kompong Cham province. She has built a wooden piggery where she raises pigs in her yard. It’s big enough for 5-7 piglets.
