She raises pigs for slaughter, earning  approximately $1.50 per day. After she finishes harvesting her rice crop, she intends to spend most of her time  dealing with her pig raising project. 

Son is asking for some funds from HKL to purchase a few additional piglets and feed to fatten her pigs. She hopes that she’ll be able to make this micro business run successfully and make it profitable soon.

loans.use: to purchase a few additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Santa Lucia  sus integrantes decidieron ponerle  así por que les parece un nombre bonito y lleno de vida como todas ellas.
Este grupo esta  conformado por  once integrantes todos trabajadores y con deseos de  hacer mas grandes sus negocios  y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
La representante de el grupo es la profesora Odilia una persona amable trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de leche, calabaza  y quesos .
Ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es  exprimir la cuajada y salir a vender sus quesos  en  las calles de su comunidad.
Esta felizmente  casada con el señor Carmelo de  de cincuenta y dos años de edad ,con quien tiene  dos hijos una mujer Andrea y un hombre Jonás quienes la ayudan a ordeñar y a moler la cuajada para la elaboración de quesos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar mas picheles y aros para quesos  y bandejas para echar la leche.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Berenice- quien se dedica a la venta de  perfumes.
Andrés- quien se dedica  a la venta de servicio para banquetes.
María Reina- quien se dedica a la venta de  quesos
Cenobia- quien se dedica a la venta de ganado.
Gregoria- quien se dedica a la venta de  materias primas.
Remedios- quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Jorgina- quien se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Xochil- quien se dedica a la venta  de costura.
Martha Felisia- quien se dedica a la venta de abarrotes
Eduardo- quien se dedica a la venta de chiles y semillas
Le dan las gracias a fundación por darles  la oportunidad de crecer  como personas y como comerciantes  ya que son personas pobres con deseos de superarse.
texts.en:
This group is called Santa Lucia. Its members decided to call it such because to them it seems like a beautiful name and full of life like them. It is made up of eleven members who are all hardworking, desire to grow their businesses, and have a better quality of life.

The representative of the group is Odilia, a nice, hardworking person who makes a living selling milk, pumpkin, and cheeses. She tells us that what she likes most about her business is squeezing the curd and going out to sell her cheeses in the streets of her community. She is happily married to Carmelo who's fifty-two years old and with whom she has two children: Andrea, a woman, and Jonás, a man. They help her milk and mash the curd to make cheese. She requested the loan to buy more jugs and hoops for cheese and trays to put milk.

The other members of the group are:

Berenice - who makes a living selling perfumes.
Andrés - who makes a living selling banquet services.
María Reina - who makes a living selling cheeses.
Cenobia - who makes a living selling livestock.
Gregoria - who makes a living selling ingredients.
Remedios - who makes a living selling bread.
Jorgina - who makes a living selling Mexican appetizers.
Xochil - who makes a living selling sewing services.
Martha Felisia - who makes a living selling groceries.
Eduardo - who makes a living chilies and seeds.


They give thanks to the foundation for giving them the opportunity to grow as people and as merchants since they are poor people with a desire to better themselves.

loans.use: to buy jugs and hoops for making cheeses.

loans.name: Honorato

texts.es: Honorato, de 46 años de edad, por problemas familiares vive separado de su pareja y esta al cuidado de sus 05 queridos hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia en el distrito de kimbiri. Honorato cumple con ser padre y madre dentro de su cesta familiar. Desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, es campesino y cuenta con un terreno con plantaciones de Piña.  Honorato viene trabajando 23 años en sus propias tierras, En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de los jornaleros para avanzar con mayor rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. El crédito solicitado es para poder comprar más semillas de las plantas de piña y poder renovarlos por las plantas de café; por que los frutos de la piña le generan mayor ingreso y en menor tiempo. Este será su crédito número 03 con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará  más semillas de piña para poder incrementar en su chacra.
texts.en: Honorato, who is 46 years old, lives separate from his partner because of family problems.  He is caring for his 5 beloved children.  They live together in his own home in the Kimbiri district.  Honorato fulfills the role of father and mother due to his family's circumstances.  Since he was very young, his parents instilled in him how to work on the small farm.  He is a country-person and depends on a plot of land with pineapple plantations.  Honorato has been working for 23 years on his own land.  During the harvest times he counts on the support of his children and day laborers to make progress more quickly with the extraction of the fruits.  What he likes the most about his job is harvesting the fruits from the plants, since he feels that the challenging months provide him with compensation for the quality of his fruits.  He considers that the most difficult part is transporting his products from the small farm to the city of San Franscisco, the place where they give him the best prices for his products.  He is asking for the loan to be able to buy more pineapple plant seeds and to be able to exchange them for the coffee plants, because the pineapple fruits generate a better income and in less time.  This will be his 3rd loan with MFP.  He knows that if he pays it on time, he will be able to obtain another loan with greater ease, and he will not bring complications to his communal bank.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy more pineapple seeds in order to improve his farm.

loans.use: buy more pineapple seeds.

loans.name: Edwin Oswaldo

texts.es: Edwin de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al transporte de carga desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar y  por los precios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su camión para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento

loans.name: Anelia

texts.en: Anelia K. is 43 years old and keeps a coffee and refreshments shop in one of the biggest factories producing carpets in Sliven. First this factory was property of the state and  so was the shop. Anelia has worked as a manager of this shop for more than 15 years. Eight years ago the factory was sold to private owners and they had no interest to the shop so Anelia got the option to rent it and to work for herself. Then she started her business. The staff of the factory is about 600 workers and all of them are customers to the shop. Anelia is divorced and has three children. Her elder daughter who is 17 years old helps her with the business. Because of this shop Anelia is able to look after her three children. The loan she applies for she will use to buy a sweets show case – icecreams, cakes, creams. The loan amount is $ 1000.

loans.use: To buy a sweets show case

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace A. is 52 years old. She started her food and kitchen equipment business 4 years ago. She joined LAPO two years after she started her business with her little savings. She lives in a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She is eager to receive a loan of $800 for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and kitchen equipment

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.en:
Maria has worked very hard to raise four children on her own--two sons ages 20 and 23 and two daughters 13 and 27. Two years ago, with the help of her sister, Maria opened her own shop selling groceries and stationery. Her oldest daughter now helps with the shop as well. The shop has given her the resources to support her children's education. At this time she is asking for a loan of $475 to buy merchandise. She promises to repay the loan in 6-12 months. You can help this family to improve it's quality of life and the children to finish their education. They will be forever grateful.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria es madre de cuatro hijos, dos hombre de 20 y 23 años de edad y dos mujeres de 13 y 27 años, nunca contó con el apoyo de su pareja para el sustento de sus hijos por lo que ha trabajado mucho para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola. Con ayuda de su hermana, Maria inició hace dos años su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes y papelería, donde ahora también recibe la ayuda de su hija mayor. Esta tienda le ha permitido a Maria obtener los ingresos para que sus hijos puedan continuar estudiando.

En estos momentos solicita un crédito por $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo con su negocio, Maria se compromete a regresar este préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses. Gracias a tu ayuda mejorará la calida de vida de esta familia y lograrán consumar sus estudios, ellos te lo agradecerán por siempre.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ángel Ramón

texts.es:
Ángel Ramón S. is married and the father of two beautiful little girls, one now 12 years old and the other 8. Both girls study in a local public school and both are dedicated, responsible and excellent students. Ángel's wife is a housewife and the primary caretaker of their daughters.

Mr. S. got his start in the business 27 years ago, working in a well known suspension repair shop in the city of Caaguazú, where he learned the profession. He is now a successful mechanic and the owner of his own shop.

Ángel has his own shop with a well developed clientele, thanks to the efficiency, speed and quality of his work. Due to the volume of work his clients are requesting, he would like to buy parts currently on offer in his city and is applying for a loan of $575.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ángel Ramón S., es casado y padre de dos hermosas niñas, una tiene 12 años y otra 8; ambas están estudiando en una escuela pública de la ciudad y son excelentes alumnas, muy responsables y dedicadas. Su esposa es ama de casa y es la principal educadora de sus hijas.

Don Ángel S. se inicio en esta actividad hace 27 años siendo empleado de una elastiquería (taller mecánico cuya especialidad son los elásticos de los autos y camionetas)muy renombrada en la ciudad de Caaguazú donde aprendió su profesión actual, hoy día es un exitoso mecánico de elásticos dueño ya de su propio taller.

Ángel cuenta con un local propio con una clientela bien formada por la eficiencia, rapidez y calidad del trabajo con que realiza. Debido a la gran cantidad de trabajo que tiene, el desea comprar más elásticos que en este momento están de oferta en la ciudad, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 575.

loans.use: Buy auto parts currently on offer in his city to use in his auto suspension business

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim is a low-income person from Baku district. He is married, has two daughters, and is 35. He started his car repair business 10 years ago. He is professional and uses his knowledge to give a high-level service to clients and earn sufficient money to meet his family's basic needs. He is asking to borrow $1,200 to be able to buy spare parts and earn more income to improve his living.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Juanita Bello

texts.en:
Juanita is a very likeable, charming, and intelligent person.  She’s got a terrific sense of humor.  Her constantly smiling face makes her look younger than her 46 years.  She has ten children.  The two eldest live in Santo Domingo, the capital. Her husband is a self-employed radio technician.

Juana runs a ‘ventorillo’ ( a small business stand) that she opened six months ago with a loan she took from our organization.  That business has been very successful, and she makes a daily profit of about USD 15.00.

Now, Juana is thinking about making additional money.  She needs funds to purchase more inventory and in this way increase sales.  She would use part of the loan to buy clothes that she’ll sell from home, with the help of one of her daughters.  In this way, she hopes to expand and diversify her business so that she can take good care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and clothing for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary A. is 40 yrs old, is married and has five children. She is a designer who sews clothes for sale. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan to enable her buy more materials to make clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making Clothes for sale.

loans.name: Marco A.

texts.es:
Marco lives on Ismael Montes Street in the Pasankeri zone of the city of LaPaz with his parents. He works manufacturing bricks along with his brother, who is the one that has the oven. Due to the rains which collapsed his wall, he lost his tools. The loan that he requests is to buy tools so that he can continue his business. Marco does not have a credit history, as this is his first loan with Impro, but from his work record he qualifies to obtain a loan.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Marco vive en la calle Ismael Montes de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz con sus padres; se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos trabaja juntamente con su hermano que es el que tiene el horno. Debido a las lluvias se derrumbo su pared y perdió sus herramientas; el crédito que solicita es para comprar herramientas y continuar con su actividad.

No tiene historial es su primer crédito con Impro, pero por su actividad califica para obtener un crédito.

loans.use: to buy tools for his brick business.

loans.name: George

texts.en: K. George is a 62 year-old businessman. He is married and has 11 children and 4 grand-children. George is the owner of Katebo New Life Club and Lodge in Katebo trading center. At the Club, he sells beer, soda, and Ugandan local food to the locals and fishermen who appreciate it especially after a hard day’s work. In addition, George offers accommodation to those fishermen that have late-night fishing shifts. The Club and the Lodge are located right next to his house. Currently, George needs a loan to help him renovate the premises in order to attract even tourists. Specifically, he plans to use the loan money to buy wall paints and new furniture.

loans.use: Purchase of wall paints, beddings, and chairs for a club

loans.name: Quarcho

texts.en:
Quarcho is 27 years old and a single woman. Quarcho owns a small food vendor store which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som S. is 24 years old and has lived with her children and her husband in Kampong Cham province for many years. She is a housewife who stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. She makes no income for the family.

Her husband, Suon Sorka, who covers all the daily expenses for the family, works as motorbike dealer. On average, he earns about $8 a day of income from his work. He has only one little child. Beside being a broker, he also knows how to cut hair, so he wants to make an extra income by opening a small stand and purchasing some equipment to cut hair. With the remainder of the loan, he will buy a motorbike to sell.

loans.use: To open a haircutting stand and to purchase a motorbike for resale

loans.name: Fior Daliza

texts.en:
Fior Daliza started down the path as an entrepreneur ten years ago, when she began selling clothing in the Don Gregorio community of San Cristobal. Currently, Fior Daliza has amassed a healthy clientele, which keeps growing and growing. Fior is a well-educated woman, and she is studying French and English at the public university of Santo Domingo, the capital. In her opinion, she believes that a good education is the only thing that can help her rise up out from poverty and improve her living conditions.

Fior Daliza has already taken out four loans from our organizations, and she has used them wisely. With this fifth loan, the entrepreneur would like to buy clothing in bulk in order to replenish her stock and to increase her sales volume. Fior Daliza plans on buying a house within a couple of months.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing in bulk to add to her business' stock of clothes.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en:
Moa H. is 40 years old, and has worked selling charcoal and fire wood in Siem Reap since 1995. She makes $1 a day. (Mrs. Moa is pictured.)

Her husband is employed by a tourist company to look after the temple. His job is to check the tickets of the tourists who visit the temple area. Two of their oldest children sell souvenirs in front of the temple and make $3 per day.

This couple would like a loan from Kiva to purchase wood to repair the leaky roof, which makes living very difficult in the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair the leaky roof

loans.name: Hout

texts.en: Hout S. is a young marble carver; his father is a motorcycle taxi driver. They both live in Banteaydey Krom Village, Pursat Province. S. has been carving for five years and he makes around $5 per day. To grow his business, he needs a loan to purchase more marble to carve. The loan will allow him to expand his marble business and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more marble to carve

loans.name: Llina Asteria

texts.es:
Llina is 40 years old and the mother of 2 children, who are her motivation to get ahead and prosper. She wants to make her children into professionals that she can be proud of. At present, Llina sells carbonated drinks retail, which permits her to live without anxiety, but she would like to see her business become larger in the future. In this her husband Humberto always supports her. She also sells beauty products from the catalog of a well-known line of cosmetics.

To keep her children moving ahead, to support her husband with some expenses, and to get ahead is Mrs. Llina's byword. She is requesting the current loan in order to set up her business and even become a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Llina tiene 40 años de edad, es mamá de 2 hijos, que son su razón para seguir adelante y prosperar en todo, ella desea convertir a sus hijos en profesionales y así sentirse orgullosa Actualmente Llina se dedica la venta de bebidas gaseosas al por menor, lo que le permite vivir tranquilamente, pero quiere ver en el futuro a su negocio convertido en algo más grande. Es por eso que su esposo Humberto siempre la apoya en todo. Adicionalmente, también vende productos de belleza por catálogo de una línea cosmética muy conocida.

Sacar adelante a sus hijos, apoyar a su esposo con algunos gastos y salir adelante es el lema de la señora Llina. Solicita el presente préstamo para implementar su negocio y llegar incluso a ser distribuidora.

loans.use: Capital increase for expansion and improvement of her business

loans.name: Angel De  Jesus

texts.es:
Ángel is married and has a one-year-old son. He started his own business as a result of being laid off from his previous job. He decided to start a business that would bring in better earnings for him while at the same time allow him to spend more time with his family since his schedule at his previous job never permitted him to spend much time with them. In shoe sales, he found what he was after, so now he sells shoes for a living.

He is requesting a loan of $500.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase merchandise and thus be able to fill his customers’ orders.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángel es casado y tiene un pequeño hijo de 1 año. Empezó con el negocio a raíz de que lo desocuparon del trabajo, es por ello que decidió dedicarse a una actividad que le redituar mejores ingresos y que le permitiera pasar mas tiempo con su familia, ya que por los horarios de su anterior trabajo no pasaba mucho tiempo con ellos. En la venta de zapatos encontró lo que buscaba y se dedica a esto.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder cumplir con unos pedidos que tiene que entregar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (footwear)

loans.name: Philo

texts.en: Philo A. lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Philo buys dried fish and garri from the village market and travels to the city to sell it. Dried fish is used in the preparation of Nigerian soups like Egusi, Banga,  and Okro. She is 29 years old and is married with three children. Philo is trying to make her life meaningful by working hard. She requests a loan of $700 to buy more dried fish and garri for sale.  She thanks all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish and garri for sale

loans.name: Thin

texts.en:
Mr. Thin S. is a villager in Tuol Daoung Kaing village in Kandal province.  He owns a 0.5-hectare field for cultivating rice in order to earn for living.  

On this plantation, he now cannot do any planting because he does not have enough money for rice seeds.  In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds to cultivate.  He will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers and fuel to support his field.  

His wife, Mrs. Sun Cheang, is a grocer in the local market.  Mr. Thin S. is 34 years old and the father of two children who are both attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel to support his field.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her customer base by purchasing new/fashionable clothes in bulk

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Mrs. Than R., 32, raises pigs and lives in Batrumdoul Village in the Pursat Province. She is married to Mr. Seng Ol, who is rice farmer. They both work hard everyday and live with their two children, who are young and in school. To increase the size of their farmland for rice growing, Mrs. R. is requesting a loan to purchase a plot of farmland.

loans.use: Purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Ayubjon

texts.en:
Ayubjon S. is 42 years old. He is married with two children. Ayubjon is an energetic man who loves agriculture, which he has done passionately for 10 years. He lives in Isfara, a semi-urban area about 110 kilometers away from the center of Sugd region – Khujand city. With this, his first loan from KIVA, he hopes to grow more crops and have a better overall yield. In so doing, he will contribute to the betterment of his family's living conditions. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Eltan

texts.es: La familia de Eltan esta compuesta por cuatro integrantes: su concubina, sus dos hijos de siete y tres años respectivamente y él.  Eltan se dedica al transporte de pasajeros con su propia moto taxi, en su domicilio cuentan con una tienda de barrio donde venden todo tipo de abarrotes. La competencia para Eltan es media ya que existen muchos con las mismas actividades pero paralelamente la demanda también es muy elevada. El crédito será destinado como capital de trabajo en su negocio de abarrotes. Esta es la cuarta operación de Eltan y en todo el tiempo de la relación somercial demostró ser un excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Eltan's family consists of four members: his partner, his two sons of seven and three years respectively, and him. Eltan works transporting passengers with his own motorcycle taxi. In his home he has a neighborhood store where all kinds of groceries are sold. Eltan's competition is medium, since there exist many others doing the same activities, but at the same time demand is very high. The loan will be used for working capital in his grocery business. This is Eltan's fourth loan and during all the time of his commercial relationship he has proved to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Maria es soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Maria es feriante, viaja  dos veces por semana en donD. compra quesos, cereales y luego lo comercializa en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Maria tiene un carro que realiza transporte a L. ciudad D. Sachabamba.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. neumáticos para su carro.
Los sueños D. Maria es comprar otro carro moderno.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Llapanchik Communal Bank, which means "Everyone united in Quecha." Maria is single, 23 years old and has one child. She is a "feriante." She travels two times a week to buy cheeses and grains and later sells them in markets in the city of Ayacucho. Maria also has a car that she uses to go to the city of Sachabamba. Maria needs a loan of $625 to invest in tires for her car. Maria's dream is to buy another, more modern car.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires for her car.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane J. sells bags of maize in Abura. She is also a seamstress. Jane has received a senior high education. She is a single parent with one child. 

Jane has been selling bags of maize since 2007. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to buy bags of maize to meet the increase in demand by her customers and also use part to purchase more sewing materials like thread, needles and others to enhance her work. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and sewing materials, fabrics, needles and others for her sewing work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: renovating her pub

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 31-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region. He is engaged to be married. Ahmad has been working as a car repairman for two years. He has requested a loan of $1,500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his garage. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad considers himself speciA. in his business because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He began his business because he wanted to improve his financiA. situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his garage.

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta is 32 years old, married, and the mother of five children.

Henrietta sells baby clothes, cream and cosmetics and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N120,000 to purchase more baby clothes, cream and cosmetics to sell. Henrietta says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby clothes, cream and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Oeur

texts.en:
Oeur M. is a 46-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. In addition, she currently sells fresh fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fisherman. She runs her business in the market and is earning approximately of $2 a day. Her husband is a local fisherman. The humble couple has three children who are no longer in school and are working with their businesses.

This approaching fishing season, the lakes are full of fish but the family is lacking tools to fish with. Therefore, Oeur M. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase additional fishing equipment in order to support his business activities.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 56 years old. She manages a furniture making business in the village of San Isidro Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Rogelio, her partner in making furniture. The couple was blessed with five children. Two are already married, while three of them are still attending school, college and in high school. Veronica and her husband are joining their hands in making their business become progressive and part of their initiative is to generate financial support. Thus, Veronica is borrowing loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 8,000 to be able to buy some of their needed furniture equipment. They still need capital to buy wood, the most important material in making furniture. Veronica hopes that lenders will entrust her with the assistance she is seeking.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, and sodas

loans.name: Lidia Elcira

texts.es:
La señora LIDIA ELCIRA C. C.    tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el distrito de LAREDO  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios en la Universidad, la carrera de Administración, tiene 2 hijos los cuales depende económicamente de ella.
Lidia  se dedica a la venta de tallarines, papa con miga, menús en su domicilio (Alimentos). Empezó con este negocio hace 2 años con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, debido a que se divorciò de su esposo, quien no le pasaba la pensión para sus hijos.
 Con su primer crédito de 300 soles compro mesas y sillas para su negocio.
 Con este crédito de 200 nuevos soles lo utilizarà para comprar insumos: aderezos, papa, fideos, arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc para la preparación de sus menús y platos fríos que vende por las tardes.
Lidia  tiene como sueño implementar su local y que también funcione como bar para que pueda vender cerveza y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Lidia Elcira C. C. is 49 years old, lives in the district of Laredo, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, in Peru.

The entrepreuneur studied administration at university. She has two children who are economically dependent on her.

Lida sells tallarines (pasta dishes), potatoes, and daily menus at her home. She started with this business two years ago with the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos. She divorced her husband who did not help pay for their children.

With her first loan of 300 soles she bought tables and seats for her business.

With this loan of 200 soles she want to buy raw materials: seasonings, potatoes, noodles, rice, sugar, oil, etc for the preparation of her lunches menus and the cold dishes that she sells in the afternoon.

Lidia also dreams of having her restaurant double as a bar where she could sell beer and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw goods like seasonings, potatoes, noodles, rice, sugar, oil, etc for the preparation of her food

loans.name: Tuong

texts.en: Tưởng Thị Trần was born in 1981. ( no: 010117130023). She lives in Xom Trong, Uy No, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and two young children. Her husband is a worker in Song Hong Beer Factory. First child is 7 years old. Second child is three years old. She sells clothes in the market. Her family has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 vnd. This time, she wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND ( or 250 USD) to expand her clothes shop.

loans.use: to expand her clothes shop.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Mrs. Nan V., a resident of An Doung Samreth Village in Takeo Province, is a Khmer noodle seller while her husband, Mr. Ouch Thorn, owns a piece of land upon which he cultivates rice. He currently needs some money to buy fertilizer and a pump machine to support his cultivation of the field, so Mrs. Nan V. is requesting a loan for this purpose. She is 44 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is enrolled in the local school and the youngest is yet too young to study. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a pump machine to support the cultivation of her husband's field.

loans.name: Yesenia Maria

texts.es: La Joven Yesenia A. R., tiene la edad de 27 años, habita en el barrio las dispersas, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como jardinero en una residencial Campos Azules, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene un hijo de dos años de edad , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , doña Yessenia desde hace 15 años se dedica a la actividad agrícolas , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio con el apoyo de su mamá ya que sus padres han sobresalido en su vida por las siembras , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo, con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de químicos como: fertilizantes, venenos para aplicar al cultivo y poder tener una mejor producción para vender  a mejor precio en el mercado. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible las mejoras a sus siembra como en lo personal.
texts.en:
Yesenia A. R. is 27 years old. She is a young woman who lives in the neighborhood of Las Dispersas, which is located in the town of Ticuantepe. Her husband works as a gardener in the residential district of Campos Azules. They both contribute toward the household expenses and support their two year old son. Their plans include improving their living conditions.

Doña Yessenia has been farming for 15 years. Her greatest challenge has been a lack of financing. She began farming with the help of her mother since both of her parents made their living by planting and harvesting crops. She hopes to diversify her own crops in the future.

With this loan, she plans to buy chemicals, such as fertilizers and herbicides, which she will apply to her crops so that she can improve her production and command better prices at the market. She thanks the Institution for enabling her to make improvements in both her livelihood and her personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & herbicides to improve her crops

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Julia es casada, tiene 49 años y 1 hijo, Julia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende diferentes productos como artículos de escritorio, libros, artículos de mercería, juguetes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo. Además Julia los días domingos vende ropa en las ferias.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de juguetes.
Los sueños de Julia son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su negocio y tener un local propio.

loans.use: Para la compra de juguetes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan J. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase firewood and yeasts for brewing.  Susan is 30 years old and married to a soldier. She has six children, who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar and purchase crates of beer to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase firewood and yeast for brewing

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha F.'s main source of income comes from selling used bags and clothing locally known as "ukay-ukay" in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has two adult children. She is from the village of Colonia, Valencia City. Editha has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Editha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en: Hanna owns and operates a grocery store and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. In addition to that, she also sells onions, spices and peppers on a tabletop. She is 40 years old and a wife with two children. Her husband is a trader. With her hard work, all her children are in school. She considers this a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en:
Idowu is 34 years old and is married with two children. She helps her husband to support the family.

Idowu sells phone rechargeable cards and pure water and has been in the business for the past four years. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

With this loan of 170,000 NGN Idowu plans to increase and restock her rechargeable phone cards and water due to an increase in demand. With this business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for her children's education.

Most of the challenges Idowu faces in her business are that the electricity supply is inconsistent, and that she needs it to cool her water. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more phone recharge cards and pure water to sell

loans.name: Ana Raymunda

texts.es: Ana Raymunda S. de 37 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad. Ella cuenta con un negocio en el cual vende fruta pelada, la cual la prepara con chile, limón y sal. Ana desea poder mejorar su negocio y vender otros productos como ropa, es por ello que solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el capital necesario para invertir en la compra y venta de ropa. Ana vela por el bienestar de sus hijos es por esto que desea poder hacer cosas nuevas las cuales le brinden un beneficio extra a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Raymunda S. is 37 years old, and lives in the Tonacatepeque department of San Salvador. She lives with her three young children. She owns a business where she sells peeled fruit, which she prepares with chili powder, lemon and salt. Ana wishes to be able to improve her business and sell other products like clothing, and this is why she is requesting a loan with which she can have the necessary capital to invest in the purchase and sale of clothing. Ana looks over the welfare of her children and this is why she wishes to do new things which can bring an extra benefit for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing

loans.name: Kebiri A Kadara Anite Group

texts.en:
K. Anite is forty-two years of age, is married with five children schooling, and is looking after ten dependents of whom three are going to school.

Anite has a used-clothes business and she has been operating this business for over fifteen years. She is using the loan to purchase a stock of used clothes to sell.

Anite’s business is expanding at a high rate and she is much willing to pay school fees for her children. Her future hope is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Antonio Isidro

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de Chinandega, el señor Antonio S. se dedica  a la actividad ganadera por medio de la crianza de vacas las que alimenta a diario y después de la crianza procede a la extracción de leche para la venta.
Es un varón muy dedicado a su actividad ganadera y siempre está pendiente del mejoramiento de su familia porque ha llevado el sustento a su casa de habitación. 
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de vacas paridas para continuar con la crianza y aprovechar la extracción de la leche para su respectiva comercialización.
texts.en:
In the town of El Viejo de Chinandega, Sr. Antonio S. raises livestock. He feeds his cows every day so that they can produce milk for him to sell. Antonio is very dedicated to his animals since he is always dependent on them to maintain his household and improve his family’s condition.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy young milk cows to raise so that he can improve his milk production and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cows

loans.name: Sandra Candelaria

texts.es:
Sandra R. P. tiene 37 años y habita en el barrio Galán de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Está separada con un hijo de 15 años y ahora vive con su familia en casa, donde venden almuerzos y bebidas refrescantes, un negocio familiar, Solicita un crédito de $2.000.000 para comprar bebidas, refrescos e insumos de productos alimenticios que elabora en épocas especiales como la de Carnaval, cuando las familias de su barrio organizan una fiesta en la calle y se divierten sanamente.
Iniciaron el negocio vendiendo plátanos y verduras en la puerta de un supermercado y vendió el lugar porque se iniciò la pavimentación que  afectaron sus ventas; por eso se fue para el mercado de Barranquilla donde incursionó el negocio de vender almuerzos económicos, como papas rellenas y arroz de payaso, arroz envuelto en una hoja con carne, pollo, huevo y verduras. Como ahora están reestructurando el mercado, cambió otra vez para adicionarse al negocio familiar en un sitio estable, la casa paterna donde venden almuerzos, refrescos y todo relacionado con la comida frita.
Aparte de su negocio de venta de comestibles, Sandra estudió manejo de máquinas planas gestionado ante el Sena por la Fundación Santo Domingo que la llevó a  un nivel avanzado; igualmente hizo un curso de emprendimiento, con el que se diò cuenta que resulta muy costoso comprar la maquinas planas e implementar toda la estructura para montar un negocio, por eso no tiene  su propia confección. Sueña con que algún día pueda tener la plática que le permita comprar toda la maquinaria para crear su propia microempresa de ropa, por eso trabaja fuertemente, pero con mucha alegria y dinamismo.
texts.en:
Sandra R. P., age 37, lives in the Galán neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. She is separated and has a 15 year old son. She now lives at home with her family, where they sell lunches and cold drinks. It is a family business. She is asking for a loan for 2,000,000 COP to buy drinks, refreshments, and supplies for food that she makes during special times like Carnaval. This is when neighborhood families organize a party in the street and have fun safely. They started the business selling bananas and vegetables in the entrance of a supermarket. She sold the place because they started paving that affected their sales. She then went to the market in Barranquilla where she established her business of selling economical lunches liked stuffed potatoes, rice with chicken or dried fish, rice wrapped in a leaf with meat, chicken, egg, and vegetables. As they are now restructuring the market, she moved again in order to set up the family business in a stable place. They sell lunches, refreshments, and everything having to do with fried food from her father’s house. Besides her business of selling food, Sandra learned how to use industrial sewing machines in training given by Sena (National Service for Learning). The Santo Domingo Foundation arranged for her to take the course, and she achieved a higher level of efficiency on the machines. She also took a business course, and she realized that it would be very expensive to buy the industrial sewing machines and set up all of the structure to launch a business. That is why she does not have her own seamstress shop. She dreams of one day being able to have the money that will allow her to buy the machinery to create her own clothing business. That is why she works hard, but also happily and dynamically.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy drinks, refreshments. and supplies to make food for special times

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La Sra Clara vive por la zona de los lotes hace 2 años juntos con sus 2 hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad,  llego a nuestra institucion recomendada por su sobrina Yaneth, La Sra Clara se hace cargo sola de sus hijos los cuales ya trabajan, Ella cuenta con 2 vagonetas  a su nombre las cuales las hace trabajar y recibe una renta diaria de 100 bs por cada vehiculo con lo cual mantiene su hogar . La Sra Clara y sus hijos estan trabajando y ahorrando para poder comprarse una casa propia ya que el alquiler es dinero perdido. El dinero que en este momento requiere es para reparar una de sus vagonetas que se encuentra en el Taller mecanico.

Esta agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Clara has been living in the Los Lotes area on the outskirts of Santa Cruz for 2 years, along with her children who are 17 and 19. She heard about the Field Partner through her niece Yaneth, Clara cares for her children by herself, though both are working already. She owns two small station wagons, which she rents out as taxis. She receives a daily payment of 100 bolivianos for each vehicle, and she uses this money to cover her household expenses. Clara and her children are working and saving to buy their own house because their rent money is money lost to them. The money that Clara needs at the moment is to fix one of her wagons which is in a repair shop at the moment. Clara gives her thanks to Emprender [the Field Partner] and Kiva for the trust they have shown in her by giving her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Simiona Martha

texts.en:
Simiona Martha is a member of the “Unidos para el Triunfo” (United for Triumph) community bank. She is a 39-year-old mother of two and lives in the Santiago district of Cuzco with her spouse and their children, ages 14 and one year. Simiona Martha owns a small grocery that she runs out of her mother’s house. Here she sells foodstuffs such as cookies, drinks, rice, and pasta. She also sells fireworks. She has been operating this business for over 13 years. 

Simiona Martha is asking for a Kiva loan for business capital so that she can maintain and increase the revenue from her store. Simiona Martha is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Business capital for store

loans.name: Julia Erminia

texts.es: Julia Erminia tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar de manera independiente. Ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, por lo que su actividad económica es el destace de cerdo y una pulpería, por lo que hace más de 3 años que decidió establecer un pequeño establecimiento en donde ofrece una variedad de productos, así sus clientes acuden mucho a su vivienda, pues su mayor desafío es mantener sus 2 negocio, pues para ella son muy importantes ya que con ellos sufraga los ingresos de su familia. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Julia Erminia is 57 year old hardworking woman. She has always liked to work independently and has one dependent child. She works as a pork butcher and in a grocery store where three years ago she decided to establish a small shop where she offers a variety of home products to her customers. Her biggest challenge is to maintain both jobs as they are important to sustain the income for her family. Therefore, this funding request for the purchase of raw materials. Her desire is to provide improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Emelia's Group

texts.en:
Emelia A. is from the city of Calaocan Santiago. She is 46 years old. Emelia is the group leader of a 14-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Emelia A. Group'.

Emelia is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Emelia owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from catching and selling fresh-water fish at the market. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelia is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Emelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Née en 1973, A. Pauline est mariée à ASSOGBA Germain, un coiffeur. Pauline est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Mais deux autres enfants sont en plus à sa charge. Pauline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Sèkandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis huit ans environs. Pauline vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui, les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui apporte son activité. Pauline a fréquenté l’école et s’est arrêté au cours secondaire. Il y a près de cinq ans que Pauline s’est mise à vendre des ustensiles de cuisine (Plats, bols en séries, gobelets, glacières, cuillères, fourchettes, casseroles en séries, bassines, etc.) à Sèkandji. Pauline achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Pauline sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Pauline A. is married to Germain Assogba, a hairstylist. Pauline is the mother of three children, some of whom are in school. But she has two additional children in her care. Pauline has lived together with her husband and children in the Sèkandji area, in the Sèmè-Podji commune, for about eight years. She helps her husband and, with him, takes care of the various family expenses, thanks to the income provided by her business. Pauline attended school and stopped at the secondary level. About five years ago, she started selling kitchen utensils (plates, bowl sets, cups, iceboxes, spoons, forks, pans, basins, etc.) in Sèkandji. She buys her goods in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. This is the first time Pauline is seeking financial assistance through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), with the goal of strengthening her business and increasing her stock of merchandise.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils (plates, bowls, spoon sets, etc.)

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia D. C., 35, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Reigerick D. C., a sewage worker, and they are blessed with a child in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have better lives. She has been managing her own tailoring shop for quite some time now.

Delia has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her tailoring shop.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 8,000-Philippine-peso loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by allowing her to buy raw materials needed to continue operations of the shop, like fabrics, thread, accessories, etc.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buying raw materials needed to continue operations of the shop, like fabrics, thread, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. She has been farming for the last 30 years and has employed one farm-hand. Her main products are maize, sweet potatoes, beans, and groundnuts which she sells locally.

Mary is 52 years old. She is a widowed mother of 4 children between the ages of 8 and 30. Two of the children attend school. Apart from farming, she also operates a retail shop and sells ready-made clothes at the local market. Her primary challenge has been lack of capital to expand her farming activities.

She recently completed her first loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of KES.70,000 to purchase a 'posho' mill (used for grinding maize into flour). The proceeds from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children who are in school.

She appreciates the loan she has been given and is planning to apply for other loans in future to improve her financial status.

loans.use: To purchase a posho (cornmeal) mill

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 51 años y 5 hijos que son su razón D. vivir, desD. sus años escolares le gustaba tejer bolsos D. diferentes colores a sus compañeras les gustaba asi que pensó en venderlos. En ese tiempo obtuvo buenas ganancias. Pero, para mejorar sus tejidos se compro catálogos que le permitían hacer diferentes modelos. Ahora tiene una tienda D. bolsos a macramé en casa. Flor tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, bebidas y golosinas en su casa hace 5 años. El objetivo D. Flor es establecerse en un local y vender como mayorista y así obtener mayores ganancias, para L. manutención D. su familia.
Rosalinda es una mujer muy trabajadora venD. comidas al paso, además tiene una pequeña bodega en casa donD. venD. diferentes productos, a elL. le gustaría ampliar su negocio, para poder invertir en otros productos. Los socios son responsables y puntuales en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 51 and has 5 children who are her reason for living. Since her school years, she has enjoyed weaving different-coloured purses for her friends, and since they liked them she decided to sell them. At that time she maD. good earnings; however, in order to improve her products she bought catalogs which allowed her to make different designs. She now has a macrame purse store in her home. Flor has a store where she has sold groceries, drinks and candies in her home for 5 years. Her goal is to establish herself in a store and sell wholesale, thus obtaining better income for the maintenance of her family. Rosalind is a very hard-working woman who sells food. She also has a small store in her home where she sells different products. She would like to expand her business, in order to invest in other products. The members are responsible and punctual in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of products

loans.name: Verónica Yolanda

texts.es:
Verónica Yolanda Q. T. tiene 25 anos. Es casada y vive en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos que se llaman Carmen y Anita. 

Verónica es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Verónica se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra arroz, maíz, y cacao. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

Solicita esta préstamo para su agricultura, que con el apoyo de esta préstamo espera mejorar y seguir adelante. Su sueno es comprar una casa para su familia y un terreno propio. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maíz, uno en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨  

Le gusta trabajar y cuando tiene tiempo libre, juega con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Verónica Yolanda Q. T. is 25 years old. She is married, and she lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. She has two children, Carmen and Anita. Verónica is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. Verónica is a farmer, and she plants rice, corn, and cacao. She makes her purchases and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is requesting this loan for farming. With the support from this loan she hope to improve and get ahead. Her dream is to buy a house for her family and to buy her own piece of land. One of the challenges she faces in her work is the pest infestation of her corn. Specifically, one of them is called “longosta” (locust). She likes working, and when she has free time she plays with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina C. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 42 years old. Fermina is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Fermina owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fermina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fermina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fermina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Fermina is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Fermina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen Q. is a housewife and the mother of one daughter. Her husband, Sami, started a new business three years ago when he rented a small shop and started a barber shop for men. The shop is doing well and attracts a good number of clients.

Haneen's husband, who appear in the photo in his shop, is a nice man known for his good manners and his sense of humor. After three years in business, he wants to start fixing up his shop to make it look better. Therefore, Haneen took a $2,000 loan to help him perform the changes.

loans.use: To enable her husband to fix up his barbershop

loans.name: Arshaan's Group

texts.en:
Arshaan lives with her family in Vehari, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan. She is a housewife and stays at home. She is a very cooperative wife and a great mother who does both her responsibilities well. 

Her husband's name is M. I. and he is involved in a vegetable-selling business. He operates a small shop in the nearby market where he offers fresh vegetables to his customers. He gets up early in the morning to visit the vegetable wholesale market and buys vegetables to sell in his shop. 

Arshaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to help her husband in his business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy fresh vegetables in bulk which will cut his costs as a result of bulk purchasing and also allow him to offer different kinds of vegetables to his customer and increase his sales and income. 

Arshaan is very hopeful about her family’s bright future. She is sure that her husband’s business will improve and her family’s living standard will become better in the near future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria Julia es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, vive en la zona D. villa Fátima que se encuentra a unos 25 minutos del centro D. la cuidad. Es madre D. tres hijos quienes ya son mayores D. edad y trabajan D. manera independiente. Ella tiene un kiosco en la calle Colombia cerca del centro D. la cuidad donD. venD. golosinas, dulces, y refrescos, además también prepara unas barras D. maní crocante con azúcar. Estas barras D. maní crocante son muy deliciosas y por eso la Sra. Maria julia es muy conocida ya que también realiza la venta por mayor D. las mismas. Con el dinero del crédito comprara maní por cantidad, dulces para surtir su kiosco. La Sra. Maria Julia es cliente antigua D. emprender, comenzó el año 2005 con un préstamo D. 100 dólares en el grupo solidario "avanti". Actualmente trabaja como préstamo individual. Ella es una persona muy puntual y alegre.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Julia is a very responsible and hardworking person. She lives in the community of Villa Fátima, located about 25 minutes from the city center. She is the mother of three grown children who support themselves independently.

She has a stand in Colombia Street near the city center where she sells snacks, sweets, and soft drinks. In addition, she also makes some peanut brittle bars with sugar. These peanut brittle bars are very delicious, and Sra. Maria is very well known since she also sells them wholesale.

With the money from the loan she will buy peanuts in bulk and sweets for stocking her stand. Sra. Maria Julia is an old client of Emprender. She began in 2005 with a loan of $100 in the Avanti support group. Currently, she is working with an individual loan. She is a very punctual and cheerful person.

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts, sugar, and sweets.

loans.name: Eudoxia

texts.es:
Eudoxia es socia del Bancomunal Solición, tiene 56 años, es madre soltera de una hija de 20 años, la cual se esta preparando para poder ingresar en la universidad, Eudoxia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (detergente, aceite, fideos, harina, jabón de ropa y de cara, leche, huevo, galletas caramelos, etc) este negocio lo realiza en un local que es alquilado en el barrio de Belén, su negocio lo tiene desde hace 20 años, también se dedica la venta de granos(haba, maíz, trigo, cebada, fréjol, etc.) el que reparte a las vendedoras de cereales y lo deja al crédito para 5 a 10 días.
El préstamo que solicita lo va ha emplear en la compra de granos (maíz, cebada y trigo).
Su sueño es poder trasladar su tienda a su casa propia que queda en el barrio de Santa para ello lo esta haciendo construir.
texts.en:
Eudoxia is a member of the Solution community bank.  She is 56 years old and the single mother of a 20 year old daughter, who is preparing to enroll in university.  

Eudoxia works selling groceries (detergent, oil, pasta, flour, soap, milk, eggs, biscuits, sweets, etc).  Her business is located in a rented store in the Belén neighborhood.  She has had this business for twenty years.  She also works selling grains (beans, corn, wheat, barley, pigeon peas, etc).  She acts as a dealer to grain sellers and gives them credit for 5 to 10 days.

She is asking for this loan to purchase grains like corn, barley, and wheat.

Her dream is to move her store to her own home in the Santa neighborhood that she is building.

loans.use: Purchase grains like corn, barley, and wheat

loans.name: Mercedes Olimpia

texts.es: Mercedes Olimpia G. C. de 55 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Soyapango, junto a su esposo. Ella posee su propio negocio el cual es una venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual la comercializa en el mercado de San Martín, cada día Mercedes coloca la ropa en su automóviles  y se dirige al mercado en donde vende las prendas de vestir con sus diferentes clientes, así mismo este lugar es muy concurrido por personas, lo cual la beneficia en gran manera. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de ropa en diferentes estilos, colores y tallas, lo cual le permita obtener mayor cantidad de clientes y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mercedes Olimpia G. C., age 55, resides in the town of Soyapango with her husband. She has her own business selling clothing for men, women, and children at the market in San Martín. Each day, Mercedes loads her inventory into her car and brings it to the market where she sells clothes to different customers. At the market she has become well-known among the people, which is a great benefit.

Mercedes is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy a large quantity of clothes in different styles, colors, and sizes. This will enable her to attract more customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Miriam Nicolasa

texts.es:
Miriam de 46 años de edad es soltera, labora para el MINED-Acoyapa desde hace 14 años como docente de primaria. Habita en su casita junto a sus 5 nietos a los cuales cuida mientras los papas trabajan fuera.  

Esta solicitando  su 7mo credito con el objetivo de terminar de cercar su propiedad con malla y poder instalar el servicio de agua potable en su casa, pues actualmente no cuenta con el. 

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y que sus nietos estudien y sean personas de bien que saquen adelante a nuestro pais.
texts.en:
Miriam, 46, is single and has worked as an Elementary School Teacher for the Ministry of Education-Acoyapa for 14 years.  She lives in her little house with her five grandchildren who she cares for while their parents work elsewhere.

She is requesting her 7th loan to finish fencing in her property with wire mesh and to be able to install potable water service to her house; she currently does not have it.

Her greatest wish is to provide her family with better living conditions and that her grandchildren go to school and become upstanding citizens who will help our country get ahead.

loans.use: To fence in the property and install electricty and running water.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 31 years old and married. He owns a printing service located in Kimironko, a suburb of Kigali. His business is open from 7am until 4pm every day and he has one years' experience.
Gilbert has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more paper, ink for printers, files, etc. and more internet broadband access. His dream is to buy more computers for his growing business.

loans.use: To purchase more paper, ink and internet access

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née le 23 Décembre 1979 à Bamako (capitale du Mali), Mariam B. est mariée et mère 5 enfants. Elle réside dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Mariam B. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et vente  des pagnes Wax,  de chaussures, de  Tissus brodés, de concentrée de tomate il y a environ cinq ans. Elle mène son activité à son domicile et de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant cinq ans avec laquelle elle a bénéficié  5 prêts solidaires dans un association des femmes de son quartier (Association DANAYA de Wayerma I). Tous ses prêts solidaires ont été tous correctement remboursés ce qui lui a valu un premier prêt individuel  qui fut également bien remboursé. 
Ainsi, elle sollicite ce deuxième  prêt individuel  pour acheter à Lomé (république du Togo) 25 paires de chaussures différentes, 10 pièces de pagnes Wax, 4 complets de tissus brodés et 10 complets de napperon. Ses marchandises sont vendues en détail de façon ambulante au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mariam B. was born on December 23 1979 in Bamako (capital of Mali). She is married and the mother of five children. She lives in a nuclear family with her spouse, in Wayerma I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

After having unsuccessfully pursued various activities, five years ago Mrs. Mariam B. learned the business of purchasing and selling Wax pagnes [colorful traditional wrap around fabric], shoes, embroidered fabric and tomato concentrate. She is conducting her business form her home and door-to-door in the town of Sikasso. Her customers hold her in very high demand because of the quality of her products. Five years ago she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwasso in order to meet her ever-increasing customers’ demand. She has already received five group loans with a woman’s association from her neighborhood (Wayerma I Danaya Association). All her group loans have been fully reimbursed which got her a first individual loan that was also fully reimbursed.

She is requesting a second individual loan to buy 25 pairs of shoes, 10 pieces of Wax pagnes, 4 suits of embroidered fabric and 10 sets of doilies. Her merchandise will be sold retail door to door for cash and on credit to customers who are mostly women.

With this loan she is planning on making a monthly profit of 130,000 Francs CFA. It will be mostly used to increase her working capital, cover the family’s expenses and pay her loan.

loans.use: To purchase Wax pagnes, shoes, embroidered fabric and doilies.

loans.name: Clara Jaqueline

texts.es:
Clara Jaqueline P. A. tiene 35 años, Es casada vive con  el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Clara Jaqueline se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta realizar quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Clara Jaqueline P. A. is 35 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 4 children.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito precinct, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Clara Jaqueline is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She buys her products in the García and López shopping areas and sells her products in the Vaca shopping area.  She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.

The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

Clara Jaqueline enjoys doing her household chores.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael  N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda.  She is not married and has no children.   Rachael has a business of selling fruits and vegetables, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rachael hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Rachael hopes to own animals.        Rachael is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to play netball.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: La Cumbre Group

texts.es: Doña Maria C. P.. D. 32 Años, es la presidenta, tiene 5 Hijos, 2 D. sus Hijos van a la escuela, ella se dedica especialmente al comercio compra y venta D. consumo diario en la plaza D. Pologua Momostenango, el grupo son Tres integrantes  una  D. ellas se dedica a la venta D. refacion: arroz en leche y Chocolate. Necesitan ampliar sus producción D. animales y también la venta D. consumo diario, por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas D. la asociación ASDIR D. pologuá, para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y D. sus familias. Este grupo D. señoras, son personas que se conocen muy bien, desD. hace 10 años han trabajado siempre juntas, en el cual lo integran D. la siguiente manera.
texts.en: The group has three members, including Doña María C. P., who is 32, is the president. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are in school. Her business is buying and selling food in the Pologua Momostenango plaza. Another member sells snacks: rice pudding and chocolate. They need to increase their animals' production as well as their food sales, so they came to the ASDIR Association offices in Pologuá for financing for their businesses, so they can improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. This group of ladies know each other well, having worked together for the last 10 years, and will continue to do so.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
