Because of his good repayment performance with his previous loans, he has been able to borrow nine times in CCT’s Cooperative, using the money he borrows to expand and improve his business.


To ensure the continued success of his business, he is now requesting a PHP 18,000 loan to be used as a source of added capital for his expanding business. Bizard will buy raw materials needed for his upholstery business. He dreams that his business will continue to grow so that he can provide an education for his children. He dreams of being able to attain financial security, a debt-free life.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying raw materials for upholstery buiness.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying produce to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita B. is from the village of Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 45 years old. Angelita is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Angelita owns & operates a business buying  & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Angelita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Angelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Hosanna Jabneel

texts.es: Hosanna es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, tiene un hijo pequeño de dos años y vive sola con el ya que desde hace un tiempo vive separada de su esposo. Ella se preocupa por el bienestar de ella y de su bebe, es por eso que esta solicitando este crédito, por que quiere colocar una barda en la parte del frente de la vivienda, para  ofrecerle a su hijo un patrimonio seguro. Y también para sentirse ella misma mas tranquila cuando esta sola con su hijo.
texts.en:
Hosanna is a very enterprising and hard-working woman. She lives alone with her small two year old son. She has been separated from her husband for some time. She worries about her well-being and that of her baby. That is why she is requesting this loan. She wants to place a wall in the front part of her house. She wants to do this to give her son a secure inheritance. She also wants to feel that she is not worried when she is alone with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall

loans.name: Precious Women Group

texts.en:
Oldlady Y. who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Precious Women'. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children who range from 4 to 15 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school. 

For 8 years, she has been selling red oil, 'fufu' ( a local food produced from cassava) and fish in Marshall City, Margibi County, Liberia.

She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 60,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more gallons of red oil, more 'fufu' and fish. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

Her goal is to improve her business, build a house, and educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil, more 'fufu' and fish

loans.name: Daysie

texts.en: Daysie S. is from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga. She is 49 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Daysie operates a business in agriculture, particularly in planting corn to sell. Daysie has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 1,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Daysie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daysie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Daysie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used for corn production. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Daysie from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For corn production

loans.name: Normie

texts.en:
Normie B. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Normie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Normie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Normie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Normie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Normie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Normie is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Normie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús F. de 42 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposo, y tres hijos de 16, 15 y 14 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, tanto alimenticios como de primera necesidad en el hogar, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Teresa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir la tienda comprando más pan, leche, jugos y otros productos más, los cuales posee mayor demanda, así de esta forma ella espera mejorar sus ventas. Teresa es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual desea mejorar su negocio y de esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad y de esta misma forma brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos en el cual puedan contar con todo lo necesario para vivir mejor.
texts.en: Teresa de Jesus F., 42 years of age and lives in Usulutan with her husband and three children, (ages 16, 15 and 14) who are in school. She runs a store out of her home where she sells basic products - both food and basic necessities for the home. Teresa requested a loan which she will use to re-stock her store and with which she will buy more bread, milk, juices and other products, due to the increased demand, and thus she hopes to improve her sales. Teresa is a very hardworking woman.  She wants to improve her business and create better financial stability, which in turn will help build a better future for her children, so they can have everything they need to live better.

loans.use: Compra de productos perecederos.  (To purchase products to re-stock her store's inventory)

loans.name: Nubia Maria

texts.es:
Nubia de 38 años, vive con sus dos hijas que estudian en la escuela donde ella tiene su negocio ubicado en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Hace cinco años ella comenzó con el bar en un Colegio llamado “Eloy Alfaro” ya que le dieR. la oportunidad de administrar el local en las tres jornadas y sacar sus propias ganancias. Cuando los niños salen al recreo comienzan sus ventas de golosinas, snack y otras comidas rápidas. En ocasiones su tía le ayuda atender el negocio ya que tiene tres jornadas que atender. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar dulces, snack, bebidas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito y poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nubia is 38 years old and lives with her two daughters who attend the school where she has her business in Primavera de Duran (a peri-urban area with a deteriorating ecosystem on the outskirts of Guayaquil).

Five years ago she started working at the snack bar in a school called “Eloy Alfaro” because they gave her the opportunity to run the business for three days a week and make her own profits.  When the children go out for recess she sells candy, snacks and other fast food.  Her aunt sometimes helps her with the business because she must work there for three days.

With her loan she would like to buy sweets, candy, snacks and drinks for her business.  In the future she would like her children to successfully complete their studies and to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Candy, snacks, drinks

loans.name: Ama Abokuma Sabina

texts.en: Ama Abokuma Sabina Q. sells "banku" (fermented maize dough) and rice at Abura. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a charcoal maker. She assists her husband by making sure that the children are in good health. The loan will be used to buy more maize and rice to cook for sale. She hopes to reinvest her profit back into her business.

loans.use: buy more maize and rice to cook for sale

loans.name: David

texts.es: La señor  David, se dedica a la carpintería y al Tallado de maderas, tiene 36 años y su Esposa la Sra. María de 23 años es ella quien le colabora en el trabajo de la carpintería cuando el Sr. esta sobre cargado de trabajo, Tienen una pequeña de 5 Añitos, El señor a Veces Que  realiza  Trabajos De Tallado a los muebles de Empresas de reconocido Nombre En la Ciudad. El Empieza su labor desde muy Temprano, son personas que quieren ampliar y crecer en su actividad mejorando su  taller y así tener personas q dependan de el y dar oportunidades a otros. Para asi  tener en el Futuro un bienestar para su hija y su familia. Vive en el barrio San Agustín de la Zona del Plan 3000.
texts.en: David is in the carpentry and wood carving business.  He is 36 years old and his wife María is 23 years old.  His wife helps him with his carpentry work when he is overloaded with jobs.  They have a little 5 year-old girl.  David sometimes performs wood carving work on furniture from well-known companies in the city.  He begins his work very early in the morning.  He is someone who wants to expand and grow in his business, improving his workshop so that he has people depending on him and also giving opportunities to others.  He hopes thereby to provide for the future well-being of his daughter and his family.  He lives in San Agustín neighborhood of Plan 3000 district.

loans.use: To buy raw material (wood) and to expand his workshop roof

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La Sra. I. es una madre de familia muy joven ella tiene un año con su venta de ropa y articulos de segundo uso, a pesar de ser muy joven es una mama muy responsable y con ganas de salir a delante y apoyando a la economía de su hogar y al esfuerzo que tiene su esposo ha decidido invertir mas en su venta, el esposo labora en una maquiladora de la localidad y tiene poco de haber adquirido su casa de interés social el siempre esta al tanto de su familia y apoya a su esposo en todo lo que ella emprende.
texts.en: Mrs. I. is a very young mother, who has operated a business selling clothing and used items for one year. In spite of being very young, she is a very responsible mother with a strong desire to get ahead. To support her household economy and the efforts made by her husband, she has decided to invest more in her business. Her husband works in a nearby factory, and they have just acquired a subsidized house. She is always taking care of her family and supporting her husband with everything she undertakes.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her business

loans.name: Sitan

texts.fr:
Sitan D. est une femme mariée de plus 40 ans et mère de quatre  enfants dont 3 garçons et 1 fille qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Sitan D. mène cette activité d’achat et vente de bois de chauffe et de poissons fumé il y a dix années. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout en saison hivernale, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. Ainsi, elle a besoin de ce septième prêt individuel pour acheter, 8 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso  et 10 cartons de poissons fumés à Gao (7ème région administrative du Mali) afin de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre.
Ses marchandises respectivement le bois de chauffe et les poissons fumés sont vendus à domicile et au marché du quartier.  
Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus cinq ans, a déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts solidaires avec une association des femmes de son quartier et est maintenant à son  septième prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour  réaliser l’essentielle de ses dépenses, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sitan D. is a woman over 40 years old, married and the mother of four children, three boys and one girl. She lives with her husband and their children in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso.

Sitan D. has been buying and selling firewood and smoked fish for ten years. She enjoys a good reputation in this business and receives a lot of orders especially during the winter season. However her resources do not allow her to meet her customers’ demand. Thus she needs this 7th individual loan to buy 8 truckloads of firewood in the locality surroundings the town of Sikasso, 10 boxes of smoked fish in Gao (7th administrative region of Mali) to satisfy the demand of her ever-increasing customers.

Her merchandise, firewood and smoked fish, are sold from home and at the local market.

She has had a five-year relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, and has already received four group loans with a neighborhood woman’s association. She is now on her seventh individual loan, all her previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

With this loan she is planning on making a monthly benefit of 130,000 Francs CFA that will be used to cover the bulk of her family’s expenses, pay her loan and invest in her activity.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Michael Mariano

texts.es:
Michael Mariano V. B. tiene 31 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Michael Mariano se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un terreno propio.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Michael Mariano V. B. is 31 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He has 2 children.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Michael Mariano is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He buys his products in the García and López shopping areas and sells his products in the Vaca shopping area.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to own his own plot of land.

Michael Mariano likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Maryuri Mariuxi

texts.es:
Maryuri Mariuxi B. C., tiene 21 años, es soltera, vive con  los hijos y con el padre en el  cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Maryuri se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta leer le Biblia.
texts.en:
Maryuri Mariuxi B. C. is 21 years old, she is single and she lives with her children and her father in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos Province. She has 2 children.

The V.R.C. Valle Alto (Valle Alto Communal Bank) is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; this group engages in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Maryuri engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. She buys and sells the products in Ventanas and in the Comercial Peña, and she also sells them every day at her house or in the market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize and rice by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of buying farm.

She likes reading the Bible.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia D. banco comunal Virgen D. la Puerta D. distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 56 años D. edad, está casada  y tiene 7 hijos.
La señora Rosa es ejemplo D. mujer, a pesar D. tener sus años tiene todas las ganas D. seguir trabajando y lo disfruta, siempre está al pendiente D. todo y muy cerca a sus trabajadores.
Rosa se dedica a la elaboración D. carbón, que es un trabajo pesado para una mujer, pero eso no la detiene.
Con éste préstamo D. S/.1,000.00 comprará aserrín para tapar la leña y quemarlo, 2 volquetadas D. leña que necesita para la elaboración D. su  carbón, cada uno cuesta s/.400.00 y lo demás lo invertirá en otras cosas que le falta para su negocio.
La señora Rosa está feliz con su trabajo, nos cuenta muy contenta todo  lo que ha logrado gracias a su esfuerzo y dice que todavía le falta más, solo lleva 2 años trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos. 
Rosa quiere seguir trabajando para ayudar a su hijo que está en la universidad.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the community bank "Virgen D. la Puerta" in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is 56 years old. She is married and has 7 children.
 
Señora Rosa sets an example as a woman: in spite of her age, she has a great desire to continue working, and she enjoys it. She is always attending to everything and is very close to her workers.

Rosa makes charcoal, which is heavy work for a woman, but that doesn't stop her.

With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will buy sawdust to cover the firewood and burn it, and two truckloads of firewood that she needs to make her charcoal. Each one costs 400 PEN, and the rest she will invest in other things that she needs for her business.

Señora Rosa is happy with her work, she tells us, and very satisfied with all that she has achieved through her efforts. She says that she still needs more. She has been working with the loans from Manuela Ramos for only two years.

Rosa wants to continue working to help her son who is at the university,

loans.use: Buy firewood and sawdust.

loans.name: Paul Mutuku

texts.en:
Paul Mutuku M. is 50 years, married to Elizabeth and they have two children. Paul is a tire dealer and he has been in this business for 20 years in Kangundo, and earns a monthly profit margin of KES.20, 000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his fifth loan purposely to buy more stock of tire for sale. The anticipated profit from the proceeds of this loan will be saved and pay for his children's school.

In the future he hopes to grow his business, and open other tire shops in other centers.

loans.use: To buy more tires

loans.name: Maribel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maribel de 35 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y su hijo, ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra de hortalizas hace 10 años, de esta actividad han logrado vivir dignamente sin mayores dificultades.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, esta compra es para realizar una nueva siembra, ya que sin estos materiales no pueden comenzar el proceso del cultivo, pues se necesita abono, fertilizantes y tratamientos para plagas, para dar los cuidados necesarios durante el proceso de crecimiento.
Las aspiraciones de doña Maribel con respecto al crédito que realizar una buena inversión y también una buena siembra, recibir la producción y comercializarla a buen precio.
texts.en:
Maribel, 35, lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután department with her husband and son.  Together with her husband she has been farming leafy vegetables for 10 years.  This activity has made it possible for them to live with dignity and free of major problems.

She is asking for a loan to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.  This purchase is to start a new planting cycle and without these supplies they cannot start the process because manure, fertilizer and insecticide are needed to provide proper care during the growing process.

Maribel’s hopes with respect to the loan are to make a good investment, to have a good planting, to harvest the production and sell it at a good price.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Zonia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Tarapotinas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 40 años y es madre de 02 hijos.  Tiene estudios secundarios completos.  

Zonia se dedica a la venta de kinkones, bizcochuelos (dulces-bocaditos), y los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de carne asada en las afueras de su casa,  negocio en el cual empezó a trabajar desde muy joven ayudando a su madre, fue su esfuerzo y dedicación los que la llevaron a salir adelante e ir ganándose la confianza de los que ahora son sus clientes frecuentes, vecinos y amigos. Con su primer crédito de S/.100 Nuevos Soles adquirió las primeras gallinas y sábanas qué empezaría a vender; para luego, dedicarse a la producción de kinkones y venta de otros alimentos.

Con este crédito de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará los insumos que utilizará en la preparación de sus productos: Harina y azúcar en bolsas, pasas, huevos, sal y saborizantes para la preparación de kinkones y bizcochuelos pudiendo así abastecer los pedidos de sus clientes.
 
Zonia dijo que está muy agradecida al Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque siempre la estuvo apoyando desde sus inicios, no sólo con créditos sino también con talleres y charlas orientadas principalmente a mujeres como ella, que quieren salir  adelante y ser empresarias de éxito.
texts.en:
Sra. Zonia, 40, belongs to the Las Tarapotinas II community bank in the Peruvian province of San Martin.  She is single and has 2 children.  She has a high school education.

Zonia operates a business making and selling traditional snack foods.  On weekends, she makes and sells grilled meats, a skill she picked as a girl from her mother.  Her strength and hard work have given her the confidence she's needed to gain a loyal group of customers and make a success of her business.  

Zonia used her first loan, for S/.100 new soles, to buy merchandise---hens and sheets--that she then resold.  She's selling prepared foods now and she'll use this loan, for S/.500 new soles, to buy the supplies she needs--flour, sugar, raisins, eggs, salt and spices--to make traditional Peruvian snacks such as kinkones and bizcochuelos.  

Zonia told us that she is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos because it has long supported her business efforts, not only with funding, but with workshops and seminars designed for women like her who want to start their own businesses and support themselves.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food business

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn is 45-year-old widow with two children who are studying in the local public school. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she  grows rice both to sell and to feed her family. She is also a pig and a chicken breeder. 

Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand it. So for this purpose Mrs. Orn is applying for a loan to buy two piglets, ten chickens, pig food, and a cow. The cow will be used for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, pig feed, chickens, and a cow

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 32-year-old married woman with four children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She takes care of the family with the help of her husband, who is a businessman. Their dream is to build a residential house.

Annet sells clothes. She has been in this business for four years and the business is promising as she started with six million UGX and now she has a working capital of eight million UGX. She has a challenge in the seasonal nature of the business. Her aspiration is to own at least four outlets.

Annet needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El sr. Daniel vive  Zona Monte Alto hace mucho tiempo,  su actividad es el transporte  ya que realiza el recorrido de la zona hacia el centro, su esposa la señora francisca es empleada domestica en la ciudad ambos trabajan para mantener el hogar, salen desde muy temprano de su casa rumbo a su y trabajo,   son personas responsables tienen su casa propia que a base de esfuerzo compraron, les falta terminar la construcción motivo por el cual solicitaron el crédito para la compra de material de construcción para terminar de construir su vivienda y	 así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, el Sr. Daniel esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en ellos y brindarles un apoyo para poder culminar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Daniel has lived in the Monte Alto are for a long time. He works in transportation, running a route between Monte Alto and the city center. His wife, Francisca, is a housekeeper in the city. Daniel and Francisca both work to support their household. They leave their home very early to go to work. They are both responsible people and they have their own home that they bought thanks to their hard work. 

Daniel and Francisca still need to finish the construction work on their home. For this reason they requested a loan to purchase construction materials to finish building their home. In this way they will be able to provide better comfort for their family. Daniel is grateful to our institution for trusting him and his wife and for providing the support they need to finish their home.

loans.use: to complete the construction work on his house.

loans.name: Dolores Mercedes

texts.es:
Dolores Mercedes es habitante del municipio Santa Rosa del Peñón en León, es una dama que se ha destacado por velar por el bienestar de su familia dando lugar al cuido de esta y preocupándose por el bienestar de su casa.

Está atravesando la necesidad de invertir a lo inmediato en el mejoramiento de su vivienda y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de cemento y arena para mejorar su vivienda en especial el local de la cocina. Ella espera muy confiadamente en que este crédito le será otorgado y así podrá mejorar sus condiciones y brindar mejoras a su vivienda para beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores Mercedes lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Penon, in the department of Leon. She is a woman who stands out ensuring the well-being of her home and family.

She has realized the need for investing immediately in improving her home, and for this reason has approached CEPRODEL (Kiva field partner) with the aim of receiving a loan to purchase cement and sand to renovate her home, especially the kitchen. She is very hopeful that she will receive this loan and thus will be able to improve her living situation and benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand to renovate her kitchen.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and is married with two children who attend school. For the past five years, she has run a business raising and fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has taken out 16 previous loans with NWTF to sustain her business.

Teresita is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: El señor Gerardo vive en Belén a 30 Km de Santa Rita. Esta casado con la Sra.  Martina y tiene 5 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el Sr. Gerardo es agricultor y sus hijos también le ayudan se dedican a la agricultura y siembra de papa, maíz, yuca y tienen plantas de guineo con el dinero del crédito comprara semillas para la siembra de sus productos y también lo utilizara en lo que es el preparado de la tierra par la siembra. Él Sr. Gerardo nació en Chuquisaca el 30 de Septiembre de 1977 hace 10 años que él vino de Chuquisaca porque lograron conseguir una parcela en Santa Cruz, ya que se vinieron buscando un mejor futuro para el y su familia, es un apersona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gerardo lives in Belén, 30 kilometers from Santa Rita.  He’s married to Martina and has five children who are school aged.  Gerardo’s a farmer and his children also help him to farm.  They farm potato, corn and manioc and also have plantain plants.  He will use the money from the loan to buy seeds for his plantings and also will use it to prepare the soil for planting.

Gerardo was born in Chuquisaca on 30 September 1977.  Ten years ago he moved here from Chuquisaca because they managed to acquire a parcel of land in Santa Cruz having come here seeking a better future for himself and his family.  He is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to clear the fields and plant corn.

loans.name: Vicente Rufino

texts.es:
Vicente Rufino tiene 58 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Vicente se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es tener mas ingresos para tener una casa comoda y grande y no tener tantas necesidades.

Le gusta hacer deporte y escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Vicente Rufino is 58 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called '26 de Noviembre' and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Vicente is a farmer.  In particular, he grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas each month and makes his sales in the street market in the town.

Vicente is requesting this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs and increase his production.  He faces challenges in his business such as pests which attack his crops.  His dream is to make more income so that he can have a large, comfortable house and not experience so many needs.

Vicente enjoys taking part in sports and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Oklunon Lingbotoche Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OKLUNON LINGBOTOCHE est formé de trois personnes qui habitent tous ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Suzanne, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Suzanne est âgée de 49 ans et est mariée à un militaire du nom de Sosthène. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant ensemble avec eux. Suzanne a très peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs trois ans que Suzanne exerce comme activité, la vente de produits divers à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Suzanne s’approvisionne dans un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Suzanne désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Suzanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe OKLUNON LINGBOTOCHE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Oklunon Lingbotoche group comprises three people who live together in the same area. The group representative, named Suzanne, is the one with the raised hand in the photo. This is the first time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their business. Suzanne is 49 years old and married to a serviceman named Sosthène. The couple have five children, all of whom attend school and live with them. Suzanne has had very little schooling. For about three years, she has run a business selling various items at her home; this allows her to respond to her needs and those of her family without great difficulty. Suzanne gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. With the hope of better responding to the demands of her clientele, she wants to increase the stock of her products. To do this, Suzanne, along with the other members of the Oklunon Lingbotoche group, are seeking their first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To buy various items.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe de 68 años de edad, vive con su esposa porque sus hijos son independientes en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Felipe desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra a unos minutos de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo que las trabaja, donde siembra limón y mango; una vez que cosecha lo vende en los mercados de la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras y su producto, con los ingresos que obtendrá pueda cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Felipe es una persona trabajadora y  responsable que lo único que quiere es brindarle más comodidades a su esposa.
texts.en:
Felipe, age 68, lives with his wife as his children are independent and have their own homes. Their home does not have any basic services. They live in the rural zone of the Tambogrande district, which belongs to the Piura department. This zone is characterized by agricultural, livestock and craft activities.

Felipe has raised and sold sheep for several years. His corrals, located a few minutes from his home, are suitable and spacious. He feeds balanced food and natural grass so that his animals will develop ideally for sale in the various markets of the zone. This will mean very good earnings to cover his daily costs. He also has land for cultivation, which he works. He sows lemon and mango. Once harvested, he sells them in the markets of the zone.

He has requested a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of balanced food and fertilizer to improve his lands and his product. With the income that he will obtain, he will be able to cover his loan and improve his quality of life. Felipe is a hard-working and responsible person, and all he wants is to offer his wife more conveniences.

loans.use: to purchase balanced food, and fertilizer to improve his fertile land

loans.name: Osmelia

texts.es:
Osmelia, llegó al barrio villa angelita hace 8 años luego de adquirir la vivienda gracias al subsidio que le aprobara  una caja de compensación familiar a su esposo,  trabajador de un supermercado Hace  dos años, se dedica a la preparación y venta de fritos y chichas los fines de semana en horas de la mañana y también vende cerveza aprovechando la cercanía que tiene su vivienda con un escenario deportivo del barrio.  Sus ventas en general son de contado y maneja pocos inventarios de materias primas e insumos,   debido a   que las realiza de acuerdo a las necesidades, en graneros del barrio donde habita.
Osmelia tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 22 años, en Soledad municipio de Colombia con el mayor crecimiento poblacional del país. Osmelia se dedica a varias actividades, productos de su empeño en generar buenos ingresos para fortalecer el bienestar de su hogar; pues además de la  preparación de fritos y venta de cervezas ya mencionadas,    también confecciona ropa en todas las líneas y fabrica, cortinas y ofrece el servicio de reparación de ropa. Gradualmente su negocio de alimento se ha ido incrementando y requiere comprar un freidor, para agilizar la preparación de sus fritos y también necesita comprar materias primas como aceite, y cervezas en un mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos y lograr trasladarlo a los precios de su oferta. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, pues su capital de trabajo le resulta insuficiente para poder lograrlo, pues sus indicadores financieros, muestran una estabilidad en el negocio, y condiciones favorables para la inversión. Su meta y gran desafío es tener un local donde ubicar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas, para lograr mejores ingresos familiares y continuar apoyando a sus hijos en el logro de sus metas, pues su gran sueño es verlos exitosos
texts.en:
Osmelia came to the Villa Angelita neighborhood 8 years ago after acquiring a house, thanks to the subsidy her husband a supermarket worker got through a family compensation bank. For two years, she has worked preparing and selling fried food and chicha weekend mornings. She also sells beer, taking advantage of the fact that her house is near a sports field. In general, her sales are in cash and she manages little inventory of ingredients and materials. She buys to meet the demand from stores in the neighborhood where she lives. 

Osmelia is 41 years old. She lives with her spouse and 3 children, aged 16 to 22 in Soledad, a town in Colombia with the biggest population growth in the country. Osmelia does various activities. Her hard work is to generate good income to strengthen her home's wellbeing. In addition to making fried foods and selling beer, as already mentioned, she also makes clothing in all types of fabric and styles as well as curtains. She does clothing repair as well. GRadually, her food business has grown and she needs to buy a fryer to make the preparation of her fried food easier. She also needs to buy ingredients such as oil and beer in bigger quantities to get discounts and pass on the savings in her products. This is the reason that she has taken out a Kiva loan. Her working capital isn't enough to do it with. Her financial indicators show that her business is stable and conditions are favorable for investment. Her goal and big challenge is to increase her sales in order to have more family income and continue to support her children achieve their goals. Her dream is to see them become successful.

loans.use: to buy a fryer to make the preparation of her fried food easier. She also needs to buy ingredients such as oil and beer in bigger quantities.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Lucia has a poultry farm that sells chickens by the kilogram. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy animal feed for chickens she will sell.

Lucia has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Lucia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for chickens

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda says that we make our fortune and we call them fate. Her thinking drove her to strengthen her dreams. 

Yolanda is 51 years of age, married, and has three children. She has been running a rice farming business for almost 30 years.  Yolanda dreams of having all her children finish their study and get good jobs someday. At her age, she constantly work hard on her farm to lessen her expenses for labor cost.   She is doing all of this just to give her family enough food and to send her children to school.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer to apply on her farm. She and her husband give their best in managing their farm to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: buy herbicides, insecticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a hardworking businessman aged 39. He is married and blessed with three children. For the last 10 years, he has been doing electronic repairs to make a living. In the next five years, he wants his business to become successful. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy phone and electronic accessories. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy phone and electronic accessories.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 61 years old, married, and has three children.  He sells gas cylinders so as to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years.  His wife assists him in the business.  He has grown the business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  He also sells firewood to supplement his income.

Francis hopes to expand his business in the future for more income generation.  He needs 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy gas cylinders for cooking.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders for cooking.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 60 years old, married and has five children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines.
Elizabeth has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.
In the future, Elizabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alimaa

texts.en:
Alimaa is 60 years old and lives with her husband and child in a ger (tent like structure), in Huvsgul province, Mongolia.  Her husband is in the agriculture business and her child goes to college. 

Before retiring, Alimaa was an accountant.  Now she owns a vegetable trading business, started in 2000.  She also operates a tailoring business.  She mostly sews souvenir for tourists, like felt crafts, traditional clothes and shoes.  She has two tailors.  Alimaa is also a part time craft consultant. 

Alimaa is a sharp and hard working woman who says, "I love my job and it makes me feel young again."  She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy  materials to make shoes and Mongolian traditional clothes.

loans.use: to buy  materials

loans.name: Evangelisto

texts.es: Evangelisto, de 52 años de edad, originario de Estelí un humilde campesino, que se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de ganado, el padre de 4 hijos, casado. Dos de sus hijos mayores trabajan on el en el campo y los otros dos están en la escuela. Sus comienzos fueron muy difíciles para el porque no contaba con muchas herramientas ni maquinaria para trabajar tenia que alquilar bueyes para arar la tierra , tenia que cuidar durante jornadas enteras sus siembras para que no le robaran o los animales entraran al campo a comerse sus siembras poco a poco fue surgiendo como agricultor por si solo, con la ganancia que obtenía la fue ahorrando  y con eso compro  su  propia tierra para trabajar también compro sus vacas para criar ganado y venderlo. Hoy en día su familia lo ayuda con las labores del campo, pero su casa esta en deterioro debido a las fuertes lluvias que esta sufriendo  el país. Es por ello que esta solicitando del crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para ir reparando su casa poco a poco. Con el crédito podrá comprar parte de los, materiales que necesita  y que sus hijos ya no esta  sufriendo por las malas condiciones del techo debido a las goteras que tiene. Por lo pronto quiere mejorarles las condiciones de vida a su familia y salir adelante con su negocio de venta y crianza de ganado.
texts.en: Evangelisto, 52, is a humble peasant from Estelí.  His business is agriculture and livestock farming, and he is married and the father of four children.  His two older children work in the fields and the other two are in school.  His beginnings were difficult because he had no tools or machinery to work with so he had to rent oxen to plough the land.  For entire days on end he would stand guard to prevent thieves or animals from damaging the crops.  Little by little he became a crop farmer on his own and was able to save enough to buy his own land.  He also bought a cow to start raising livestock.  Now his family helps with the field work but his house is in disrepair because of the heavy rainfall in his country.  This is why he is requesting a loan to buy construction materials so he can repair the house little by little.  He plans to use the loan to buy part of the material he needs to repair the holes in the roof so his children don't suffer.  He wants to improve his family's living conditions and get ahead in his livestock business.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for home repair.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en: Heba is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child. Heba has worked as a hairdresser on a freelance basis since 2008, serving customers at her home. She decided to start her own business after seeing that her husband, who works as an employee in a local company, hardly covers the heavy expenses. Heba is requesting a loan of $600 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase new hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Arlie Group

texts.en:
Arlie is married and has three children. Arlie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Arlie is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for growing corn. 

Arlie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Arlie hopes to support her children's education.

Arlie is the leader of a three-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for growing corn.

loans.name: John Carlo

texts.en:
John Carlo is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single and has 1 child. 

John Carlo is providing motorcycle, or habal-habal, services. He has had this business for 2 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for maintenance of his vehicle.

John Carlo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, John Carlo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Ma Santos

texts.es:
La señora Ma Santos esta solicitando un préstamo ya que tiene un problema de salud. 
Ya que desea apoyar a sus padres los cuales radican en el estado de Veracruz y se encuentran mal de salud; y son personas mayores de edad, están pasando por un situación de emergencia, ya que uno de sus padres se encuentra muy delicado de salud y con este préstamo los ayudara a cualquier imprevisto que les surgen con la enfermedad. 
Doña Ma Santos trabaja en una maquiladora como operaria en producción, desde hace 2 años y su esposo tiene ya mas de 20 años dedicándose a la mecánica reparación de carro en su domicilio. Tiene cuatro hijos de edad escolar y a quienes les quieren dar lo necesario para un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Ma. Santos is requesting a loan since she has a health problem, because she wants to help her parents, who live in the state of Veracruz and are in poor health.  They are older and are going through an emergency situation, since one of her parents is in delicate health.

With this loan she will help them with any unforeseen events that come up from the illness.

Ma. Santos has been working for two years as a production worker in a "maquiladora" [factory in a free-trade zone].  Her husband has been an auto mechanic in their home for more than 20 years.  She has four school-age children whom they want to give everything they need for a better future.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses for her parents.

loans.name: Santalina

texts.en:
Santalina is 40 year old a married woman. She has five children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator South Sudan for three years.

Santalina is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Janet Yolanda

texts.es:
Janet Yolanda es una joven de 24 años de edad la cual es madre soltera  de una pequeña niña de 4 añitos, Janet es muy responsable, dedicada y sobre todo luchadora ya que cría a su pequeña sola,  Janet nos comenta que su hija es lo mejor que Dios pudo regalarle y sin ella no podría continuar por ello  le brinda su afecto y se esfuerza porque no le falte nada cada día y no pase penurias. Janet vive en casa de sus padres a los cuales apoya mucho con los ingresos de su trabajo, ya que ellos le brindaron un pequeño espacio para poder tener su negocio y sobre todo porque la ayudan en el cuidado de su pequeña cuando Janet está trabajando.

Actualmente Janet tiene una bodega en donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes, arroz azúcar, enlatados, etc.), desde hace 11 meses viene trabajando duro y de manera constante, ella le dedica a su trabajo 16 horas diarias,  ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque atiende muy bien a los clientes, es ordenada y mantiene su negocio limpio y eso inspira confianza en los clientes. Actualmente Janet esta mas que agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería, en este caso ropa ya que quiere ofrecer este producto es su bodega y con ello mejorara su negocio ya que los clientes tendrán más variedad de productos, con ello aumentaran sus ingresos y ahorrar para más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: “Ampliar su Negocio”
texts.en:
Janet Yolanda is a 24 year old young woman. She is a single mother to a four year old little girl. She is very responsible and dedicated. More than anything, she is a fighter who takes care of her little one on her own. Janet tells us that her daughter is the best things that God could have given her and without her, she would not be able to continue to give affection and she makes an effort because every day she does not miss anything and she doesn’t have hardships. Janet lives in her parents’ house and they support her a lot with her work. They give her a small area where she can have her business and more than anything, they help to take care of her daughter while Janet is working.

Now Janet has a store that offer basic needs products (groceries, rice, sugar, canned goods, etc.). For 11 months, she has been working hard and constantly. She dedicates 16 hours a day to her store. She believes her business is going well because she serves her customers very well and because she is organized. Also, because she keeps her business clean and this inspires confidence in her customers. Janet is more than grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the support that they offer, she will be able to purchase more merchandise. In this case, it will be clothing. She wants to offer this product in her store and this will improve her business. Now her clients will have a greater variety of products. With this addition, she will increase her income and save more for the future she can fulfill her big dream: “expanding her business”.

loans.use: purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.en:
Lisbeth is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Lisbeth is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Lisbeth owns and operates a business venture, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been in her business for four years and earns 2,300 PHP a month from these activities.

Lisbeth is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. In 2010, Lisbeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Russell

texts.en:
Russell has always been an entrepreneur at heart. After leaving the military, this veteran waited for the right opportunity to launch out and start his own business. When the housing market crashed in 2007, the number of bank-owned properties sky-rocketed, creating a large need for property preservation and maintenance. Seeing the opportunity in the market, Russell started R/M Asset Maintenance, a company which conducts foreclosure property maintenance, lawn care, clean-up and removal, as well as assisting with evictions and lock changes.  

With over a decade of experience in the construction, maintenance and janitorial industries, Russell already has the skills necessary to offer high quality, efficient service to his clients. Furthermore, his military training has instilled in him the discipline and work ethic to do whatever it takes to turn his business into a successful venture. 

Russell will use his $4,000 Kiva loan to purchase a truck, power generator and several power tools. This will provide him with the basic equipment necessary to get his business off the ground.

Russell's dreams of self-employment is slowly becoming a reality.  Currently, Russell is working full-time for a temp agency, but hopes to grow his company to the point where he can commit to it full time.

loans.use: to purchase a truck, power generator and several power tools

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en: Nikolai Arabadjiev is 46 years old. He is married and has a baby girl. His wife is a dentist. Previously Nikolai has worked as a technical manager in a chemical factory in Bourgas and later in the mining industry but he was not satisfied with the salary he earned so he decided to quit and to start his own business. He first founds a bookstore on the city market. In 2000 he open a small grocery store in the neighborhood he lives. The business is going well and the bookstore becomes very small so two years ago Nikolai founds a new bigger bookstore. Now he wants to buy a copying machine and to supply such services in his bookstore. The requested loan amount is $ 2000.

loans.use: To buy a copying machine

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Mr. Martinez is a professional accountant with a great future ahead. Despite having only 3 years on the job, he has acquired enough experience to work on his own. He developed this experience while working and attending school simultanteously. He says, "I hope to succeed professionally and to serve the community in general. To do this, I need a $700 loan to buy equipmemt and to increase my office space."

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

El contador M. es un profesionista con un gran futuro, a pesar de sus escasos 3 años de antigüedad, ya ha adquirido experiencia suficiente para trabajar por su cuenta, esta la formó durante el periodo de estancia en la escuela pues desde esas fechas él ya trabajaba a la par de los estudios. "Mi intención es poder sobresalir profesionalmente y servirle a la comunidad en general, para esto necesito un préstamo de $700.00 dlls. Para comprar equipo de trabajo y ampliar mi oficina".

loans.use: Buy office equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase, processing and selling of bisap juice

loans.name: Mimisa

texts.en: Mimisa is 27 years of age and married with three children. Knowledgeable in elei printing, she has used it as a means of earning money to meet her family needs. She uses her loan to buy the specialized equipment for her business. Mimisa is also grateful for the support she gets from her husband. They both struggle together in order for their business to run smoothly. They deliver their products to various shops down at the market and they earn $70.00 a day. They earn $420.00 profit from the business after all the expenditures have been deducted. Mimisa is grateful in SPBD for lending her the money so that she can manage to improve her business.

loans.use: Mimisa would like to buy fabrics and some more paints for her traditional elei printing.

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en: Rahman is a 30 year old local resident of the town of Khachmaz Azerbaijan. He is not married yet. He rents a shop in Khachmaz where he sells foodstuffs. He has been in this business for more than five years. He wants to develop the business and increase the number and variety of goods sold in the shop. For this purpose he applies to Normicro Khachmaz branch for a loan in amount of $300.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Ni Made Sekariani

texts.id:
Having the knowledge of pig farming is essential for any pig farmer. Ni Made Sekariani a mother of 3 face problem of insufficient yield and lack of capital. This caused her to be very afraid and skeptical to expand her business. And being a women, she is shy and afraid to acknowledge that these requires more capital. However after receiving financial assistance from Dinari, this changed her perspective, as she realize that she must do well to raise her 3 children who are still in school. And most importantly, her husband Made Supartika has also lend a hand in doing this. With the capital, she intend to buy good quality pig feedings, so that her pigs can grow fat and healthy. Recently one of her sow has also gave birth to 10 piglets. She also intends to build a bigger pig sty. With the capital and knowledge gained, Ni Made Sekariani is confident that her business will grow.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Pengetahuan tentang beternak babi yang baik dan benar, adalah suatu hal yang mesti dimiliki oleh seseorang sebelum menekuni usaha tersebut. Hal itu juga terjadi pada Ni Made Sekariani, seorang ibu dengan 3 orang anak. Karena keterbatasan pengetahuan dan rasa takut untuk berkembang, seringkali usahanya tidak mendapatkan hasil yang optimal. Wanita didesa seringkali malu dan takut, bahwa untuk mengembangkan usaha perlu latihan dan dana yang mencukupi. Setelah mendapat pembinaan dari yayasan Dinari, pikiran Ni Made Sekariani mulai terbuka. Ni Made Sekariani menyadari bahwa usaha yang ditekuninya semuanya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya, apalagi dengan ketiga anaknya sedang duduk di bangku pendidikan. Yang lebih penting, sekarang ini suaminya, I Made Supartika, juga mendukung usaha yang ditekuni istrinya. Dengan modal pinjaman yang didapatnya, Ni Made Sekariani berencana untuk membeli pakan yang berkwalitas agar pertumbuhan babinya maksimal dan sehat. Kebetulan saat ini babinya baru saja melahirkan anak sebanyak 10 ekor. Ni Made Sekariani juga berencana untuk membuat kandang yang baik, karena selama ini babinya belum memiliki tempat yang memadai. Dengan pengetahuan dan dana yang sudah didapatnya, Ni Made Sekariani yakin usahanya akan berkembang dengan baik.

loans.use: Membeli pakan dan membuat kandang - Buying Pig Feedings and Building a pig sty

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura M.’s business is a flutter of flipping fins and flapping feathers! She owns a small fish farm and also raises chickens which she then kills, plucks, cleans, cuts and sells as meat at market. Ashura is married to husband Selemani with whom she has two children, Asha, 10 and Rahma, 8. She requires a loan of $775 to expand the chicken-raising/killing business and hopes that the vegetarians won’t boycott her loan application!

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additonal chicks for raising and sale.

loans.name: Talib

texts.en: Talib A. lives in Beylagan, a small town in Azerbaijan. He is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He is engaged in animal sales. Talib has seven years' experience at this business. (He is pictured at the livestock market.) Talib has applied to Normicro's Beylagan Branch for a loan, because he would like to purchase some sheep and expand his business. Talib needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1200 for this purpose.

loans.use: To expand his animal sales business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a trader who buys corn, groundnuts and plantains in large quantities and sells them to the women vendors in the local market. Mary is married and has 3 children. She wants to increase her income by increasing her sales.

She is asking for $325 to enable her buy more corn, groundnuts and plantains.

loans.use: To buy more corn, groundnuts and plantains.

loans.name: Victor

texts.fr:
Mr. C. works as a cobbler in the town of Thies where he has been located for more than 15 years. He manages an industrial shoemaking business. He needs funding to strengthen his stock of raw materials and inputs. He sells his finished products at the local level and in Belgium where his brother lives, facilitating transactions and the purchase of production machinery.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr C. exerce une profession de cordonnier dans la ville de Thiès où il s’est implanté depuis plus de 15 ans. Il gère une activité industrielle de fabrication de Chaussures et de gangs. il a un besoin de financement pour renforcer son stock de matières premières et d’intrants. Il écoule son produit fini au niveau local et en Belgique où se trouve son frère qui lui facilite les transactions et l’acquisition de machines de production.

loans.use: Purchase of leather and hides to strengthen stock

loans.name: Mwashamba's Tuvumiliane Group

texts.en:
Mwashamba is 23 years old and is married. Mwashamba is a business woman, she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7.30am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy moreitems for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in small businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is thirty eight years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She has been selling used clothing for eleven years now. She has also added some grocery sales to increase her income in order to support her family.

Diana wants to use her loan to buy more bales of used clothing and some grocery products to increase her inventory and also to avoid price hikes. She is a member of the group called Nyame wo Tum (meaning "God has power"). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Diana’s photo was taken during a group’s meeting.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing and grocery products

loans.name: Huseinova

texts.ru:
A. Huseinova is a young woman of 28, she is not married and lives with her parents. She works as a seamstress in a sewing factory. Besides her job she also helps her father with the cattle. Her parents are retired. A. loves taking care of the cattle, she walks and washes them on the weekends. At this time she has two cows and wants to buy two bigger ones when she receives a loan. She needs a loan of 3,500 somoni (US$1,025).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хусейнова Анора девушка в возросте 28 лет не замужем , живет с родителями. Работает закройщией в швейном цехе.По мимо работы она помогает отцу по уходу за скотом.Мать и отец Аноры пенсионеры, ни где не работают. Анора очень любит скот и уход за ним, по выходным она выводит их на прогулку , купает .На данное ремя у нее сейчас двое коров , получив кредит она хочет купить еще пару больших коров.Она хочет получить 3500 сомони.

loans.use: Feeding and selling of cattle

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi V., 59 years old, is a participant in the Fund. Her family borrowed money to do business in butchering chicken. On average, each day they sell 30kg of chicken. Because of the success of the business, they had to hire one worker to work for the family fulltime; each month they pay him a salary of 1,500,000 VND. Her husband is a retired veteran, with a stable monthly pension of 2,500,000 VND. Even though he has the pension, her husband is still very hardworking and helps the family by raising fish. The annual income from the fish business is 10,000,000 VND. With the various sources of income, her family’s finances are relatively good compared to people in the region. She has 3 children, 2 who are grown and live on their own, and 1 who is still young and goes to school. In this round of funding the family is requesting 15,000,000 VND to invest in the butcher shop. Their average income is 6,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị V. 59 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương gia đình chị vay vốn buôn bán giết mổ gia cầm, bình quân mỗi ngày gia đình chị bán 30kg gà thịt, do việc kinh doanh thuận lợi nên gia đình chị phải thuê 1 công nhân chuyên làm cho gia đình chị hàng tháng gia đình chị trả lương 1.500.000đ, chồng chị là cán bộ quân đội về hưu lương tháng ổn định 2.500.000đ, mặc dù có lương hưu nhưng chồng chị rất chịu khó vẫn luôn phụ giúp công việc gia đình chăn nuôi cá, hàng năm thu hoach từ thả cá là 10.000.000đ. Với nhiều nguồn thu như vậy nên kinh tế gia đình chị thuộc diện khá tại địa phương, chị có 3 con, 2 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 1 con sống cùng gia đình và đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị vay 15.000.000 đầu tư vào giết mổ gia cầm. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in butcher shop

loans.name: Ericka Yaneth

texts.es:
"My name is Ericka Yaneth A. López. I work in an industrial assembly plant in Piedras Negras. I have 2 children; one of my children is now school age, and his school costs are increasing our family expenses. My husband and I decided to open a food stand in order to increase our earnings. We are applying for a loan for 400 dollars, in order to improve the quality of our business and better serve our clients."

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

"Mi nombre es Ericka Yaneth A. López trabajo en una maquiladora de Piedras Negras, tengo dos hijos uno de ello ya en edad escolar por lo que los gastos aumentan mi esposo y yo decidimos poner un puesto de comida para poder aumentar nuestros ingresos por lo cual solicitamos la cantidad de 394 dls, para poder mejorar la calidad de nuestro negocio y atender mejor a nuestros clientes."

loans.use: Add a roof to her taco stand

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia, socia del Banco comunal  “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en el  Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la Venta de todo tipo de condimentos envasados en sobre y licuados, vende en su puesto que tiene en el Jr.  Tawantinsuyo C- 07,  Mercado Nº  02  de la ciudad.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual lo pagará en 6 meses, comprará  sillao, vinagre, cominos en kilos, orégano, ajinomoto, ajos en kilos para licuar y vender, diferentes tipos de ajíes para venderlos licuados y otros condimentos como palillo,  pimentón, etc., que ella compra en gran cantidad para luego venderlos al menudeo.

Tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con uno de sus  hijos, el cual aún está a su cargo y en un futuro quiere verlo todo un profesional. Tiene como meta adquirir un local para tener más seguridad con sus productos y surtir más su negocio, porque sus productos tiene bastante salida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia, a member of the communal bank "Nuestra Señora de la Paz" (Our Lady of Peace), lives in the Department and Province of San Martín in the Tarapoto District. She makes a living selling all kinds of packaged and liquid condiments. She sells them from a stand she has in the Jr. Tawantinsuyo C-07, Market #2 in the city.

With this loan for $525, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy soy sauce, vinegar, cumin by the kilo, oregano, Ajinomoto brand MSG, garlic by the kilo to liquify and sell, various kinds of chilis to liquefy and sell, and other accessories, such as toothpicks, paprika, etc, that she purchases in bulk to later sell retail.

She is 45 years old, and lives with her husband and one of her children, who is still in her care and who she hopes to one day see become a professional. Her goal is to acquire a location where she'll have more security for her products and stock her store even more, because her products sell quite well.


Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as vinegar, cumin, garlic, etc.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida trabaja como comerciante de frutas, su marido es portero de una empresa. La pareja mantiene a 4 hijos, de los cuales la mayor esta a punto de ser bachiller. La familia tiene casa propia que fue beneficiada con un crédito anterior, el domicilio esta ubicado en la zona Villa Tahuntinsuyo de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (mercaderia) de esa forma incrementar sus ingresos económicos.

Es el segundo crédito via Kiva, sus impecables antecedentes favorecen esta solicitud de préstamo
texts.en:
Adelaida sells fruit, and her husband works as a doorman for a local company. The couple supports their four children, the oldest of whom will soon finish high school. The family owns their own home in the Villa Tahuntinsuyo neighborhood of the city of El Alto. They bought the home with a previous loan.

The loan will be used to buy more fruit to sell so that the couple can earn more.

This is Adelaida's second Kiva loan; her impeccable credit history makes her an excellent candidate to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Hasnija

texts.en:
Hasnija was born in 1962 and she lives in a village near Doboj in Bosnia. She is married and has two adult children. Her son is employed and her daughter is studying at a local university. To support her family (and particularly her daughter`s education expenses), Hasnija works in a textile factory where she earns 500KM/month, the equivalent of roughly $330USD. She also has a vegetable garden and raises chickens seasonally for her family`s consumption.

Hasnija requests a loan for 1,000KM from Women for Women International, which she will use to buy chickens and food for chickens. She hopes to start selling chicken products at a local market to generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken food.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. Lago Titicaca Nº 170-A, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y 2 que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de combustible. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas. Trabaja de Lunes a Domingo, en las mañanas vende caldo de pollo y en las noches antojitos. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 5 kilos de arroz, 5 pollos, 15 menudencias, 6 paquetes de galletas, 4 bolsas de caramelos, etc.

Rosa se siente feliz porque todo lo que ha logrado es gracias a su esfuerzo. Agradece a Dios por bendecir su negocio y por brindarle vida y salud.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the El Paraiso Community Bank, located at Jr. Lago Titicaca Nº 170-A, in the district of Calleria, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 46 years old and is the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom are grown up while 2 are still dependent on her. She is married, and her husband works independently of her. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of fuel. Currently she works selling food and snacks. She works seven days a week, in the morning selling chicken broth and in the evening selling snacks. With this loan of S/. 2,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 5 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 15 assorted items, 6 packets of cookies, 4 bags of candy, etc. Rosa feels happy because everything she has achieved is thanks to her hard work. She is thankful to God for blessing her business and for offering her life and good health.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 5 kilos of rice, 5 chickens, 15 assorted items, 6 packets of cookies, 4 bags of candy, etc.

loans.name: Inés

texts.fr: Y. Inés est une coiffeuse célibataire qui vend également les mèches et les produits cosmétiques. Elle est née le 10 aout 1977. Elle a commencé avec la vente des cartes de recharge et de pagnes et de tissus. Quand elle a reçu son prêt de Kiva en 2005, elle a ajouté les produits cosmétiques. Elle achète ses produits à Tokpa et à Lomé. Actuellement elle est entrain de construire une parcelle à côté d’elle pour avoir une vraie boutique coiffeuse.
texts.en:
Inés Y. is an unmarried hairdresser who also sells hair extensions and cosmetics. She was born on August 10, 1977. She started off with selling mobile phone cards, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), and fabrics. When she received her Kiva loan in 2005, she added cosmetics. She buys her goods in Tokpa and in Lomé. Currently, she is building on a plot of land next-door in order to have a real hair salon.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel G. y su esposo el Sr Clemente Delgado  tiene dos hijas que están estudiando la universidad, pero tiene un problema en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la comprar de útiles escolares y pago de colegiatura.
Doña María Isabel trabaja como operaria en una maquiladora y Don Clemente trabaja encargado de la construcción estos son los ingresos que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
