Mrs. Maria Isabel Gonzalez and her husband Mr. Clemente Delgado have two children that are studying at University, but they have a problem right now as they don’t have the money necessary to pay for school supplies and tuition. Maria Isabel works as an operator in an assembly plan and Clemente is in charge of construction as the source of income for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School support

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Mr. S., 38, and his wife Kheoun, 35, live together in a small village in Pursat Province. They have been married for a number of years, and they have four children; all four of them are students. S. presently drives a taxi motorbike for daily income through picking up passengers, whilst his wife is a grocery seller. S. now faces a problem that his old motorbike often is broken so he can't attract as many clients as before. Therefore, he would like to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike to replace his old one. The loan will help them have more income to sustain their family's living expenses adequately.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to use as a taxi

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline R. lives at Sapang Dalaga, MIsamis, Occidental, Philippines. She is 31 years old and married to Joseph R.. They were blessed with 2 children; both are not yet in school. She is an active and regular member in Paglaum Cooperative. Her husband is a fish and ballot vendor in their place. They have also a sari-sari (convenience) store with starting capital of Php 10,000 and have operated it for almost 10 years already. The business establishment is situated in the middle of their barangay (township).
	
Apparently, the business status is progressive. They are requesting Php 14,000 for additional grocery items. With the help of her husband the business grows. All their daily needs are taken care of from their business income and they are preparing for the future of their siblings. As for the loan they are requesting, it will help them to have more capital to buy more stock for their business because they are planning to extend their sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: additional capital for purchase of grocery Items

loans.name: Fazliddin

texts.ru: Клиет Юсупов Фазлиддин в возрасте 36-ти лет, проживающий в Абдурахмони Чоми.Женат имеет 3-их детей, образования среднее.Клиент занимается животноводствотм более 6 лет, у него имеется несколько бычков. На полученные деньги клиент хочет купить пару молодух телят. Клиет откармливает телят и продаёт, это помагает ему содержать семью.
texts.en:
Client Fazliddin Y. is 36 years old and lives in Abdurahman Jami. He is married and the father of three children, and has a high school education. He has raised livestock for over six years, and has several bull calves. He would like to use the funds received to buy a pair of young calves. Feeding then selling the calves will help him to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis B. is 35 years old, married, and has two children. All of his kids currently attend school. Francis sells a variety of hardware materials, such as paint, nails, and roofing. He has run his business for over twenty years. He purchases his supplies from importers in the greater Accra of Ghana at wholesale prices, and then resells his merchandise at retail value. Francis is extremely committed to his work and wants to increase his stock of materials to meet the increased demand for customers. He hopes to use his income to continue the schooling of his children and contribute to the family income.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros and Ernesto are blessed with six children: their eldest is Jomel - 15 years old, a fourth year high school student; Mary Grace - 13 years old, a third year high school student; Mary – Ann - 12 years old, a first year high school student; April Joy - 10 years old and Aries - 8 years old, both in grade school, and Anthony - 5 years old. They live a simple and happy life in Barangay Del Pilar, Cabatuan Isabela.

She is 44 years old. Her husband is working in the municipal health office as a utility worker. She has been engaged in the vending business for almost five years. She sells different vegetables and snacks in their village using her tribike (a bike with three wheels). She wants to expand her business and for her to do that, she would like a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos. This amount will be of great help in her business for its continuing growth.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Makhsudkhuja

texts.en:
E. Makhsudkhuja is 42 years old. He is married with 3 children. Makhsudkhuja is a farmer. He plants onions, potatoes, and other vegetables. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. At the same time he raises cattle at his house.

Thanks to his savings, Makhsudkhuja was able to arrange the marriage of his elder son. His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, he would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve Makhsudkhuja’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, and calves

loans.name: Djiguiya 2 De  Diossébougou.(Koumantou) Group

texts.fr:
Vivant en majorité dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, toutes les femmes du groupe Djiguiya 2 sont mariées avec une moyenne  d’âge de 38 ans et de 7 enfants. Elles résident dans le  village de Diossébougou, dans la commune rurale de Koumantou (région de Sikasso en république du Mali).
A travers des relations agricoles et de parenté elles se sont connues. Elles exploitent plus de six hectares par campagnes en diverses cultures.(maïs, arachide, sorgho petit mil, pois de terre etc.). 
Pour redynamiser leurs relations et augmenter leur productivité agricole, ces femmes ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
 Elles sont à leur troisième prêt agricole et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce prêt servira à acheter, 20 daba pour les semis et le sarclage, 50 kg de semence d’arachide et 12 sacs d’engrais (dont 4 sacs de complexe et 8 sacs d’urée) tout cela pour faire 1,5 hectare d’arachide, 3 hectares de sorgho et 2 hectares de petit mil. Les produits sont achetés auprès des commerçants grossistes de Koumantou. La production attendue est de, 1 tonne 155 kg de graine d’arachide, 7 tonnes 500kg pour le sorgho et  4 tonnes  pour le petit mil. En fin de campagne, les récoltes sont vendues en détail, en gros et au comptant sur les marchés de Bougouni et Koumantou à une  clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 50 000 FCFA chacune en fin de campagne qui  servira à entretenir leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Mostly living in extended traditional families, the women of the Djiguiya 2 group are all married and have an average age of 38 with, on average, 7 children. They reside in the village of Diossébougou, in the rural community of Koumantou (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali).

They met through farming or through being related to each other. They cultivate more than 6 hectares each season with diverse crops (maize, peanuts, sorghum, native millet, potatoes, etc.). In order to enliven their relationships and increase their agricultural productivity, these women decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their third rural loan and both the preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

This loan will be used to buy 20 "daba" hoes for planting and weeding, 50 kg of peanut seeds and 12 sacks of fertilizer (that is, 4 sacks of complex fertilizer and 8 sacks of urea), all this with the intention of cultivating 1.5 hectares of peanuts, 3 hectares of sorghum, and 2 hectares of native millet. The products will be purchased from the wholesalers in Koumantou. The expected yield is 1 ton 155 kg of shelled peanuts, 7 tons 500 kg of sorghum and 4 tons of native millet. After the harvest, the produce will be sold retail or wholesale, for cash, at the markets of Bougouni and Koumangou to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make a profit of 50,000 F CFA at the end of the planting season, which will be used to support their children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of seeds, minor agricultural material, and entrants

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda and Ernesto M. are a couple who help each other in struggling through life’s difficulties. They make farming and vending as their sources of income. They live in the village of Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. The highest education they attained is only high school because of early marriage. At present, they have four children and do all their best to support their children’s studies in order for them to have better living opportunities someday.

Rhoda is requesting the amount of PHP 10,000 for her vending business. She also wants to put up a sari-sari store (a typical village store) in their village to increase her family’s daily income. She sacrifices to roam every house in their village just to sell vegetables and other vending products she is able to sell. Rhoda believes that with their patience and hard work, they can surpass the hardships of life, of course with the help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as business capital

location.town: Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Grover Gerardo

texts.es:
"Don Grover, trabaja de barman en el café La Terraza, del cual recibe un sueldo y propinas, a parte de esta actividad trabaja en sociedad con su hermano con la venta de café capuchino, jugo de naranja en las diferentes ferias importantes que se realizan en todo el país a través del alquiler de stands.

El destino del dinero está dirigido a la compra de una cafetera más grande de una maquina para hacer espuma para la preparación del capuchino."
texts.en:
Don Grover works as a bartender in the cafe "La Terraza" where a base salary and tips. Aside form his work at the cafe he works among society with his brother, selling capuccino and orange juice by renting stands in the different fairs that occur all over the country. This money will be directed to the buying of a larger coffee maker and a machine for making the foam necessary for capuccino.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing capital

loans.name: Yesenia Marizol

texts.es: La Maestra Marizol es originaria D. la zona cuatro del departamento D. Totonicapán   es graduada D. maestra primaria rural  D. la gloriosa ENRO viene ejerciendo su actividad como docente en la escuela oficial del Municipio D. Totonicapán  en jornada Matutina y por las tarD. es la encargad D. un hogar comunitari en la misma localidad y los fines D. semana esta estudiando  y la cual neseita D. un credito para la presentacion D. un conferencia  a Nivel occidental y la cual no cuenta con el efectivo y por ello necesita el apoyo D. ASDIR en un credito para que dicha actividad sea realizada.
texts.en:
Professor Marizol is originally from area #4 in the Totonicapán District. She graduated with a degree in rural elementary education from the renowned ENRO. She teaches in the mornings at the official school for the town of Totonicapán, and in the afternoon she manages a community home in the same area. On the weekends, she is studying for a presentation at a conference on western education. She needs a loan to pay for her conference expenses because she does not have the funds at the moment. Therefore, she needs the support of Asociación ASDIR so that she will be able to attend.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Conference expenses

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a member of the Mlandege borrower group in Ilala,Morogoro,she is 45 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 19 and 10 years.

Rebeca started her own clothing business selling clothes 5 years ago,she works 5 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Rebeca`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Rebeca hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha S., age 41 (pictured with her daughter), is widow with two sons and three daughters. Two of them were married and live outside the family home and other three are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chantha has been growing rice on her own farmland in the village since 1989, a skill she learned from her parents.  She doesn’t have money to buy a motorized hand tiller for her farming business, that’s why she is applying for a loan of $1,000 to make the purchases.

loans.use: To purchase a motorized hand tiller for farming.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. Gloria has been in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Having successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, Gloria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be Gloria's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amena Group

texts.en: Amena is the group leader of Amena group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their business. There requested a loan of 25,000 Afghani.Amena and Nawid want to take a loan for there business of tailoring. And Garan Aqa wants to take a loan for his business of taxi driver. There expand and progress for their business. Also Fahem Ahmad wants to take a loan for his business of color selling. He wants to make larger his business. With this loan they can make larger their business and support their families and make better future for their families they are really happy with this process in this poor country.

loans.use: they make larger their businee

loans.name: Belinda

texts.pt:
Belinda M. nasceu em Magude (distrito localizado no norte da província de Maputo), tem 51 nos de idade, viúva e mãe de 03 filhos todos maiores de idade e já casados. Estudou ate 4 classe parou de estudar quando foi ao lar. Para alem dos filhos sustenta uma sobrinha que vive com ela.

Saiu de Magude com seu marido quando este foi transferido pelos serviços para trabalhar na cidade de Maputo.
Ė Comerciante permanente a mais de 05 anos e faz 08 horas diárias, trabalha pessoalmente não tem nenhum empregado. Aprendeu a fazer o negócio por iniciativa própria logo depois de perder o seu marido, o seu rendimento vária de 6.000,00mt a 7.000,00mt com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum para investir no seu negócio e no melhoramento da sua qualidade de vida. 

Nunca trabalhou com nenhuma outra instituição de crédito e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, no valor de 10.000,00mt com o qual pretende aumentar a mercadoria para responder a procura que é cada vez crescente e consequentemente o seu rendimento. Vende refrigerantes, bebidas e outros produtos. 

Conheceu a HLUVUKU-ADSEMA graças a um vizinho que também é cliente da instituição. Compromete-se a pagar bem o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros financiamentos para ligar agua e mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Belinda M. was born in Magude (district located in the north of the province of Maputo). She is 51 years old, widow, and mother of three children, all of them adults and married. She studied up to the 4th grade and stopped when she became a housewife. Besides her children, she supports a niece who lives with her.

She left Magude with her husband when he was transferred at his work to Maputo. She has been a retailer for more than 5 years, and works 8 hours a day. She works by herself and has no employees. She learned to do business by herself after she lost her husband. Her earnings vary from MZN 6,000 to MZN 7,000, with which she supports her family and saves some money to invest in her business, as well in improving her living quality.

She has never worked with another credit institution and this is her first loan from Hluvuku-Adsema, of MZN 10,000. With this loan, she intends to increase her inventory to meet the increasing demand, and consequently raise her earnings. She sells sodas, beverages and other products.

She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema thanks to a neighbor, who is also one of the institution’s clients. She commits to repay well the loan in order to reach new ones so that she can have running water and furnish her house.


Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and selling of products

loans.name: God Is Good Group

texts.en:
The God is Good Group is made up of Isatu C., Mariatu C., Aminata M. and Joya S.. These four women are seeking a loan of 2 million LE from SMT (a partner of Shine On Sierra Leone, Waterloo) and Kiva lenders in order to invest in their existing businesses.

Isatu (right) is the group leader. She is 48 years old and has owned a business selling a variety of household goods including palm oil, wood, and charcoal for over twenty years.

Isatu has five children who attend school. Her husband has recently fallen ill and is forced to stay home, making Isatu the primary breadwinner for the household. With her portion of the loan, she hopes to expand the inventory she holds in her stall to bring more income back to the home.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her business

loans.name: Iliana María

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce del departamento de León, la señora Iliana se dedica a atender su propia pulpería que posee en su casa de habitación desde hace dos meses ofreciendo todo tipo de productos comestibles como pan simple, pan dulce, golosinas, salsas, refrescos. También ofrece productos personales y para el hogar como son shampo, cepillos dentales, pastas, jabones, entre otros.

Sus inicios en el negocio fueron muy difíciles porque vendía solamente golosinas y no adquiría muchos ingresos pero por ser una persona muy esforzada, continuó trabajando arduamente para mejorar su situación. Es importante destacar que ella es madre soltera y con un pequeño hijo en edad escolar al que tiene la responsabilidad de brindarle los estudios y suplir todas sus necesidades.

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para comprar los productos para la pulpería entre los que se encuentran los comestibles como pan, golosinas, salsas y también los productos personales como jabones, shampo y pastas dentales. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente porque abastece la pulpería y da lugar a la obtención de ganancias para continuar manteniendo su hogar y beneficiar a su pequeño hijo que depende de ella.
texts.en:
In the town of El Sauce in the department of León, Sra. Illiana manages the grocery store located in her home that she started two months ago. She offers all types of food items such as basic bread, sweet bread, candy, sauces, and soft drinks. In addition she offers personal and household products such as shampoo, toothbrushes, toothpaste, soap, and other items.

The start of her business was very difficult because she only sold candy and did not generate much profit. Illiana is a brave woman, so she continued to work hard to improve her situation. She is a single mother with a young son in school, so she has the responsibility to provide for his education and supply all of his needs.

Illiana is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to buy products for her store. These include foods such as bread, candy, sauces, as well as personal products such as soap, shampoo, and toothpaste. She will benefit greatly from this loan because restocking her store will lead to profits that will allow her to maintain her household and support the young son who is dependent on her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Aïchatou Elise

texts.fr: D. Aïchatou Elise est née en 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à FOLY Narcisse, Aïchatou Elise est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Aïchatou Elise a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses enfants. Aïchatou Elise vit depuis trois ans à Cococodji, non loin de Cotonou, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Aïchatou Elise a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, et a appris la coiffure. Depuis près de 8 ans, Aïchatou Elise exerce ce métier. Aïchatou Elise vend également des produits cosmétiques et des mèches dans son atelier de coiffure à Cococodji. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin, que Aïchatou Elise s'approvisionne. Aïchatou Elise a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. En vue d'agrandir davantage son activité afin de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Aïchatou Elise sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Aïchatou Elise D. was born in 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Narcisse Foly, Aïchatou Elise is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. Aïchatou Elise takes care of another child in addition to her own children. For three years, Aïchatou Elise has lived in Cococodji, not far from Cotonou, with her children and husband. Together, the couple supports the family. Aïchatou Elise dropped out of high school and learned to do hair. For 8 years, she has worked as a hairdresser. She also sells cosmetic products and locks of hair in her hairdresser's shop in Cococodji. She buys her supplies In Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin, and in Lomé, Togo, a country bordering Bénin. She previously received one loan from ALIDé which she repaid in full. Wanting to expand her business and meet more customers' needs, Aïchatou Elise is asking for another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 Cartons of Cosmetics and 5 Dozen Locks of Hair

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en: Silvard M. lives in Sevan with her husband and two daughters. She and her family run their own business in a private shop. They sell food, and every month they make approximately $970 in income from their business. With the profit from this business Silvard’s family fills all of their needs. Silvard needs a loan of 600.000 AMD to buy a New Year’s assortment of candy and beverages. With her future income she intends to add household goods to her store.

loans.use: To buy candy and beverages for New Years

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is excited about taking out a Kiva loan. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria, where she sells bed sheets at the market. She is 29 years old and married, with five children. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more lightly-used bed sheets to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more used bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel C.
texts.en: Manuel C.

loans.use: Buy farming supplies

loans.name: Libertadores Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL LIBERTADORES

Los 11 integrantes  D. L. Alcancia Comunal "LIBERTADORES" son organizados y se reúnen puntualmente. Ellos se agruparon para acceder a un crédito que les permita invertir en su negocio.
Tienen diferentes negocios que con mucho esfuerzo pueden brindarles lo mejor a sus familias. Como es el caso D. L. socia Zenobia, es casada hace 16 años tiene 2 menores hijos, Zenobia se dedica a L. venta D. salchipapas por las noches ya que durante el día tiene que ocuparse D. sus hijos, esto le permite aportar para L. alimentación D. su familia; el crédito recibido lo invertirá en algunos productos que le hace falta para atender a sus fieles clientes.
El Sr David es el secretario del grupo, viendo L. necesidad D. su familia opto por iniciar un negocio que le permita sustentar los gastos en casa,  se dedica a L. costura D. Jean,  2 personas lo ayudan. Como todo negocio al principio fue difícil,  pero con mucho esfuerzo su negocio se estabilizó, ahora se preocupa por L. educación y alimentación D. sus 3 menores hijos. 
Hace varios años Sonia pudo comprar un carro juntamente con su pareja para trabajar en transporte público, aunque a veces ese negocio tiene sus bajas,  pero elL. sigue adelante para poder mantener a sus 3 hijos. 
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el apoyo que les brinda Edaprospo  y las personas que intervienen en el financiamiento como son los prestatarios D. KIVA.
texts.en:
LIBERATORS COMMUNCAL BANK The 11 members of the Liberators Communal Bank are organized and meet punctually. The group formed to take out a loan that allows them to invest in their business. They have different businesses that, with a great deal of work, can offer the best to their families. Take the case of Zenobia, who has been married for 16 years and has 2 minor children. Zenobia sells salchipapas (combination of sausage and French fries) at night, since she takes care of her children during the day. This allows her to contribute to feeding her family. She will invest the loan in commodities needed to serve her loyal customers. David is the group’s secretary. Seeing his family’s need, he decided to set up a business that allows him to keep expenses at home. He sews jeans, and 2 people help him. As is true with any business, the startup was difficult, but with a lot of hard work, his business stabilized, and he now concerns himself with raising and feeding his 3 minor children. Several years ago, Sonia was able to buy a car along with her partner, to work in public transportation. Although business is down at times, she forges ahead, in order to support her 3 children. The members are grateful for support offered by Edaprospo, and those who participate in the financing, such as kiva lenders.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Daniel Bolivar

texts.en:
Mr. Daniel Bolivar is 58 and married. He and his wife live in a cement home in Guayaquil with all the basic services. He started a small store in his home 10 years ago and has continued to grow the store over the years. Now, he and his wife also bake and sell fresh bread in the store.

Daniel and his wife work everyday from 5:00 am to 10:00 pm. They have five children together with ages ranging from 10 to 30. The two youngest children live at home and attend school. The youngest wants to be a doctor. One difficulty of their business is that the suppliers won`t deliver merchandise to their home because it is not in a safe neighborhood and because of the delinquency rate in the area.

With the loan, Daniel is planning to buy broken washing machines, refrigerators, etc. that he will fix and then re-sell in his store for a profit. He would love to give his daughter the opportunity to be a doctor someday.

loans.use: To buy broken washers, refrigerators, etc. to fix

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
El Sr Cirilo  tiene 47 años, está casado con  la Sra Gregoria Sanchez ,ellos; tienen 5   hijos mayores .
Don Cirilo se dedicó en el rubro de la olería con un tío y aprendió este oficio, y con un poco de capital logro abrir su propio negocio .
El crédito será de gran  ayuda para la compra de mercaderías  en  cantidad y así abaratar el costo del mismo. 
EL  anhelan poder ampliar su negocio y dar mas trabajo a las personas de su barrio.
texts.en:
Sr. Cirilo is 47 years old and married to Sra. Gregoria Sanchez. They have five grown children. Don Cirilo has been making clay bricks with his uncle, from whom he learned this trade. With a little bit of capital, he was able to open his own business.

This loan will be of great help in purchasing materials in quantity, thereby lowering the cost. He hopes to expand his business and provide more work to people in his neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clay for making bricks

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Yamileth Del Carmen se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa usada, la cual vende en su casa y también de forma ambulante. Ella actualmente es casada, tiene 50 años y tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace seis años, lo que ella hacía en ese tiempo era comprar  en Managua y salir a vender, ya que los precios de los artículos de vestuario son más caros. Ya que sus ventas son en su mayoría al crédito, a recuperarse en 15 días, lo mas 30 días. Actualmente está solicitando este crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de 2 pacas de ropa usada, ya que desea diversificar el producto que actualmente esta ofreciéndole a sus clientes. Ella sueño es establecer una tienda grande en el mercado de Managua en que pueda vender ropa al por mayor, esto con el propósito de dejarles algún día a sus hijos un negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Doña Yamileth Del Carmen is dedicated to the business of selling used clothing, which she sells from home and also door-to-door. She is currently married, 50 years old and has three sons, all of them grown up. She started this business six years ago; what she did then was to buy clothes in Managua and go out to sell, since the prices of the articles of clothing are more expensive. Most of her sales are on credit, and are collected in 15 days, or 30 days at the latest. Currently she is requesting this credit to invest in the purchase of two bundles of used clothing, since she wishes to diversify the products she is currently offering her customers. Her dream is to establish a large store in the Managua market where she can sell clothing in bulk, this with the purpose of leaving her sons with a well established business.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Enos

texts.en: Enos is 35 years old and married with three children. He runs taxi business to earn a living. Previously he used bicycles but now he uses a motor cycle. He was able to make the change because of a loan of kes 40,000 that Faulu Kenya offered him. He saves his money with his group members named Fumulia in Faulu Kenya which enables him to access loans. He has requested a loan of kes 80,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy another motor cycle. In ten years time, he hopes to have several motor cycles for his business.

loans.use: To buy a motor cycle

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Víctor M. R., tiene la edad de 30 años, está soltero y vive solo. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vaca, la idea es aumentar el número de animales que tiene en la finca. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Además, desea darle mantenimiento a las hortalizas que posee, las cuales están en muy buen estado.Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Víctor trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura y también con el ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Víctor M. R., 30, is single and lives alone. He wants funds to buy a cow in order to increase the size of his cattle herd on his farm. He wants to provide proper care for his cattle so that they will command the best possible prices when time to sell them comes. Besides, he wants to provide maintenance for the vegetable crops he has which are in good condition. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms offered. Víctor has been a farmer and cattleman for several years. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and improved economic stability in order to continue developing as a person and as a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vegetable crop maintenance and to buy cattle.

loans.name: Latifan's Group

texts.en:
Latifan is a 50 year-old married woman with five children. She lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan.

She is an active lady. Despite her old age she involves herself in a shoe making and selling business. This has become her family business. They all make the shoes and then sell them to the shoe shops. Her two daughters stay at home and manage the household chores and cook the food for the family.

They don't make just simple shoes – they also make embroidered shoes. Their earning range up to 10-15000 PKR every month.

Latifan is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase material (glue, nails, leather and thread) so she can take orders from more shoe shops and increase her profits.

She hopes to marry her elder son and daughter with the profitable amount.

loans.use: To purchase material to make shoes to sell.

loans.name: Srey Lin's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Lin B. is 30 years old and is the leader of group loan who was selected by the other four members, located in Deum Kor village in Kandal province. Each of the members will use loans to support their different purposes. Mrs. Srey Lin B. is a pillow maker who can earn a small income to support her family. For this business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pillow-making supplies to support her business. Her husband, Mr. Zoeu Dy Ny, is a teacher who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has two children; one is attending the local school while the younger one is two years old.

loans.use: To buy pillow-making supplies

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina lives with her family in the city of Multan, famous for its sweetmeats and saints' places. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and she supports him by running a boutique in her home. Her embroidered dresses are famous among her relatives and within her community. She is excellent at her work and receives a good amount of orders from her neighbors. Despite her elderly age, she works with energy and enthusiasm. This is the reason for the success of her business: she takes good orders from her customers and completes them on time. Her daughters have the advantage of learning this art from her and every day she teaches them a new embroidery technique.

Samina has applied for a loan from Asasah / Kiva for her husband. He will use the loan amount to overhaul and maintain his rickshaw. She is hopeful that by repairing the rickshaw, her husband will be able to work better and bring more money home.

loans.use: Repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita P. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old, is widowed, and has seven adult children. Pacita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling coconut shells in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 9,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Pacita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan K. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old and is married with two adult children. Susan owns and operates a specialized retail store, culturing and selling flowers. Susan has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She is also starting to invest in a sari-sari (variety) store business in the local community. In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and uses as working capital. Susan is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Marling Norelly

texts.es: Mailing Norelly tiene la edad de 24 años, Ella se dedica a la actividad económica como es el la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ella pagaba por la ropa que compraba era el doble así descubrió que este negocio es muy rentable, por lo que ya tiene experiencia en financiamiento. El negocio al principio fue difícil porque no tenía capital, suficientes su primer préstamo lo invirtió para comprar algunas prendas como camisas, pantalones y blusas, la ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda. Solicita este financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar una gran variedad de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Marling Norelly is 24-years-old. For over 6 years she's sold merchandise general merchandise. When she first paid for her clothes she realized that they were marked up to double their value, and that retail was a profitable business, especially because she already had finance experience. The business was difficult at first because she didn't have sufficient capital. She invested her first loan in the purchase of garments such as shirts, pants, and blouses. Her business is located in her modest home. She's asking for this loan to purchase a great variety of garments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Filemón

texts.es:
El Sr. Filemón es casado, tiene dos  hijos,  todos  en edad escolar.
Él se dedica a la venta de mercería de forma ambulante  por las colonias, la misma cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.
Su actividad consiste en comprar las mercaderías del mercado de la ciudad y salir por las ciudades aledañas para ofrecer y vender a los clientes.
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos  brindarle todo el apoyo necesario en sus emprendimientos.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería en gran cantidad como, harina, fideos, arroz, productos de limpieza, enlatados y poductos de basicos para boticos, y muchos accesorios para el cabello, articulos de libreria,y otros.
texts.en:
Filemón is married and has two school-age children. He is a traveling salesmen in nearby neighborhoods, his sales are increasing and generating a good income. He buys merchandise in the city´s market and then goes out to surrounding cities to offer products and sell to customers. With his wife´s help, they are moving forward with a lot of sacrifice and effort. Today he is a successful businessman with a loyal and large clientele because of his kindness. He has proven to be honest and responsible with his commitments which is why we are giving him all the support he needs for his endeavors. He is requesting a loan to buy bulk quantities of merchandise such as flour, pastas, rice, cleaning products, canned goods and basic goods for drugstores as well as haircare products, stationery supplies and others.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bulk quantities of flour, oil, cleaning products, canned goods, pastas, rice and basic goods for drugstores, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the village of Minlasag, Sibutad. She is 51 years old, widowed and has four children, two of whom are adullts and two who are school-aged. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional capital for her business. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for house repairs. This will be the sixth loan that Elizabeth has taken out from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for house repairs

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Very hard-working and determined to own a big farm in his home area of Kibirizi, Rukungiri, M. Gordon, aged 36 years, is a peasant farmer who grows food crops, owns a banana plantation, and normally sells off his produce to grocery and restaurant business dealers. 

 At length, he has built a strong determination that has played into his hands, and with hard working skills, he has gotten for his 4-year-old enterprise a dependable niche. Monthly profits to the tune of 100,000 Ugandan shillings is what he has been getting from banana and milk sales. With this loan he hopes to purchase fertilizers to help improve his agriculture and other farm inputs for the next season. This will in turn improve his yields, hence sales revenue will rise and he will be able to live a more satisfying life and educate his children, which is his main goal.

loans.use: agricultural farm inputs like fertilizers

loans.name: Cruz Manuel

texts.es:
Cruz Manuel tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Cruz Blanca del distrito de Túcume, un distrito conocido en el norte por su atractivo turístico ya que en su territorio se erige un complejo de 26 pirámides cuya construcción data de épocas preincaicas. La zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para efectuar servicio de transporte). El cubre las rutas Puente El Pavo – Granja Sasape todos los días y ofrece su servicio a los pobladores que se movilizan diariamente por esta ruta. Como el número de personas que transitan por esta vía es elevado y constante, su negocio siempre cuenta con una clientela y demanda estable.

Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores y su esposa cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su vivienda. Con estos ingresos se encargan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia. Cruz desea brindar mantenimiento y realizar algunas reparaciones en su mototaxi ya que esta ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas debido al constante uso de su unidad móvil. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1800 nuevos soles.

Cruz es una persona responsable y bastante entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cruz Manuel is 47 years old, is married and lives with his wife and three children in the Cruz Blanca district of Túcume, a district known in the north for its tourist attractions because there are 26 pre-Incan pyramids located within its territory.  The zone is a part of the Lambayeque province and is located 55 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Cruz provides transportation services for passengers and cargo from his moto-taxi (a modified motorcycle with a passenger compartment added to it).  He covers the Puente El Pavo – Granja Sasape route every day and offers his service to villagers who travel daily along that route.  Because the number of people who travel on that road is constant and increasing, he can count on a steady customer demand.

He also raises and sells small animals and his wife has a small store in their home.  These incomes allow them to move their family ahead financially.

Cruz wants to do maintenance and make some repairs to his moto-taxi, now that it has started to malfunction due to its constant use.  In order to do this, he has seen fit to request his first loan of 1,800 PEN ($650) through Edpyme Alternativa.

Cruz is a responsible person, very dedicated to his family.  His greatest desire is to continue to grow as an entrepreneur and provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Rubén D. V. R. es taxista actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años, en este momento el requiere de un préstamo para comprar las partes de su carro para arreglarlo pues se encuentra fallando por lo que  no quiere que el problema se agrave y le salga mas caro. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos es por ello que pide el apoyo para poder seguir trabajando y ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rubén D. V. R. is a taxi driver and has been for the past 6 years.  He currently needs a loan to purchase parts to fix his car because it is not working properly.  He does not want the problem to get worse and end up costing him more.  This business is his source of income which is why he is asking for help so that he can continue to work and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Philo Efua Twento

texts.en: Philo Efua Twento A. is a widow taking care of four children. She has not attained any formal education.  Philo smokes fish at Abura for sale. She sees to the well-being of her children with the income she makes from her sales. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Philo hopes to further her childlren’s education.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
La persona que esta en la imagen es la esposa de Mariano 

Mariano M. Guzmán es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que a pesar de la crisis económica el sigue adelante, desde hace un año entre el y su esposa se dedican a vender ropa usada en su propia casa para incrementar sus ingresos para poder cubrir sus gastos, por lo que ello quiere comprar mercancía de temporada para que sus venta no bajen.
texts.en:
The person in this picture is Mariano's wife.

Mariano M. Guzmán is a very hard-working and enterprising person who, in spite of the economic crisis, has managed to keep going.  For one year, he and his wife have been selling used clothes from their own home to increase their income and thereby cover their expenses.  Mariano would like to buy seasonal merchandise so that his sales don't fall.

loans.use: To stock his business

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam, resiD. en Guatajiagua, departamento D. Morazán, donD. vive con su esposo y seis hijos: Ever D. 18 años, Kevin D. 12, Jimmy D. 10, Franklin D. 7 años, Marvín D. 4 años y Liliana D. 2 años D. edad, Miriam se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización D. comales  y ollas D. barro, tiene 36 años D. edad, este oficio lo aprendió hace más D. 20 años cuando su madre se dedicaba a esta actividad, hoy día es su fuente D. ingreso y lo hace en un horario D. 8:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella quiere comprar barro, leña, nacazcol y loza para elaborar comales y ollas para la venta, y solicita un préstamo para realizar esta compra poder preparar los productos para la comercialización, con este préstamo aumenta el movimiento del negocio creando más productos y ofreciendo a los clientes para poder tener mejores ventas e ingresos para su familia, ya que es granD. y debe ver la manera D. ir aumentado poco a poco los ingresos.
Su visión es que a través del crecimiento del negocio pueda generar dinero para arreglar poco a poco su vivienda y vivir más cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam lives in Guatajiagua, in Morazán department with her husband and six children: 18 year-old Ever, 12 year-old Kevin, 10 year-old Jimmy, 7 year-old Franklin, 4 year-old Marvín and 2 year-old Liliana.  Miriam makes and sells 'comales' (flat earthenware pans for cooking tortillas) and earthenware pots.

Miriam is 36 years old.  She learned her traD. more than 20 years ago when her mother was in the business.  Today it is her main source of income and she works from 8.00am to 5.00pm.

Miriam would like to buy clay, firewood and nacazcol (a dye) so that she can make 'comales' and pans to sell.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy her material and prepare her products for sale.  With this loan she will increase her business activity, creating more products to offer to her customers so that she can make more sales and make more income for her family since her family is large and she needs to see a way to make her income increase little by little.

Miriam's vision is to grow her business so that she can make more money with which to fix up her house bit by bit and thereby be able to live more comfortably with her family.

loans.use: To buy clay, firewood and nacazcol (a dye)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar V. M.  tiene 23 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la esposa y la hija,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Julio Cesar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar V. M. is 23 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and daughter in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Julio Cesar is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He buys his products in the García and López shopping areas and sells his products in the Vaca shopping area.  He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a farm.

Julio Cesar likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: José Alexander

texts.es:
José Alexander Garcia A. tiene 19 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  No Tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

José Alexander se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Agro servicios San Jacinto y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es formar un hogar

Le gusta trabajar en el campo, hacer deporte, y jugar video juegos.
texts.en:
José Alexander G. A., aged 19, is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has no children.

The members of the rural communal bank Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 12 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

José Alexander is a farmer. He grows corn and rice. He buys his agricultural supplies from Agro Servicios San Jacinto and sells his products at the same place.

He applies for a loan to finance his sowing of corn and rice. He needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help him to pay for the required supplies. He faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. His dream is to set up home and start a family. He likes working in the field, doing sport and playing video games.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and seeds

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: El Carmen es un grupo solidario conformado por Karen y Pía Bonifacia. Sus diferentes actividades económicas han hecho que salieran adelante. Pía se dedica a la venta de ropa, a pesar de su edad ha salido adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación que le brinda a su negocio. Karen se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, desde hace mas de 4 años juntas se han unido para realizar un financiamiento que sea destinado para la compra de materia prima para sus negocios. Ambas son personas muy emprendedoras que han disfrutado de obtener este medio de vida que es muy necesario.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “El Carmen” consists of Karen and Pía Bonifacia. Their various business activities have allowed them to get ahead. Pía sells clothing. Despite her age, she has been able to move forward due to the great effort and dedication that she brings to her business. Karen has been selling cosmetics for more than four years.

They have joined together in order to access a loan to buy merchandise for their businesses. Both women are enterprising individuals who enjoy their means of earning a living since they are necessary.

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire merchandise

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: La señora Eulalia se dedica a la venta de  Café, con el dinero del préstamo adquirirá mayor cantidad de Insumos para la elaboración y comercialización de café. Vive en casa propia la cual esta ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención, por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar la mercancía que  necesita.
texts.en: Eulalia sells coffee. With the money from the loan, she will purchase supplies for the production and the marketing of coffee. She lives in her own house which is located in the Alto San Pedro area in the city of La Paz. This is her primary source of income for supporting herself. For this reason, she is requesting this loan to buy the merchandise she needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the production and the marketing of coffee

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: Eliseo, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y amable, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro para poder forjarse un buen futuro. Cuando los primeros rayos de sol llegan al poblado de Punray (Pueblo de la provincia de Tarma), Eliseo en compañía de sus queridos padres, sale a trabajar sus tierras, las cuales quedan a una hora de camino. Sus tierras son muy fértiles, motivo por el cual la papa, arveja y maíz que siembra son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar sus cultivos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Eliseo, age 21, is a simple and friendly young man who lives at the home of his parents. What he desires most in life is to work hard so that he can create a better future. As soon as the first rays of sunlight reach the town of Punray (located in the province of Tarma), Eliseo and his loving parents leave their home to go work on their land, which requires an hour-long walk. Their land is quite fertile, which helps them grow potatoes, peas, and corn of good quality. What he enjoys most about his work is planting the land with great care. Eliseo has been farming for two years and considers the most difficult part to be fumigating his land. Going forward, he hopes to buy additional land so that he can increase his crop yield.

This is his first loan with MFP. Eliseo does not want to fall behind on his payments due to a lack of funds, so he saves what he needs to meet his obligations. In his Communal Bank, he is a responsible member who is respected by the others in his group. The loan of 1000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon O. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 48 years old. Ramon is separated from his spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ramon owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals like "escabeche," "adobo", "pancit bihon" & fish soups to customers in the local community. Ramon has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Ramon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramon is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ramon from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.

loans.name: Sombou

texts.en:
Mrs. Sombou K. (is in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Horn Hay, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and one daughter. 

Sombou is a weaver. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for another loan of $250 to purchase a cow for her sister to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her sister

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cupboard, living room suite, wardrobe, and bed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: invest in her business selling lingerie.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La señora Zenteno Tejerina Maria Elena tiene 24 años de edad y vive en un barrio de la ciudad de Tarija. Maria Elena es madre soltera tiene una hija. Maria Elena se dedica al comercio de verduras actividad que viene realizando desde hace mas de 6 años esta actividad la realiza en el mercado campesino pero tambien esta dedicandose a la confeccion de ropa de mujer, este trabajo le ha ayudado mucho porque como muchos la conocen y por eso le han traido por contrato para entregar muchas prendas, para ello necesita de telas, entretelas, forros, etc.
Maria Elena quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarle una mejor vida a su hija pero ella nos cuenta que quiere comprar mas material es por eso que el credito sera destinado para la compra de esta mercaderia para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.

Elena nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra de mas maquinaria de costura, porque al parecer esta actividad le genera mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elena Zenteno Tejerina, 24, lives in a neighborhood in the city of Tarija.  She is a single mother of one daughter.  María Elena has sold vegetables for over six years in the local farmers market but she also is starting to make women’s clothes.  This work has helped her quite a bit because, since she is well known by many, she’s been brought contracts to make many items.  In order to do so she needs fabric, lining and other dressmaking supplies.

María Elena wants to earn better income to provide a better life for her daughter but she tells us that she wants to buy more material and that’s what the loan will be used for, to buy this merchandise in order to increase her income this way.

Elena tells us that she wants to improve her living conditions and this is why she says that the next loan she will request will be to buy a sewing machine because it seems this activity will produce higher income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other dressmaking supplies.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a housewife who stays at home and carries out her household responsibilities. She is the mother of a five-year-old son who has not started his education yet. Naseem’s husband has a horse cart, with which he provides loading as well as transport services to his clients. He is a very efficient and hardworking person.
Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to buy a new cart for her husband because the current one has grown old and needs to be replaced. Her husband has been operating this business for the past 12 years and Naseem is hopeful that after purchasing a new cart her husband will be able to provide better services to his customers and increase his profits.
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: to buy a horse cart for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nyambwana

texts.en:
Nyambwana is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 4 years, Nyambwana has operated a grocery business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Nyambwana dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Nyambwana plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase sacks of onions and potatoes for sale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of onions and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Malita

texts.en:
Malita operates a retail shop and works six days a week. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her business like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil. Malita has been in her business for ten years. She doesn’t have any other side businesses. Her business challenges include transportation of merchandise from Kikuubo to her shop in Kamwokya. 

Malita is married with four children who go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. They live in a home that she rents and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and feeding the family. 

Malita hopes to see her business grow big so that she can start selling wholesale only and also own a delivery van to help with transportation. She decided to work with MCDT because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mahudjro 22 Group

texts.fr: MAHUDJRO 22 est un groupe de six personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La présidente du groupe, Florence (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un technicien du nom de Joachim. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Florence et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs deux enfants. Florence a très peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a six ans environs que Florence fait le commerce de boissons, de l’huile végétale et des cartes de recharges téléphoniques de façon secondaire à son domicile. Florence s’approvisionne au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Florence sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit avec les membres du groupe MAHUDJRO 22. Ce crédit lui servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits.
texts.en:
MAHUDJRO 22 is a group of six people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The group's president, Florence (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 29 years old and married to a technician named Joachim. They have two children who both attend school. Florence and her husband live together with their two children. 

Florence received minimal schooling. She started selling beverages and vegetable oil from her home six years ago. As a secondary activity, she also sells mobile phone recharge cards. Florence gets her stock in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. This business allows her to support herself and her children. 

In order to ensure customer satisfaction, Florence is seeking a third loan together with the MAHUDJRO 22 group. This credit will help her to replenish her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy beverages, vegetable oil and mobile phone recharge cards for resale

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
José de 61 años de edad, vive con su esposa  en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,ganadera y artesana.

José se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos) y aves de corral (pavos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puede ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga solventará los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia.  José es una persona trabajadora, responsable y que se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos.
texts.en:
José is 61 years old and lives with his wife in a home of his own, which has electricity but no other services.  It’s located in the rural district of Mórrope, part of the Lambayeque department.  This zone is known for its farming, livestock, and arts.

José has been raising and selling pigs and poultry for several years and raises them in a corral located behind his home.  He feeds them balanced feed and natural grain.  Once they are the optimal size, he is able to offer them to his clients and uses the money to pay the household expenses.

He has requested this loan of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa and will use the money to buy balanced feed for his animals, so he can fatten them up to sell at the different markets within the zone, where he can get better prices for them, thereby increasing his income and be able to move ahead with his family.  José is a hardworking, responsible person who cares about his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Ensueño Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Ensueño” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran atención de almacenes, venta de ropa en ferias libres, venta de comida rápida, amasandería, costuras y albañilería, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Colina, ciudad de Santiago.
Viviana presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, inclinada hacia delante apoyando su mano en una de sus piernas, vistiendo un chaleco color negro, jeans color celestes y su cabello está tomado. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente la venta de artículos para el hogar y venta de ropa. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 10 años, comenta que disfruta mucho lo que realiza. Su horario es de 8ºº a 16ºº horas, teniendo los días lunes y jueves  libres.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras, ya que resulta más conveniente comprar al por mayor. La ropa la compra de acuerdo a la temporada, durante éste tiempo su mercadería ha sido de invierno, por lo que le ha ido muy bien. 
Con el crédito comprará loza, vasos, paños, delantales y guantes de cocina, además de pantys, buzos y camisetas de polar.
Sus metas son establecerse en un local estable para expandir su negocio y posteriormente comprarse un vehículo que le permita trasladar su mercadería a los lugares más apartados. 
Viviana vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños son brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, entre esto una mejor calidad en su educación para formar profesionales. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, además disfruta gratamente de las reuniones realizadas al interior del grupo del banco comunal, ya que las demás socias son comprometidas, sociables y comparten sus distintas experiencias en cada uno de sus negocios. Respecto a las capacitaciones, considera que le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de organización para su negocio. 
Colina es una comuna de la región metropolitana (donde está Santiago, capital de Chile) ubicada al norte de la misma. Actualmente es centro de importantes inversiones, principalmente en el área agro industrial, debido a la instalación de grandes e importantes empresas, que de paso entregan un gran número de empleos a la comunidad. Es también un área de parcelaciones de agrado, lo que ha contribuido a aumentar considerablemente el número de habitantes. También cuenta con espacios adecuados al turismo, tales como termas, deporte en la Laguna Piedra Roja y montañismo.
texts.en:
The communal bank called Ensueño ("The Dream" ) is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, including general store retail, clothing sales in street markets, fast-food sales, selling baked goods, sewing, and construction. All of them live in the Colina municipality in the city of Santiago. 

Viviana, the president of the communal bank, is seen in the photo, standing in the first row on the far right. She is leaning forward with her hand on her leg, wearing a black pullover and light-blue jeans, with her hair up. She sells household items and clothing.  She has worked in this area for 10 years, and says that she really enjoys what she does. She works from 8:00am to 4:00pm, with Mondays and Thursdays off. She buys her merchandise from distributors, since she finds it better to buy at wholesale. She buys clothing according to the season. Lately, her merchandise has been for winter, so she has done very well.  With the loan she will buy crockery, glasses, cloths, aprons, kitchen gloves, as well as panties, tracksuits, and thermal pullovers. Her goals are to set up her business in a stable premises in order to expand, and later to buy a vehicle so that she can transport her merchandise to more out-of-the way places. 
    
Viviana lives with her husband and her two children, ages 7 and 2. Her dream is to provide them with a better quality of life, including better quality education leading to training in a profession. She is very happy and thankful for the loan obtained through Fondo Esperanza, and also very much enjoys the meetings of the communal bank group, since the other members are committed, friendly, and able to share their different experiences with each of their businesses. She believes that the training has helped her learn new strategies for organizing her business.

Colina is a municipality in the northern part of the Santiago metropolitan area (Santiago is the capital of Chile). Currently, it is the focus of significant investment, mainly in the area of agro-industry, due to the setting up of important large companies providing numerous jobs to the community. It's also an area where new sub-divisions are being built, which has contributed to a considerable increase in the population.  It also has areas for tourism, such as hot springs, sports at Piedra Roja Lake, and mountain climbing.

loans.use: To buy crockery, glasses, cloths, aprons, kitchen gloves, as well as panties, tracksuits, and thermal undershirts.

loans.name: Lyneth

texts.en:
Lyneth is 33 years old and married with four children. With all four children in school, Lyneth works very hard to provide for them.

Lyneth runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future Lyneth would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Otabek

texts.ru:
