Отабек честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и любящий 2 детей. Он занимается купля продажей продуктов питания. Он начал свой бизнес с продажей маскаронов и сахара. Постепенно его бизнес развивался, и он добавил много других ассортимента продуктов. Отабек хочет получит максимальный прибыль для содержании своей семьи и обучение своих детей. Он хотел бы получить займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки продуктов питания.  Отабек заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за их доброты и милосердие.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Otabek is an honest and goal-oriented person.  He is married and a loving father of two children.  He is involved in buying and selling food products.  He started his business with sales of pasta and sugar.  His business gradually grew, and he added many other assortments of products.  Otabek wants to maximize his profits in order to support his family and educate his children.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of food products.  Otabek is grateful in advance to all creditors for their kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a hardworking businessman aged 42. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last four years, he has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. He has grown his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya hence becoming more financially stable. In the next five years, he wants to become successful in his business. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 54 years old. A mixed crop farmer, she is widowed with one child aged 30 years. She has been in the farming business for the past seven years with the monthly income of KES 5,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Florence will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. 


With the anticipated profit from the business she will venture into pig rearing. Her hope is to buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Junalie

texts.en:
Junalie is 41 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years.

Junalie requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
Nelda is 47 years old and lives in Ponong, Larena, Siquijor. She is a single mother of one child.

Nelda sells of fresh fruits, spices and vegetables to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years.  Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables to sell in the market.

Nelda has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for five months.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: buy fruits, spices and vegetables

loans.name: Serzhik

texts.ru:
Сержик  родился 1983г. в  селе Н.Анд(N.Hand) Сюникской области. Имеет среднее образование.В данный момент работает в Капанской Дорожно-ремонтном управлении . Сержик женат и  имеет двух дочерей - трех и двух лет.  
Сельскохозяйственным бизнесом занимается почти 7 лет и имеет в деревне Н.Анд  собственый земельный участок где выращивает овощи. Кроме того у него есть крупно рогатый скот, свиньи ,пчелы(14 улей).Сержику в хозяйстве помогает его жена .Вместе с женой он реализует овощи из огорода на рынках Сюникской области а мясо, молоко и мед у него покупают постоянные скупщики прямо из дома .
Сержик получал  кредит от Kiva и раньше срока погасил его. Благодаря кредиту он добавил количество пчелиных улей и получил большой прибыль от продажи меда.
Сержику нужен кредит 700.000 армянских драмов, для покупки корма для свиней на зиму и для покупки новых улей.
texts.en:
Serzhik was born 1983 in the village in the Syunik region. He has a high school education and is working at the Kapan road-building management. Serzhik is married and has two daughters - three and two years old.

He has been engaged in agricultural business for almost seven years and owns the land where they grow vegetables. In addition, he has cattle, pigs, and 14 bee hives. Together with his wife, they sell vegetables from the garden in the markets of Syunik as well as meat, milk and honey that wholesalers purchase from his home.

Serzhik received a loan from Kiva and it paid off ahead of schedule. Thanks to the loan, he added the number of bee hives and got a big profit from the sale of honey. He is asking for a loan for 700,000 drams for the purchase of feed for pigs in the winter and to buy new hives.

loans.use: To buy feed for the pigs and  add the number of bee hives

loans.name: Feyrouz

texts.en: Feyrouz is a 50-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children, all of whom still attend school. Feyrouz has owned a women's beauty salon since 1998. Over the years, she was able to gain a good number of customers and was even able to hire one full-time employee. Due to some bad circumstances, Feyrouz is asking to borrow $2,500 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase cosmetics and a makeup trolley in order to reinforce and strengthen her business. In the future, she plans to open a new branch of her shop.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and a makeup trolley

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is taking another Kiva loan of 50,000 KES to boost his retail shop business. With the loan he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. He dreams of expanding his business into a wholesale shop in the future. Raphael is grateful to Yehu and Kiva lenders for providing loans to boost his business and his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Tessie has a shop from which she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & beverages.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & beverages.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Amauta Huamanga, es madre de 4 niños, y socia de FINCA Perú desde hace un año.
Paulina recientemente tiene un negocio de Internet, antes ella tenia una bodega pero no le fue bien y ahora tiene un Internet y espera que le vaya muy bien, gracias a las capacitaciones su vida familiar a mejorado mucho y ella se valora mas como mujer. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una computadora, y ahora su sueño es ahorrar mas y poder comprarse su casa.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the “Amauta Huamanga” Communal Bank, and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for the past year.

Paulina has recently opened an internet cafe business. Previously, she operated a restaurant but that didn't do well. So, now she has an “internet” and hopes that this will do better. Thanks to the training she has received, her family life has improved greatly and she values herself more as a woman. 

The loan Paulina requests will be invested in purchasing a computer. Now her dream is to save more and to be able to buy herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan, a 58-year-old father of 10, 4 of whom are still in school, has been farming for 31 years in his home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. He produces maize, milk and poultry products.

Duncan has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him boost his poultry business by buying more birds and expanding the housing unit. He adds that his many years in farming and poultry in particular have helped him acquire skills for managing the challenges of diseases, the high cost of feeds, and price fluctuations. He is very optimist about the prospects for growth and says he will use the income to educate his children.

Duncan urges Juhudi Kilimo to introduce education loans.

loans.use: To buy poultry and expand a poultry housing unit

loans.name: Martha Betulia

texts.es:
Martha Betulia tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene seis hijas.  Reside en el barrio El Centro en el municipio de Juticalpa.  Tiene una pupuseria donde trabaja con sus hijas desde las 8:00 am hasta las 8:00pm.  Comenzo hace 9 años vendiendo pupusas su necogio a crecido y ahora vende todo tipo de comida.  Su negocio es buen conocido y tiene muchos clientes.

Este prestamo lo solicita para la compra de materia prima para hacer diferentes comidas. Comprara refrescos, carnes, verduras, lacteos, jugos, huevos, condimentos, frijoles y arroz.  El prestamo le ayudara a crecer su negocio y sus ingresos para que puede ayudar a sus hijas en sus estudios ya que ellas no tienen un padre responsable que les ayude.  

Sus sueños son que su negocio sea mas grande y que sus hijas sean profesionales.  Martha ha sido una buena clienta de FAMA por mas de siete años y los prestamos le han ayudado a crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha Betulia is 45 years old. She is single and she has six daughters. She lives in the El Centro neighborhood in the city of Juticalpa. She has a pupuseria where she works with her daughters from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. Nine years ago, she started selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas). Her business has grown and now she sells all types of food. Her business is well known and has lots of customers. 

The loan she is requesting is for purchasing materials for making different foods. She will buy soft drinks, meats, vegetables, dairy products, juices, eggs, condiments, beans and rice. The loan will help her grow her business and profits. She will be able to help her children with their studies since they do not have a responsible father to help them. 

Her dreams are that her business will become bigger and that her daughters will be professionals. Martha has been good FAMA customer for more than seven years and the loans have helped her grow her business.

loans.use: purchase ingredients to make different types of foods.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, 48, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Nicomedes, an overseas contract worker, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband  manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Wilma operates a computer rental shop. In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents out computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Wilma is requesting a PHP26, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Wilma hopes to give her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for computer parts and accessories needed in her business

loans.name: Carmen Nelida

texts.es: La señora Carmen se dedica al servicio de costura desde hace 12 años,  necesita un préstamo para la compra de máquina de costura  ya que actualmente ella está viviendo sola y necesita aumentar sus ingresos y para ello necesita nueva máquina, y comprar más material  de costura. La señora Carmen al quedar sola después de su separación  está pasando por momentos difíciles, pero aun así  es perseverante en su trabajo. Ella está muy contenta de poder acceder a esta oportunidad y poder  seguir en el rubro de costura, ella vive en un domicilio en anticrético, gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo de esta manera demuestra que tiene  ganas de superación independiente, con la compra de la nueva  máquina podrá realizar más y diferentes trabajos de costura con lo cual podrá cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en: For 12 years Carmen has been making her living providing sewing services. She needs a loan to buy a sewing machine as she is currently living alone and needs to increase her income: to do so, she needs a new machine. As Carmen has been alone since her separation, she is going through a difficult moment but even still she is resolute in her work. She is very content to have been able to have access to this opportunity and continue working in the field of sewing. She lives in an anticrético [a Bolivian rental agreement in which the rent is paid up front] thanks to the hard work in which she shows a great desire to get ahead in life on her own. Through the purchase of this new machine, she will be able to more and different types of sewing items with which she will be able to cover her costs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials.

loans.name: Kipkering Koech

texts.en:
Kipkering is 57 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged between 29 and 20 years old. He has been into a dairy farming business for over ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 45,000.

This being his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, he intends to buy one more dairy cow to improve his income.

He anticipates he will pay school fees for his children from the expanded business profits. His dream is to expand his farm to increase productivity.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed, pesticide, and dewormers.

loans.name: Atanas

texts.en: Atanas M. is 33 years old. He has been working since he was thirteen. First he was a barman and then a manager of some restaurants and bars in the city. Since then he has dreamed to have it’s own bar. His father who is an auto fitter helped him realize his dream. So 6 years ago Atanas found a bar on one of the main streets of the city. Because of the seasonal character of this business he soon decided to start with trade and two yeas ago he found clothing shop in a visited market in the city. Because of the quality of the clothes that he sells and the business of the marketplace Atanas has many clients and this makes him think of opening another shop. He needs $ 2 000 for this purpose.

loans.use: For opening another shop

loans.name: Hau

texts.en: Mr Hau used to roast pork for his wife's business in the market of Đong Ha commune. But their pigs and cattle contracted hoof and mouth disease, which ruined their business. They produce a small amount of rice -- 1-2 tons a year, which does not provide enough money for them or their children to be properly nourished. They have a 2-month old daughter and two children in school. Sometimes their other older children are able to send a little money home, but not on a regular basis. Their modest house is placed at a busy intersection surrounded by a high concentration of people. Mr. Hau is requesting a loan for $75.00 from Thien Chi Center and KIVA so that they can open a small bazaar in their home which will draw customers from the dense population in their area, and increase their income so they can properly nourish and care for their children.

loans.use: To open a small bazaar

loans.name: Angélica

texts.en:
Mrs. Angélica is married and has two sons of 10 and 23 years old, and a daughter of 18 years old. Her husband is a bricklayer, but he only works seasonally. In order to supplement her income and to help her children to continue their schooling, six years ago Angélica started her own business. She opened a grocery store where she also sells flour tortillas that she made herself. This business took so much of her time that she decided to close it and only sell tortillas, while her daughter helps her with this. Together they have made the business prosper and little bit by little bit they have increased their customer base.

Angélica now requests a loan of $375 that she will use to buy wholesale supplies at a better price and to increase her profits. She commits to pay back the loan in 6 to 12 months.

This is the moment you can help someone that really needs it. The wellbeing of this family is in your hands; they are thankful for your consideration.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Angélica es casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 23 años de edad y una hija de 18 años. Su esposo es albañil pero trabaja solo por temporadas, para obtener un ingreso extra y ayudar a sus hijos a continuar en la escuela, Angélica inició su propio negocio hace seis años, abrió una tienda de abarrotes donde también vendía tortillas de harina que ella misma preparaba, este negocio le quitaba mucho tiempo por lo que decidió cerrar y dedicarse solo a la venta de tortillas, donde recibe la ayuda de su hija, juntas han hecho prosperar este negocio y poco a poco han estado incrementando sus clientes.

Ahora Angélica solicita un préstamo por $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de insumos en mayoreo para conseguir un mejor precio e incrementar sus ganancias, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Hoy es tiempo de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, en tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Hoji

texts.en:
B. Hoji is 49 years old, and she has a secondary-level education. She is married but her husband does not work.

B. Hoji previously worked as a cleaner in a hospital. She decided to start a business because the salary was not enough. She sells sport bags in the Panjshanbe bazaar. She has been in this business 6 years. She brings bags from Bishkek and Istaravshan. Her daughter helps to sell bags. B. wants to purchase a new model of bags from Bishkek and wants to introduce sport clothing. This loan will help her to obtain goods at moderate prices.

loans.use: To purchase a new model of bags and sport clothing.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
My name is Victor M., I produce and sell balconies for homes and offices. I have had my business for 5 years my clients are excellent because they like the quality of my work. Currently, I need to buy more material because I have a big project involving many houses and I have used all my capital to buy more material with the profits I will get I can feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Mi nombre es Victor M. me dedico a la produccion y venta de balcones para casas y oficinas, tengo mi negocio hace 5 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que les gusta la calidad de mi producto, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas material ya que tengo un proyecto de varias casas y se me ha terminado mi capital para comprar mas material, con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia

loans.use: compra de hierro, equipo de soldadura,  pintura, anticorrosivo,

loans.name: Ikoh

texts.en: Ikoh is 32 years old and married with two children, aged 13 and 5. She runs a business selling household goods such as cooking oil, rice, eggs, etc. Her husband, Asmita, is jobless and usually helps her run her shop everyday. Ikoh usually earns $1.50 per day in profit.  She is a member of MBK and needs a  loan to complete her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her shop

loans.name: Godbelther

texts.en:
This is Mama Jack (in reference to her eldest child and probably safer than using her real name, for which I can provide no translation or explanation!). Mama Jack makes and sells women’s clothing, usually long, flowing, kaftan-like dresses, made from beautiful batik cloth (what is often referred to as tie-dyed in the west). She requires a loan of $700 to purchase bulk bundles of plain cloth, as well as different dyes with which to create her creative creations! Mama Jack has already repaid one loan from SELFINA. She is married to Mchukya and has three children, Jackline, 9, Godfrey, 7 and Grace, 3.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and dyes to make and sell batik dresses.

loans.name: Maria Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida is 53 years of age, married to a taxi driver, and mother of 3 grown-up children who work. Her youngest, who is 16 years old, helps her out with the business. She has been selling tortillas, cheese, baked beans, Nicaraguan tamales, and home cooked meals for over 15 years. Her day starts at 4:00 am and ends at 9:00 pm. She lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood of Managua. Adelaida is requesting this loan to invest it into her business and expand the kitchen, which is where she makes 100% of the products she offers. With this expansion, she will be able to offer better services to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Adelaida tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es taxista, tiene 3 hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y trabajan por cuenta propia. Su hijo menor tiene 16 años de edad y es quién la apoya en el negocio. Tiene más de 15 años de tener este negocio el cual consiste en vender tortillas, cuajadas, frijoles cocidos, nacatamales y comida casera. Su día empieza a las 4:00 am y termina a las 9:00 pm. Habita en el barrio Laureles Norte de Managua. Doña Adelaida necesita el crédito para invertirlo en su negocio, quiere mejorar la infraestructura del lugar ampliando la cocina que es donde se desarrolla el 100 % de los productos que ofrece, y así poder ofrecer mejores condiciones a los vecinos que la visitan.

loans.use: Purchase of cinder blocks, sand, and metal to build kitchen

loans.name: Blesing

texts.en: Blessing O. is married with 6 children. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 50 years old, and has been in business for 3 years. She needs a loan of $600 to buy more birds (some for laying eggs) for rearing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more poultry for rearing

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Maria E. makes and sells roofs for construction in the town of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She has been doing this for 2 years now.

Nowadays what she needs most is to buy the materials needed to make the roofs, and for this she is counting on Ceprodel with the hope of being benefitted by one of their loans, which will allow her to improve her economic situation and therefore feed her 2 young kids where they live.

It is necessary to add that up until now she has had 2 loans, both of which have been paid off in time and in the right way.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La actividad económica de la señora Maria E. es la elaboración y comercialización de las tejas para construcción en el municipio Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 2 años.

Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la compra de los materiales para la elaboración de las tejas y para esto acude a Ceprodel con la esperanza de ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan mejorar su condición económica y así llevar el alimento a sus dos pequeños hijos en su hogar de habitación.

Es necesario destacar que hasta este momento tiene un record de 2 créditos pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: To buy roofing materials/Compra de materiales para la elaboración de las tejas

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en: Elvisa lives in a small village near the town of Doboj.  She has one child, 12 years old. Elvisa gets a monthly child allowance in the amount of 150 KM (about US$ 120). This is her first loan through MCO WWI in the amount of US$ 500. She intends to buy seeds for farming. She plans to produce food and reduce costs in this way.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana is a very hardworking woman. She opened an internet café within her house with which she not only provides a very important service to her community, but also helps support her family (made up by her husband and their two children). It has been three years since the business started, and the computers require maintenance so that Viviana is able to provide a better service to her clients and that way have satisfied customers. With this objective in mind she is requesting a loan that will allow her to achieve her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Viviana es una dama muy trabajadora. Con diligencia y empeño viene sacando adelante su negocio y con ella a su querida familia que la integran su esposo y sus 2 hijos y ha logrado adecuar un pequeño espacio de su vivienda para abrir un espacio de internet y prestar este importante e indispensable servicio a su comunidad.Actualmente y a 3 años del funcionamiento de su negocio sus computadoras necesitan mantenimiento para brindarles una buena y rápida atención a sus clientes y así estos queden satisfechos por los servicios.Con ese objetivo se presenta ante vosotros para solicitarles un préstamo que le permitirá concretar sus planes.within

loans.use: To obtain working capital in order to provide appropriate maintenance to the computers.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Since 2003, Hul S. has worked as a vendor selling noodles in a busy market. In one day, she can earn $25. Her husband is a farmer. He owns a plot of farmland and grows vegetables and rice. This couple has five children: four are students, and one daughter now is a hairdresser.

To supplement the household's income, her daughter plans to open a beauty salon. The extra income that will come from the salon will finance the other children’s education. To set up the shop, Mrs. Hul and her husband have agreed to request a loan from Kiva. (Mrs. Hul is pictured.)

loans.use: To set up a beauty salon shop

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
Marvin N. is a native of Sandino City in the capital of Managua, Nicaragua. For several years, he has sold clothing in the city streets as a traveling vendor.

His business requires a high degree of effort, moving daily from one place to another, and exposed to direct sunlight. He undertakes these efforts with the objective of supporting his family, which consists of his young school-age daughter.

Marvin's reason for approaching Kiva field partner Ceprodel is to obtain a loan for the purchase of inventory. By doing so, he will be able to keep up his traveling sales and thereby improve his financial condition.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Marvin N. es originario del municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua capital de Nicaragua. Desde hace varios años se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de ropa el cual la vende ambulantemente en las calles de su municipio.

Esta labor requiere de mucho trabajo por lo que se expone diariamente al traslado de un lugar a otro y además a la exposición al sol. Sin embargo estos múltiples esfuerzos los lleva a cabo con el propósito de mantener a su familia la cual esta compuesta por su pequeña hija en edad escolar.

El motivo por el cual acude a Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito para la compra de su mercadería y así continuar vendiendo la ropa ambulantemente para mejorar su situación económica.

loans.use:
Purchase of clothing
Compra de la ropa

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Lili, at 55 years of age, has shown that she is a proactive woman, crediting her ability to moving forward to all that she knows. She is a mother of 5 children, who are independent of her, and lives with only her husband Carlos, who works very hard to ensure them a comfortable life.

Lili works in food sales, and has for many years. She is a woman with dreams of improvement, as such she want to increase and develop her business as much as possible, since she is located in a very good area. Through this work in food sales, she was able to support her 5 children, who are now Technical professionals.

She hopes to improve her business, for which she needs capital that she solicits today as a loan, to invest in her business. Support this mother that has demonstrated her ability to move forward.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Lili, a sus 55 años de edad demuestra ser una mujer proactiva que contagia sus ganas de seguir adelante a todo aquel que la conoce, ella es madre de 5 hijos, los mismos que ya se independizaron, quedando en la actualidad, solos, ella y su esposo Carlos quienes trabajan duro para tener una vida tranquila. Lili se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace mucho tiempo, es una mujer con deseos de superación, pues ella quiere ampliar e implementar su negocio en lo posible, puesto que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona. Mediante esta actividad de venta de comida sacó adelante a sus 5 hijos, quienes ahora son técnicos profesionales. Ella desea ampliar e implementar su negocio, para ello estima de un capital que solicita hoy en préstamo, que invertirá en lo antes mencionado. Apoyemos a esta madre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante.

loans.use: Growth and development of her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de dos niños, María de 7 años y Robiño de 4. Se dedica al negocio de la venta de popcorn (Palomitas de Maíz) de forma ambulatoria por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca, negocio que es la fuente principal de los ingresos de su familia, ya que tiene que mantener sola a sus dos hijos.Siempre ha sido una mujer muy alegre y perseverante, a pesar de las pequeñas dificultades que se le presentan, siempre ha sabido superarlas, haciendo que su trabajo sea fácil de hacer. Un día común en el trabajo de Norma empieza a las 12 del día para terminar a las 8 de la noche, que es donde hay más venta, por el frío que hace en la ciudad de Juliaca.
Esta madre, sola, quiere sacar a sus hijos adelante y demostrarles que pueden tener un gran futuro a pesar de las penurias económicas que a ella le tocó vivir.
Con el dinero Norma quiere comprar algunos accesorios que le faltan a su triciclo, para mejorar la preparación del popcorn, haciendo que sea más consumido. En un corto tiempo, le gustaría comprar otro triciclo para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Norma is 29 years old. She is a single mother of two children: 7 year old María and 4 year old Robiño. She focuses herself on the business of selling popcorn (Palomitas de Maíz) on foot through the streets of the city of Juliaca. The business is the principle source of income for her family, since she only has to look after her two sons. She has always been a happy and persevering woman. Despite the small troubles she is faced with, she has managed to overcome so that her work should be easier to do. Norma's typical day starts at noon and ends at eight in the evening, which is when there are greater sales because of the cold in Juliaca. This single mother wants to move her children forward and demonstrate to them that they can have a good future despite the kind of economic hardships she has lived through. With this loan Norma wants to purchase several accessories she is missing for her tricycle so she can improve her production of popcorn so that it will be in greater demand. In a short while, she would like to buy another tricycle to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment and remodel of a tricycle used for selling popcorn on the go

loans.name: Avalisa

texts.en:
Avalisa S., 43, is married with 3 children. She has 5 years of experience in the food and clothing business. She sells to the village people and the public 4 days per week. Her husband helps her operate the business. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).

Avalisa has 2 previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Avalisa's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. The loan will be used to buy freezers and snack food for the store, and also to buy cement for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase freezers and food supplies for the retail store, and cement for home improvement

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.en: Nasrullo has six children. His wife works at a farm. But her salary is very small. So for almost 15 years Nasrullo has been buying cattle, fattening them and then selling them at the cattle market. He first started his business with a small amount of money. But now he is using money from his profit to he expand his business. He wants to borrow money to buy more hay for the winter season. This way he won’t have to sell his cattle for less during the winter season.

loans.use: Nasrullo would like to purchase more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Victoria Lila

texts.es:
La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, ubicado en la Urbanización Prolongación con Tupac Amaru Mz. 192 Lt. 16, distrito D. Yarinacocha, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 63 años D. edad, es viuda y madre D. 3 hijos mayores D. edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la confección.  

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. ropa y sábanas. Este negocio le brinda ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 6 sábanas polares, 2 docenas D. faldas, 3 docenas D. blusas, 2 docenas D. ropa interior, etc.

Victoria agradece al banco comunal por apoyar a su grupo D. socias para tener un negocio propio y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the Community Bank "Las Rosas" (meaning The Roses), located in Urbanizacion Prolongacion con Tupac Amaru Mz. 192 Lt. 16, in the district of Yarinacocho, in the province of Coronel Portillo in Ucayali. She is 63 years old and she is a widow and mother of three grown children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 she decided to invest the funds in confections.

Currently she sells clothing and bedding. This business proviD. her with earnings enough to pay off her loan on time.

With this loan of S/.1300, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase 6 polar fleece bed sheets, 2 dozen skirts, 3 dozen blouses, 2 dozen undergarments, etc.

Victoria is thankful to the Community Bank for supporting the group of members to have their own businesses and be triumphant in life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 6 polar fleece bed sheets, 2 dozen skirts, 3 dozen blouses, 2 dozen undergarments etc.

loans.name: Mawulé

texts.fr:
Madame A. est âgée de 55 ans et travaille dur pour venir à charge de sa famille, elle  habite le quartier d’agoè kléve au nord de la ville de Lomé(Togo) où elle vend des céréales, haricots et du charbon en détail depuis 1968 dans le quartier  de d’agoè gare, elle s’approvisionne pour son commerce au marché local de Notsè. Elle n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 03  sacs de maïs, 10 sacs de d’haricots et 03 sacs de charbons.
Elle est mariée à un militaire qui  est à la retraite, ils ont eu ensemble 08 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Attisove is 55 years old. She works hard to take care of her family. She lives in the Agoe region in the Northern section of the city of Togo. She has been selling grain, beans and charcoal since 1968. She sells her goods not far from the train station in Agoe and purchases them at the neighboring market located in Notse. She has never previously obtained a loan and is requesting this first one in order to be able to purchase 3 bags of corn, 10 bags of beans and 3 bags of charcoal. She is married to a retired army man. Together, they have 8 children.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, beans and charcoal

loans.name: Saúl

texts.es: Saúl es casado, tiene 40  años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijas. DesD. su juventud se ha dedicado a L. venta D. tamales,  él ayudaba a su madre en L. preparación y en L. venta, ahora que es casado y tiene 3 hijas ha optado como L. mejor salida D. generarse ingresos económicos a L. venta D. este plato típico del país que es el tamal, que consiste en una masa D. maíz molido con relleno D. aceitunas y carne D. pollo, y con un aderezo muy agradable, ese punto exacto D. sabor que pone en cada tamal es L. mejor garantía D. L. creciente demanda que tiene Saúl. Él va caminando por toda L. ciudad ofreciendo su producto, en especial a lugares comerciales y a establecimientos  D. comida, llega a vender hasta 120 tamales al día. Generalmente sale a vender por las mañanas y por las tardes, en su casa, los prepara. Saúl tiene grandes deseos D. continuar con este negocio y hacerlo más formal ofreciendo sus tamales a empresas que cubran grandes banquetes institucionales. Este trabajo es realizado con el único fin D. ofrecer a sus 3 hijas lo necesario para su sustento y educación. Es L. segunda vez tiene un préstamo con MFP, además, es un socio activo D. su banco comunal, ya que forma parte D. L. junta directiva. Saúl solicita esta cantidad para L. compra D. una máquina D. molino para que pueda acelerar el proceso D. preparación D. sus tamales, L. cual está valorizado en 4000 soles, solicita solo una parte para completar lo que le falta, ya que lo que resta lo cubrirá con su propio capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Saúl is 40 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three daughters. Since he was young he has earned a living making and selling tamales. He helped his mother prepare and sell them and now that he is married with 3 daughters, the best way to generate income is to sell this typical dish of his country. The tamale consists of a ground cornmeal dough filled with olives and chicken with a delicious sauce. The precise amount of seasoning that he puts in each tamale is the best guarantee Saul has to increase the demand for his product. He walks through the city offering his food, especially near businesses and restaurants. He sells up to 120 tamales per day. He generally sells during the mornings and in the afternoons he makes them in his home. Saúl greatly wishes to continue this business and make it more formal by offering his tamales to companies that cater large banquets. He does this work with the objective of providing his daughters with the necessary means to support them and proviD. them with an education. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he is also an active member of his community bank, where he is part of the organizing group. Saúl is requesting this loan to buy a mechanical grinder that will speed up the process of making tamales. This grinder costs 4000 soles and he is only asking for part of that, to add to what he has already saved.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a mechanical grinder

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa A. is 66 years old. Though she is old, she is still strong and able to manage her own business. She sells fish at their place. Basilisa markets dried fish and fresh fish to augment her income in providing for her needs. She has been in CEVI's credit program for almost two years now. Basilisa keeps good repayment records with CEVI because she wants to avail more of the services that CEVI offers. Her business truly helps her sustain her family and her five children. 

She is requesting another loan of PHP 12,000. Basilisa will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. Since her husband knows how to fish, part of the loan will be used to buy fishing materials like nets and fish bait.

CEVI gives Basilisa credit assistance, trainings, and insurance services.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and more fish to sell

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Don Luis Antonio, soltero, con 58 años de esda, tiene 12 años de trabajar en la Alcaldia Municipal como guarda de seguridad, con 7 hijos, de los cuales 3 estan en el ejercito y dan un aporte a la casa, una hija casada tambien habita con ellos, su compañera trabaja como conserje en la Administracion de Rentas, 3 hijos estudian los domingos la secundaria.  Con este credito pondra el techo a la construccion que logro levantar con el credito que hizo su compañera, pues para el es de suma importancia contar con una ampliacion mas de la casa, ya que sus hijos necesitan espacio y privacidad.  Con este cuarto credito podrá poner el techo y embaldozará el piso para un espacio con las minimas condiciones para habitar.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Antonio is single and 58 years old. He has been working for 12 years as a security guard at the Municipality, he has 7 children, 3 of them are in the army and help with the house's expenses, one of his daughter who is married also lives with them. His life partner works as a super for the Administration of Rents, three of his children study high school on Sundays. With the loan he is requesting he will build ceiling to the previous construction he started with the loan his partner did. For him is very important to improve his house, because his kids need space and privacy. With this fourth credit he will build a roof and floor which are minimum living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a roof and floors for his home

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame E. K. sells soft drinks and mobile phone recharge credits at Elmina. Maame E. has received a senior high education. She is not married and has no children. Maame E. has been selling soft drinks and mobile phone recharge credits since 2008. She is responsible for paying the rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her increase sales of soft drinks and mobile phone recharge credits to meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Increase the sale of soft drinks and mobile phone recharge credits

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Léocadie D. est une femme de 55ans, mariée avec des enfants en charge. Elle souhaite renforcer son activité d’élevage porcine. Ceci pour améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Léocadie D., age 55, is married and has children to support. She would like to bolster her business, consisting in raising porcine livestock, in order to improve the living and health standard of her children, as well as their schooling.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell peanut butter

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José  es socio del bancomunal Grandioso Milagro.
José es conviviente tiene 37 años, dos hijos de 12  años que esta en la escuela estatal. Y un hijo de 1 año.
La familia de José lo animo a poner un negocio de video juegos, hace dos años el se animo y empezó su negocio de video juegos, también da servicio de Internet;  estaba estudiando en la universidad administración de empresas en el quinto ciclo, cuando su esposa salio embarazada tubo que dejar los estudios.  
José necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para el mantenimiento de sus maquinas computadoras y sus equipos de video juegos.
Desde que esta en Finca, ha  podido resolver varios problemas  económicos, esta mas tranquilo y tiene para invertir. 
El sueño de José es cancelar todas sus deudas que tiene y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
José is a member of the Grandioso Milagro communal bank. He lives with his wife and is 37 years old. They have two children who are 12 years old and attend the state school, and one child who is 1 year old. José’s family encouraged him to open a video game business, so he started a business that has video games and also internet service. He was at the university studying business administration when his wife got pregnant and he had to leave his studies. José needs a loan of 800 PEN for maintenance on his computers and his video game equipment. Since he has been with Finca, he has been able to resolve various financial problems, he is more relaxed, and he has money to invest. José’s dream is to pay off all his debts and to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: José needs a loan of 800 PEN for maintenance on his computers and his video game equipment.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Назарова Гулшан проживает в районе Пяндж. ВДОВА , имеет троих детей. Работает на рынке  в центре района. Выпекает и продает пирожки.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже пять лет. Бизнес приносит дохо в размере 500 сомони в месяц. Кредит планирует использовать для закупки муки и масла. Таким образом она сможет безперебойно работать , не задумываясь о нехватки продуктов.Коме того , она сможет сохранять цены на производимую продукцию.
texts.en:
N. Gulshan lives in the Pyandj region. She is a WIDOW and has three children. She works at the market in the center of the region. She bakes and sells pies. She has been in this business for five years. The business brings her an income of 500 somoni per month. She plans to use the credit to purchase flour and oil. This way she will be able to work without breaks, without having to think about a lack of products. In addition, she will be able to save on the cost of her products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour and oil

loans.name: Fatimoh

texts.en: Fatimoh A. is fifty years old and married with four children. She sells sarongs and laces. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Kheoun

texts.en: Kheoun S., 56, has been involved in her tailoring business in Batambong province since 2006, with an income of $2.50 per day. Together, she and her husband have three children: one of them is a student and the rest are employed as construction workers. S. plans to take a loan $350 to buy fabric for tailoring and designing into clothes for customers. She hopes she will be able to generate more income for the family’s use and to pay expenses.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothes for customers

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia B. is a mother of five and a 46-year-old manager of her own business. She is married to Herminio, who is 47 and her partner in business. She lives in the island village of Malacaban in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province, in the Philippines.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in1996 with an aspiration to rise above poverty. During her membership, she has been noted for her excellent performance and ability to pay off her previous loans accordingly. Her previous secondary business was a fishing boat but she opted to shift her business. Now on her eighth loan, she proposes to invest it in the making of bamboo sets. She proposes to make 20 bamboo chairs, beds and other bamboo products with a loan request of 35,000 pesos.

With the help of her children, she is positive that her business would be in demand at the town market and in the other neighboring towns. She dreams of having enough money for the medication of her husband and for her younger children to go to school and continue schooling. She also dreams of having a more durable and spacious house and to get out from behind the wall of poverty.

loans.use: To make 20 sets of bamboo chairs and other bamboo products

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Selling charcoal and buying and selling scrap materials are the businesses that Norma manages in the small village of Gamis in Saguday, Quirino. Norma is 55 years old and she is married to Alexander L.. She manages these businesses to provide for every need of her family. She is so grateful for the blessings of God: having six helpful children and a very supportive husband. They help her to maintain her charcoal vending business and to make it progress.

Norma requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from Kiva as additional capital for the improvement of her business. Norma wants to save funds for her family's future and, of course, to provide the basic necessities of life. She prays that Kiva will continue to help her achieve her dreams in life.

loans.use: Capital for charcoal business

loans.name: Miel Plus Group

texts.fr:
Gaby K. 42 ans, est présidente d’un groupe d’emprunteurs constitué de 27 membres dénommé « Miel Plus » qui signifie « Honey » en anglais. 
Elle gère son propre restaurant depuis 2006 et elle a intégré cette Banque Communautaire « Miel Plus » depuis novembre 2008. Gaby a acquit une expérience solide dans la gestion de son restaurant qui se situe au nord-est de Kinshasa. Elle et son groupe ont déjà reçu une fois les crédits de Kiva à travers l’Institution de Micro finance Hope RDC et ils les ont remboursés correctement. Elle compte acheter avec le prochain prêt, des poissons et poulets pour renforcer le stock de son restaurant en vue de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients qui ne cessent de croitre et augmenter le bénéfice. A coté de l’ambition d’étendre son activité en y ajoutant une terrasse, Gaby rêve aussi à construire un jour une maison pour sa famille. Elle et son groupe sont déterminés à développer leurs affaires avec l’appui financier de Kiva à travers des crédits reçus de l’IMF Hope RDC. Gaby est mariée et mère de cinq enfants âgés entre 4 et 16 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Gaby K., 42 years old, is the president of a group of borrowers, comprising 27 members, named "Miel Plus," which means "Honey" in English. She has been running her own restaurant since 2006, and has been a part of this Community Bank, "Miel Plus," since November 2008. Gaby has gained solid experience in the management of her restaurant, which is located in the northwest part of Kinshasa. She and her group have already received one set of loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution Hope RDC (one of Kiva's field partners), which they repaid without incident. With this next loan, she intends to buy fish and chickens to increase her restaurant's supply, with the goal of satisfying the needs of her constantly increasing clientele and increasing her profits. In addition to her ambition of extending her business by adding an outdoor seating area, Gaby also dreams one day of building a house for her family. She and her group are determined to develop their businesses with the financial support of Kiva through the loans they obtain from Hope RDC. Gaby is married and and has five children, aged between 4 and 16. All of them go to school.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and chickens to increase the restaurant's supply

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 42 years old and married with 3 children. He sells medicine. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.  He hopes for the amount of N100,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás vive en la casa que le dejaron sus padres, con su hermana, su esposa y sus dos hijos. Desde pequeño fue muy hábil con los trabajos manuales y sus ganas de salir adelante lo llevaron a tener un pequeño taller donde fabrica guitarras, las cuales luego de elaborarlas se las entrega a sus primos y cuñado para que las pinten y adornen. Nicolás se siente muy feliz con su trabajo, el que cada vez le resulta más rentable porque tiene muchos pedidos, por lo cual necesita expandir su negocio y tener las herramientas y materiales necesarios para mejorar, cada vez más, la calidad de sus guitarras. 
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, demostrando en su anterior crédito puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita será utilizado en la compra de un medidor eléctrico industrial trifásico porque las herramientas que utiliza necesitan bastante potencia y el que tiene ahora no se abastece para su uso.
texts.en:
Nicolas lives with his sister, his wife and his two children in the house that his parents left for him. Ever since he was a child, he has been very skilled with his hands. His desire to get ahead drove him to set up a small shop where he makes guitars. Once he finishes them, he turns them over to his cousins and brother-in-law so that they can paint and decorate them. Nicolas is very satisfied with his business, which grows more and more lucrative because he has received many orders. For this reason, he needs to expand his business and obtain the tools and materials necessary to improve the quality of his guitars even more. This is his second loan with MFP, and he has demonstrated punctuality in making his previous loan repayments. The money that he is requesting will be used to purchase a three-phase electromechanical induction meter because the tools that he uses require more power, and what he has now is insufficient.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electricity meter

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: Avaz was born in 1955. He lives in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has 6 children. Ten years ago he started a cattle breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 Azarbaijani manat to buy 3 calves for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pig feed and materials to complete fattening pen for pigs

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. She is a 51-year-old single mother of two children, ages 19 and 23 years old. Both her children go to school. She rents a one-room house where she lives with the three people in her family. Florence also takes care of additional family members. They have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her residence and business premises, school fees for her children and food for the family.

Florence works seven days a week. On average, she receives 20 customers a day. She incurs transport costs to and from her suppliers in Owino market (one of the busiest markets in Uganda). She sells retail to all kinds of people. Florence has been in her business for seven years and with MCDT for five years, now on her 20th loan. Florence aspires to grow her business and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet tiene 37 años, vive junto a su esposo, sus dos hijos, su padre y sus 2 hermanos menores, en la casa de sus padres.
Desde hace 11 tiene una pequeña ferretería que implementó en un espacio al frente de su casa, donde vende fluorescentes, tubos en todos los tamaños, pegamento, etc., y aprecios muy cómodos. En este negocio cuenta con el apoyo de su padre.
Adicionalmente, desde hace 3 años también vende comida al paso por las noches, afuera de su casa, y en este negocio también le está yendo muy bien.
Lo que más le gusta de sus labores es mantenerse ocupada, ya que se considera una mujer muy proactiva, dispuesta a desempeñarse en cualquier campo laboral. 

Este es su segunda préstamo con MFP y lo que más le gusta de su grupo es que son personas responsables, además que se entretiene mucho durante las reuniones con ellos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos ferreteros para seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Janet is 37 years old. She lives with her husband, her two children, her father, and her two younger siblings in her parents’ house.

For 11 years, she has managed a small hardware store that occupies a space at the front of her house. She sells fluorescent bulbs, glue, and other items. The prices she charges are affordable. Her father helps her with the business.

In addition, she has been selling food outside of her house in the evenings for 3 years. This business has also done very well. What she likes most about her jobs is that they keep her busy. Since she considers herself to be very proactive, Janet says she is willing to work in any field.

This is her second loan with MFP. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank group is that the members are responsible, although she finds their meetings to be very entertaining. Janet will use the money to purchase more hardware products so that she can continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Musibau

texts.en: Musibau is 25 years old, married, and has a child. His wife sells ice cream to support the home. He is a friendly man and he uses his friendly skills to attract more customers to his stall. He sells engine oil at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to sell engine oil at wholesale prices in the future. He is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Isadora

texts.en:
Isadora is from the village of Mabini in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old and single. To make a living, Isadora is a Natasha dealer. She sells Natasha-brand clothing,  shoes, perfumes and kiddie items, and other Natasha products in the local community. She also raises livestock. Isadora has been engaged in her businesses for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Isadora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Isadora is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase another cow for one of her projects. This will be Isadora's 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her clothing business and to buy another cow to raise

loans.name: Libasse

texts.fr:
Monsieur Libasse N. est un jeune homme de29 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4mois et 4 ans. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-Imcec a Yoff depuis janvier 2009 mais n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt. Il est spécialisé dans l’électronique et la maintenance informatique. Il s’active dans son activité depuis 2006.C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par passion. Il a commence a l’exercer avant même de subir une formation dans ce domaine. Son plus grand bonheur c’est lorsqu’il enregistre un succès pendant ses séances de dépannage. Monsieur N. dispose d’un scooter pour faciliter ses déplacements. Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs. Une partie de l’argent est prévue pour l’achat de matériels électroniques tels que appareil de mesure, appareil digital, fer a souder, pompe a dessouder et caisse a trousse. L’autre partie du financement servira a changer les pièces défectueuses de son scooter. Ce sont les revenus qu’il gagne qui lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.²
texts.en:
Mr Libasse N. is a young man aged 29, married and the father of three children aged between 4 months and 4 years. He has been a member of the Yoff branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since January 2009, but never took out a loan. He specialized in electronics and computer repair. This is an activity he chose in 2006 because he had a passion for electronics, even before he began his training. He becomes very happy when he is successful with a troubleshooting assignment. He owns a scooter for his travels.

Mr N. applies for a loan of 250,000 CFA francs. He will use part of the loan to buy electronic equipment, such as a measuring device, a digital device, a soldering iron, an unsoldering pump and a toolkit. The remaining funds will be used to repair his scooter. The income from this activity enables him to provide for his family.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in electronic tools and repair his scooter

loans.name: Felipa Mercedes

texts.es:
En el mercado El Bisne del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Felipa T. se dedica a su actividad de venta de flores artificiales ofrecidas en su establecimiento donde diario las oferta a sus clientes teniendo variedad de flores, colores y tamaños.
Ella se ha preocupado por llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y hoy en día está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las flores a sus proveedores y así continuar comercializándolas para ganar ingresos para el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the El Bisne market in Chinandega department, Ms. Felipa T. sells artificial flowers in her establishment, where she daily offers a variety of flowers, colors and sizes to her customers. She has always cared about supporting her family in their home and today she asks for a loan to invest in purchasing flowers to her suppliers and so continue marketing them to earn an income to improve her situation and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: flowers

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Mrs.Saroeun T. is 30 years old and lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Nak Hang, mines gems in the local village from which he earns a small income. Mrs. Saroeun T. decided to ask for a loan to buy two pigs and pig food for pig breeding. With this loan she hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living conditions. Mrs.Saroeun T. is the mother of two children who are both students at the local school.

loans.use: To buy two pigs and pig food

loans.name: Los Godinez Group

texts.es: S. un grupo de personas que viven en un lugar llamado Pueblo Viejo, del municipio de Momostenango, de acuerdo a la actividad economica que realizan se dedican a 3 actividades, los cuales S. la crianza de pollos, Elaboración de canastas plasticas, asi también la siembra de invernadero, arbolitos para reforestar, ellas y ellos necesitan su prestamo para poder comprar materia prima para la elaboración de canastas, actualmente venden por docenas los cuales los lugares de venta S. en toda la republica de Guatemala,con el financiamiento que obtendrán les ayudará para aumentar de capital como también generara oficios a las personas del lugar que quieren trabajar con este oficio, solamente que S. contratados por los integrantes del grupo, de esta manera tendrán un mejor desarrollo economico en la comunidad donde residen.
texts.en:
They are a group of people who live in a place called Pueblo Viejo, which is in the Momostenango municipality. They work at three different activities, according to their businesses. They raise chickens, make plastic baskets, and use a greenhouse to plant small trees for reforestation. They need a loan to be able to buy raw material to make the baskets. They currently sell them by the dozens. They sell all over Guatemala. The loan they will get will help them increase their capital and generate jobs for people who want to work in this occupation. They are only hired by members of the group, and this way their community will have better economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Irma Rosa

texts.es: Doña Irma Rosa de 50 años de edad es soltera, vive junto a su compañero de vida,  tiene 4 hijos mayores el mayor de 32, otro de 31, otro de 29 y el menor de 28 años de edad, todos ya casados y con su propia familia, dos trabajan como docente de primaria y llos otro dos como albañiles. Irma Rosa trabaja como Tecnica Agropecuaria desde hace 13 años, atendiendo a campesinos del municipio,  està solicitando refinanciamiento de su 4to  credito con el cual pretende terminar de construir una habitaciòn, para asì tener mejor comodidad en el hogar ya que son una familia de escasos recursos econòmicos,  su sueño es  ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda y estar bien con Dios, quien nos tiene vivos y con animos de seguir trabajando y alabandole.
texts.en:
Irma Rosa, aged 50, is single and liveswith her life partner. She has four grown children, aged 32, 31, 29 and 28. All are married with their own family. Two work as primary school teachers and the other two as brick masons. Irma Rosa has worked as an agricultural technician for 13 years, helping farmers in her town. She is seeking her fourth loan with AFODENIC to finish construction on a bedroom. This will provide a more comfortable home, as they are a family of limited resources. Her dream is to continue improving her house little by little, and to be right with God, who keeps us alive, and to continue working and praising Him.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bedroom

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva es una persona puntual y responsable con sus obligaciones eso lo demuestra su historial crediticio.
Ella se dedica a la confección artesanal y venta de prendas de punto como son: chompas, guantes, tapetes, y otros prendas que sus clientes solicitan. Elva lleva sus productos a vender a diferentes provincias del Perú, para así obtener mayores ganancias, Además tiene la oportunidad de conocer diferentes lugares. Con las ganancias obtenidas y con mucho esfuerzo logro construir habitaciones en su casa y  ayudar a su hijo en sus estudios. Ella desea exportar sus tejidos a otros países así que necesita invertir para mejorar su producción. Elva agradece a todos las personas que hacen posible su préstamo.
texts.en:
Elva is a person who is punctual and responsible with her obligations, as demonstrated by her credit history. She makes and sells hand-knitted items such as sweaters, mittens, tablecloths, and other products that her customers request. She brings her products she has for sale to different provinces throughout Peru in order to generate the highest earnings. This also gives her the opportunity to become familiar with different places. With the money she earned and with great effort, she added rooms to her house and helped her son with his studies. Elva hopes to export her hand-knitted items to other countries, so she needs to improve her production. She thanks everyone who made this loan possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her business

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Mrs. M. is a 41-year-old married woman. She works very hard as a fish seller, and typically earns around $5 per day. She has a life partner in her husband, who owns a workshop in front of their home where he operates a vehicle repair service. The couple have been married many years, and they have three children. All of them have left school and are employed; two are garment workers and one is a security guard. Mrs. M. will be using her loan to buy a used vehicle for her children to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy a used vehicle for her children to ride to work

loans.name: San Gregorio Group

texts.es:
El comité  San Gregorio nace gracias al incentivo de otro comité quien comentó sobre el apoyo que encontraron una vez formado el grupo.

Las señoras que integran este comité se dedican a varias actividades y desean continuar trabajando ya que encuentran mucha mejoría en las actividades que cada una realiza.

Martina T. es una de las señoras que integra este comité, ella se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa. Ella tiene salón que alquila para ofrecer sus mercaderías dentro del mercado de San Lorenzo, ella ofrece exclusivamente ropas para niños y niñas. Todos los productos que ella que ella tiene lo ofrece a muy buen precio. El negocio es atendido por ella y una socia del negocio. 

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de calzados para criaturas.
texts.en:
The San Gregorio Committee was born thanks to the incentive of another committee that commented about the help they once received in forming their group. The women who make up this committee are dedicated to various activities and wish to continue their efforts, since each of them has encountered much improvement in their businesses. Martina is one of the women who make up this committee. She sells clothing from a space she rents for that purpose in the San Lorenzo market. Her clothing is exclusively for boys and girls. All her merchandise is offered at a good price and the store is personally attended by Martina and her associate. She requests the loan to buy baby shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baby shoes to sell

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married with four boys (two are in secondary school and two in primary).  She's a cook and sells samosas, Irish potatoes, french fries, and juices out of her home to her neighborhood and passersby.  She's had her business for 12 years.  Halima's husband works as a driver and mechanic.

Halima requested a loan that she will use to buy a freezer for her juice business and to purchase more Irish potatoes.  One of her recent business challenges is the rising price of baking flour, potatoes, and cooking oil.  

Halima hopes to make enough with her business to have her own home in the coming years. (Currently she rents a small room where she has electricity but no piped water.)  She joined Yehu in order to gain access to loans like this one so she might improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Mrs. Vanny Earm Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Sampan Leu village in Kandal province there is a village bank loan which consists of twenty-one people. Mrs. Vanny E. is the village bank president, selected by the other members, who will each use a piece of the loan to buy some supplies to support their businesses. Vanny is 47 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Vanthorn Sor, are farmers who own over one-hectare of land to grow crops to support their family. She has two children, one of whom is a beautician in the local village, while the other is attending the local public school. Since her child’s business is going well she wants to expand it. So, Mrs. Vanny E. is seeking a loan to buy some beautician supplies, and the rest of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy some beautician supplies

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is married with ten children, all of them are at school. She has no additional family members to care for. Fatuma sells bananas in Nalukongo market. She buys bananas from Mbarara in southern Uganda and uses public transport to and from Mbarara. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for ten years. She pays monthly market dues of 45000/=. She has a water project where she gets some additional money. Fatuma sells both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week. Fatuma depends on this job to get a living. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Her business challenges are transportation and defaulters. Fatuma lives in a two-roomed house she owns and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Emalin

texts.en:
Emalin A. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests rice for sale. Emalin has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $215 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Emalin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emalin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Emalin is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Bevelyn

texts.en:
Bevelyn C. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bevelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. 

She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es: Tomasa tiene 52 años, sus 3 hijos trabajan de manera independiente, por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su negocio los ingresos necesarios para mantener a sus clientes. Por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de refresco y leña a pesar de ser una actividad muy humilde ella busca la manera de ganarse la vida, además trabaja todos los días desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia como azúcar, bolsas, frutas y otros productos. Sueña con mejorar cada día su actividad.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 52 years old. Her three children are on their own now and she concerns herself with being able to invest enough into her business to be able to satisfy her customers. She sells drinks and firewood. Aside from being a very humble activity, she searches for ways to earn a living, and works every day from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm. She is asking for this loan in order to buy sugar, bags, fruits, and other products. She dreams of improving her business each day.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ines Loena

texts.es:
