Inés de 36 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, ella confecciona ropa como pantalones, blusas todos los días

Su mama le enseño a coser y a confeccionar ropa. Comenzando con una maquina de coser vieja pudo tener suficientes clientes para solventar sus gastos. Trabaja todos los días en su casa confeccionando pantalones, vestidos, blusas a sus clientes y así tener ingresos suficientes para darles una mejor vida a sus cuatro hijos de 20,16, 13, 9 años.

Para continuar con su taller de confección de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y hilos en el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y tener mas grande el taller de confección y costura.
texts.en:
Inés is 36 years old and lives in an urban area of Guayaquil, a suburb. Every day she is busy sewing clothing like pants and blouses. Her mother taught her how sew. She began with one old sewing machine which permitted her to have only as many clients as would support her expenses. Working every day in her home, she makes pants, dresses, and blouses for her customers. She makes enough money to give her four children, ages 20, 16, 13 and 9, a better life. In order for her to continue with her home business, she would like to purchase cloth and threads with her micro-finance loan. In the future she would like to be about to improve her home and to have a larger work room to sew in.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cloth and threads

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda V. is from the village of Santa Isabel Norte. She is 35 years old. Melinda is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Melinda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Melinda has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP when she sells her raised animals.

In 2009, Melinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Melinda is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Melinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita M. is a married woman who lives in Purok  5-a, Campaclan village, Sibulan, Negro Oriental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: herbal medicine, Panibit (nipa making) and RTW businesses. Her husband Rogelio M., who is 47 years old, works as a Construction Worker to earn his living. They have eight children who are 8 to 23 years old. 

Pablita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Pablita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29500, which she intends to use as additional capital for herbal medicine business so that she could continue to save up for future improve their family living condition. Pablita M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase herbal medicines

loans.name: Melfie

texts.en:
Melfie E. is from the city of Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 35 years old. Melfie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks, special recipes, ice and ice candy (similar to popsicles, only fruit juice based). Melfie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melfie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Melfie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: La Sra. María Elena C. L. ella es Trabajadora activa del Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como camarera, tiene  cuatro años de trabajar para esta institución tiene cuatro hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con Ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: María Elena C. L. is a active employee at the Barceló Monte hotel who works as a waitress. She has been working there for four years. She has four school-aged children.  She has taken out two loans with CEPRODEL and each one has allowed her to buy construciton materials to improve her home. The loans with CEPRODEL have greatly benefited her, allowing her to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Buying construction materials: Zinc, beams, etc

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
Serafina, es socia del Banco Comunal Prosperidad, tiene 65 años, es viuda desD. hace 16 años, es madre D. 7 hijos, ella se dedica la venta D. comida en el Mercado Santa Clara donD. ofrece desayuno y almuerzo, este negocio lo biene realizando desD. hace 40 años, actualmente su hija le esta ayudando en la atención (madre soltera).
Serafina solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra D. Arroz, azúcar, aceite , verduras ,carne, etc.
El sueño D. Serafina es poder construir el segundo piso D. su casa, también sueña con abrir una chicharroneria en su mismo local, a Serafina le gusta mucho la metodología D. FINCA Perú por ello es socia mas D. 15 años.
texts.en:
Serafina is a member of the Prosperidad (Prosperity) Communal Bank.  She is 65 years old, a widow for the last 16 years, and mother of 7 children.  She sells food in the Santa Clara Market, offering breakfast and lunch.  She has been engaged in this business for 40 years.  At present, her daughter (a single mother) helps her with serving customers.
Serafina requests a loan to purchase rice, sugar, oil, produce, meat, etc.
Serafina’s dream is to build a second floor to her house.  She also thinks about opening a stand to sell cracklings in the same site.  Serafina is very pleased with FINCA Peru’s methodology, and for this reason has been a member for over 15 years.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, produce, meat, etc.

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es: Oralia M. O. desde hace 3 años opto por poner un estanquillo de comida corrida en su misma casa que son tamales y menudo al que abre todos los días por ser ya conocida en su alrededor. La señora quiere invertir en su negocio ya que en esta temporada de frio es cuando ella tiene mas pedidos y quiere estar preparada para seguir incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en: Three years ago Oralia M. O. decided to set up a fast food place in her home selling tamales and 'menudo' (tripe soup).  She opens every day as she is already well-known in her neighborhood.  She would like to invest in her business since the cold season is when she has most orders and she would like to be prepared so that she can continue increasing her sales.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Teresa Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa Jesús; ella tiene 57 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de manualidades, ella realiza diferentes adornos y pinturas, el esta oportunidad realizara adornos para la época navideña, la socia quiere tener una tienda para poder vender loa adornos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para que realice los adornos para la época navideña.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "MARIA ELENA MOYANO". The bank is located in the Cusco district belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Teresa Jesús, she is 57 years old and married and has 3 children. The member alternates her daily activites with the business of selling handicrafts. She produces different decorations and paintings. At this opportunity she will produce decorations for the Christmas season. The member wants to have a store to be able to sell the decorations. The member is asking for the loan to buy materials in order to produce decorations for the Christmas season.

The member thanks those who are a part of this dream by using this means, and she promises to fulfill her installment payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: This member is asking for the loan to buy materials to produce decorations for the Christmas season

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man and the father of five children. His three oldest children are working and his younger two children both attend secondary school. He is from Lebanon. He has made his living as a house painter for over fifteen years. He works on a freelance basis upon request of the clients. 

Over the years, he has been able to meet his family's needs, especially raising such a big family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his tools and purchase scaffolding for his newest project.

loans.use: renew his tools and purchase scaffolding

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS HERALDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rina; ella tiene 35 años de edad, soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en uno de los hospitales del Cusco en el area de administración lleva  un par de años en este trabajo , esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento y de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de algunos productos de primera necesidad y para sus gastos personales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rina is a member of the "LOS HERALDOS” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Rina is 35 years old, single and has one child.  She works in administration in one of Cusco's hospitals.  She has been in this job for a couple of years.  It is the only business activity that she is engaged in right now and it is how she gets her family ahead in life.

Rina is requesting a loan to buy some essential household products and to cover some personal expenses.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy some essential household products and to cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 32 years old; she is married with five children who are between five months and ten years old, including a pair of twins.  Four of her children go to school. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Anne sells both food stuffs and soft drinks in her shop. She has spent six years in this business. She has requested this loan to buy more foodstuffs and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to use this new profit from expanded business to renovate and install electricity in her house. She would like to have a loan amount of five million in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es: Ana Maria H., es madre soltera, tiene 53 años D. edad, estudió solamente los grados D. primaria en educación, tiene 5 hijos, lo cual ninguno estudia, se dedica al bordado D. guipiles a mano, tiene 35 años D. experiencia con el trabajo que realiza, inició elaborando blusas pequeñas. Con gran entusiasmo organiza un grupo D. señoras para organizar un banco con el fin D. solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR que les servirá para ampliar su capital D. trabajo. Las integrantes del banco comunal  se dedica a diversas actividades productivas, Ana Maria espera ver su negocio granD. y productivo, y que cuente con operarias para la elaboración D. los guipiles.
texts.en: Ana Maria H. is 53 years old and is a single mother of five children. She only has a primary education and none of her children are in school. She makes hand-embroidered blouses and has 35 years of experience in this work. She started making small blouses. With great enthusiasm she organizes a group of women to organize a bank to apply for a loan with field partner ASDIR. The loan will allow them to increase their working capital. The members of the community bank are engaged in various productive activities. Ana Maria hopes to see her business grow and become productive and to have workers making blouses.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married with two teenage children. He lives in Vodyanoye, Ukraine, and grows early spring vegetables to sell in the local markets in his region. He owns six arch greenhouses where he does tomato and radish farming. He has been in the business for nine years. He currently has 90,000 UAH invested in his business. Annually, he spends about 45,000 UAH on seeds and polyethylene protective film. 

He is requesting a 15,000 UAH loan to buy five rolls of polyethylene film to repair the greenhouses damaged during the heavy winter snowfalls and ice. The loan will give him a chance to sow seedlings in his greenhouses on time. 

Vitalyi’s daughter is graduating from high school and would like to enter a university. Vitalyi hopes to earn enough money selling groceries this summer to pay for her first year of studies.

loans.use: to buy polyethylene to repair his greenhouses

loans.name: La Unión Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La unión hace la Fuerza está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Mayra P., Mercedes L. y Victoria V.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora P.  realiza y vende delantales y gabachas desde hace varios años.
Ella con el crédito comprara telas, cintas, hilos entre otros materiales que necesita.
Mientras L. tiene una pequeña fritanga, restaurante popular a base de comida frita y Victoria Vásquez se dedica al comercio de productos varios como pulseras, ropa, collares etc.
texts.en:
The group “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” (Unity is Strength) consists of three hardworking, determined, and enterprising women: Mayra P., Mercedes L., and Victoria V.. The group coordinator is Sra. P., who has been producing and selling aprons and smocks for several years.

She will use her loan to buy fabrics, ribbons, thread, and other materials that she needs.

Sra. L. manages a “fritanga”, a popular type of restaurant that sells fried food. Victoria Vásquez is a merchant who sells various products such as bracelets, clothes, necklaces, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, ribbons, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Jocelyn is married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling dried fish and coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase coconuts and dried fish products to sell. This will be her 11th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts and dried fish products to sell

loans.name: Sagynbu's Group

texts.en:
Sagynbu N. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of a small mining town, Tashkomur, which is located in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 38 and married to a taxi driver. Together they are bringing up two children. The older daughter studies at school and the second child is a newborn. 

In order to earn additional money to meet family needs, 15 years ago with an initial investment of 2,000 KGS, the family started to breed livestock.  With money received from the loan, Sagynbu will purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, she plans to start repairing the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is from the village of Tayong, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & biscuits. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & biscuits.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton O. M. is a married man.  His wife is a businesslady.  They have four children aged between seventeen and nine years old, whom they hope to educate to the university level. 

Milton's business is located at Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin. He runs a shop in which he sells phones, phone accessories and auto spare parts.  His shop is well-known and is called Celtake Phone Services. He has been running this business for four years now and has managed to give employment to two people. 

Milton says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 70,000 to increase his stock of phones and phone accessories to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and open other mobile phone shops in different towns. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: buy phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Hualdir

texts.es:
Hualdir tiene 39 años de edad vive con su esposa y menores hijos en la zona rural de la provincia de Chiclayo – Lambayeque. Hualdir es conocido en su comunidad por ser un hombre trabajador y de  buenos modales, siempre atento con los demás, sobre todo con su esposa y con sus niños.

Hualdir tiene 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, se dedica a cultivar arroz sobretodo. Él solicita unc rédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para poder comprar insumos para su cultivo de arroz, especialmente para la fertilización de sus tierras y el deshierbo de éstas. 

Hualdir desea realizar este cultivo lo más pronto posible para poder obtener ganancias que le permitan pagar el préstamo y  también reparar algunas fallas presentadas dentro de su hogar.
 
Hualdir cuenta con una buena experiencia crediticia en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Hualdir is 39 years old.  He lives with his wife and dependent children in a rural area of Chiclayo province - Lambayeque.  Hualdir is known in his community as a hard-working, well-mannered man who is always attentive to other people, above all his wife and children.

Hualdir has 10 years experience in farming and mainly grows rice.  He is requesting a loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can buy supplies for his rice crop, above all so that he can fertilize and weed his land.

Hualdir would like to carry out his sowing as soon as possible so that he can make profits that will allow him to repay his loan and also repair some faults in his home.

Hualdir has a good credit history with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies for his rice crop

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne is a married woman with 5 children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 4 years, she has been operating a tailoring business, offering services to her neighbours and passersby. She also makes dresses to contribute to  her income. Roselyne faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a tailoring school in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy cloth materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Leibnitz Marcelo

texts.es:
Leibnitz marcelo tiene 36 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con dos hijas de 11 y 4 años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NARCISA DE JESUS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Temistocles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Leibnitz se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz y arroz, es tradición en su familia dedicarse a este negocio. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos y la variación del clima. Su sueño es construir la casa ya que en la que vive es muy vieja.

Le gusta salir a pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Leibnitz Marcelo is 36 years old, married and living with his wife and two daughters who are 11 and 4 years of age.  He lives in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.

This communal bank is called "Narcisa de Jesús" and is located in San Temístocles which is in Ventanas Canton.  The members are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Leibnitz is a farmer, especially of corn and rice.  It’s a family tradition to be in this business.  His purchases take place in Ventanas and his sales at the market there.

He is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations and crop illnesses as well as weather variations.  His dream is to build a house because the one he lives in is very old.  He enjoys going on family outings.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Ma Cristina

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Ma. Cristina le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y el piso de concreto al frente de su casa.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es pintura para el exterior, comprar de cemento, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Ella se dedica al cuidado de sus dos hijos que tiene y su esposo el señor Salvador es quien se encarga de los gastos familiares, con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleado de una compañía, como vendedor.
texts.en:
María Cristina's home needs some finishing work done on the outside and also on the concrete floor out front.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials.  She will buy paint for the outside of the house and also cement and sand.  In addition, she will pay the person who will carry out these improvements.

María Cristina looks after her two children and her husband, Salvador, takes care of the family expenses with the wage that he earns in his job as an employee in a company.  He works as a salesman.

loans.use: to have some finishing work done to the outside of her home and on a concrete floor

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo tiene 59 años, Es soltero vive con solo tiene dos hijos pero son casados y no viven con el, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos..

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener mas terreno para sembrar cacao.

Le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is 59 years old.  He is single and lives alone.  He has two children but they are married and do not live with him.  Pedro lives in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The 'Luchando por una Misma Causa'  community bank is located in La Primavera, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Pedro is a farmer who grows corn, rice and beans.  He buys his products in Comercial Peña and makes his sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Pedro is requesting this loan to grown corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  His dream is to have more land so that he can grow cacao.

Pedro likes cleaning his house.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: LAS EMPRENDEDORAS Es un grupo formado por   socias que viven en puente piedra una zona al norte D. lima Perú, Nélida trabaja  haciendo tejidos a mano  como chompas ponchos  chalinas etc ,  ella presta sus servicios D. acabados a varias fabricas  D.  tejidos  quienes a su vez exportan estas prendas, las ganancias que obtiene por este trabajo le sirven D. mucho porque ayuda a su esposo en la manutención del hogar , lo que mas quiere es hacer terminar los estudios a sus hijos y lograr que sean profesionales, por otro lado espera  seguir tejiendo  y crear nuevos modelos lo que hará con su préstamo es comprar los materiales que necesita como lanas , hilos etc. actualmente pertenece al grupo " LAS EMPRENDEDORAS" que esta conformada por 10 socias.
texts.en:
"Las Emprendedoras" (The Entrepreneurs) is a group whose members live in Puente Piedra, an area to the north of Lima, Peru.

Nélida's business is knitting items by hand such as sweaters, ponchos, scarves, etc.  She provides a finishing service to several knitted goods factories who, in turn, export these garments.  The profits that she makes from this work are very useful to her as she is able to help her husband support their household.  What she would most like is for her children to finish their education and become professionals.  She also hopes to continue knitting and creating new styles.  She will use her loan to buy the materials that she needs such as yarn, threads, etc.  She currently belongs to the 'Las Emprendedoras' group which has 10 members.

loans.use: to buy yarn and thread

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor de 24 años, es soltero y vive en una casa alquilada en el distrito de Sivia. Héctor es un joven trabajador que desde niño soñaba con tener una vida llena de comodidades, por lo que aprendió que para lograr esa vida debería de trabajar arduamente. Actualmente Héctor viene se dedica al negocio de venta de ganado vacuno, el cual proviene de la serranía ayacuchana. Su trabajo requiere muchos sacrificios. Héctor debe realizar largas caminatas arreando el ganado durante 5 días. Su recorrido comienza en Huanta y termina en el distrito de Sivia. Al arribar a Sivia procede a la matanza del ganado y su venta por kilos. Héctor está satisfecho con las ganancias que obtiene pero en el futuro desea dedicarse  a la venta de carne de res mayorista. Este es su primer crédito con MFP por lo que el esta comprometido en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Héctor esta feliz  por conformar su banco comunal y se compromete a cumplir con todo los acuerdos. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles desea adquirir una cortadora de carne.
texts.en:
Hector is 24 years old, single, and lives in a rented house in the Sivia district.  Hector is a hardworking young man who, since childhood, dreamt of having a life full of comforts.  He learned that to achieve this life he would have to work arduously.  

Now Hector sells cattle that come from the Ayacuchana mountains.  His work requires many sacrifices.  Hector has to make long walks herding the cattle for 5 days.  His journey begins in Huanta and ends in the Sivia district.  When he arrives in Sivia, he proceeds to slaughter the livestock and sell it by the kilo.  Hector is satisfied with the earnings he makes but in the future would like to sell wholesale beef.  

This is his first loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments punctually.  Hector is very happy to be a part of the communal bank and is committed to meeting all his agreements.  Therefore, he hopes for each of your support to be able to continue his work.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles he wants to acquire a meat cutter.

loans.use: to buy a meat cutter.

loans.name: Marvelina

texts.en:
Marvelina is 43 years old and is married to a local farmer. She has two school-aged children. Marvelina is a determined and responsible mother. Aside from nursing their child, she also keeps herself busy in maintaining her farming business to produce better yield. With her husband, she plants and harvests rice.  Marvelina earned PHP 25,000 from the last crop season in May.  The profits earned were used to sustain her business and pay school fees and bills.

Marvelina is requesting a loan amount of P14,000 to pay for farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. She wants to regain some profit since the last crop was a loss for her due to a typhoon affecting most of their farm. She hopes this loan will be a great help for her in providing sustenance for her farming business for the next crop harvest in November.

In the future, Marvelina would like to keep making better crops to obtain the income necessary to support all the needs of the family. She also would like to earn additional income for house repair.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mwamina

texts.en:
Mwamina is a married woman with four children, all of whom all adults. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a dried fish selling business which contributes to her source of income. She dreams of establishing a selling shop in the future.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is from the village of Kveda Simoneti in the Imereti Region. He is 34 years old, married, and lives in the village with his family: wife Nana, their 7-year-old daughter, 2-year-old son, and 76-year-old mother (retired). Gela’s daughter goes to school. 

Gela has a grocery store located near the historical museum in the village. Because of the good location, along with clients from the village population, Gela gets customers from the visitors of the museum as well. 

Gela’s wife is managing the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they have 4 milk cows. She produces cheese and sells it on the Kutaisi (a nearby town) open market. She also grows greens on 0.05 hectare of land and sells them on the same market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris, including the pension of Gela’s mother. 

Gela requested credit in order to increase the stock sold in the store. He will increase the assortment of the products in the store. He expects that the amount of clients will increase starting in September, as groups of schools and high-school students from various parts of the country will be visiting the museum. Sales of the store will increase and the income of the family will grow. It will impact positively the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for the store

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a hardworking businessman aged 26. He is married and blessed with two children who are in school. He does electronic repairs so as to earn a living. He hopes to open other outlets of his business for more income generation.  He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy spare parts for televisions and radios.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for television and radios.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor cuenta con 32 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos lo cuales se encuentra estudiando el mayor se llama Román tiene 9 años esta estudiado 3º grado de primaria y Guadalupe de 7 años está estudiando 2º grado de primaria y Jacqueline esta en 1º grado de primaria, su esposo se llama Román es campesino.

Ella se dedica al comercio y docente de primaria ella vende los domingos tamales y pozoles varea a veces pozole o tamales también vende pollos y pescado su préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de cajas de pollos y pescado.

Ha Leonor le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco mas ya que quisiera establecer un local de comida.
texts.en:
Leonor is 32 years old, married and has three children going to school.  The oldest is called Román.  He’s 9 years old and going to third grade.  Guadalupe, 7, is going to second grade and Jacqueline is in first grade.  Her husband’s name is Román and he’s a field worker.

She’s a merchant and an elementary school teacher.  She sells tamales and/or pozole on Sundays; sometimes it’s tamales and sometimes it’s pozole.  She also sells chickens and fish.  She used her loan to buy crates of chickens and to buy fish.  Leonor would like her business to grow a bit more because she’d like to set up a food stand.

loans.use: to buy crates of chickens and to buy fish.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married with 4 children. Maricel is 36-years-old and she presently resides at Guba, Clarin Misamis Occidental. 

Maricel is in an agricultural business. To earn a living she manages a corn farm and after harvest she sells it to the contract buyer. Maricel has been in this business for about five years and she has a monthly income of Php 3,230. 

She requested a loan of Php 5,000 to acquire fertilizer. Maricel is a member of GDMPC this year only. She is in the first cycle. She hopes that with the help of GDMPC her family will live well because of the earnings rendered with her business that is funded by the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio es un hombre de 55 años es casado y tiene 1 hijo, al que le enseña a como ganarse la vida. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pero es por medio del negocio que es un beneficio por que es la forma que paga su casa. Hace 31 años aprendió este negocio desde muy joven con esfuerzo propio para sacar a su familia adelante. El quiere comprar botones, telas, cintas, agujas, tijeras, hilos y dedales. Para esto necesita la compra de materia prima, el sueña con ampliar su negocio cada día mas.
texts.en: José Antonio is a 55 year old married father of one. He is teaching his son how to earn a living. This is not the first time that he has taken out loans and it benefits his business, which is how he pays for his house. He learned this business 31 years ago, when he was very young. With his own hard work, he has done this to get his family ahead. He wants to buy buttons, fabric, ribbons, needles, scissors, thread and thimbles. He needs to buy raw materials. He dreams of expanding his business more every day.

loans.use: to buy buttons, fabric, ribbons, scissors, thread and thimbles.

loans.name: Pasklina

texts.en:
Pasklina is 35 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. She has had a business selling clothes for five years in Yei, South Sudan.

Pasklina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Kokoé

texts.fr:
Kokoè est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un gérant de restaurant. Elle a deux enfants.  
Kokoè travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle vend du riz, des boissons et des articles en plastiques pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule. 
Kokoè a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du riz de l’huile et des boissons. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Kokoè voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kokoè is a 31-year old woman. She is married to a restaurant manager. She has two children.
Kokoè has been working as a vendor since 2005. She sells rice, beverages and plastic items out of her home, to all kinds of clients. She buys her goods at the 
big market of Lomé. She works by herself.

Kokoè has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy rice, vegetable oil and beverages. She would like to make a new investment in her business. In the years to come, Kokoè would like to open a store. She says that she plans to use her revenues to improve life conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy 4 jugs of oil, 5 bags of rice and canned beverages

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Tumaini Group in Western Kenya! Dina is the facilitator of the Tumaini group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Dina takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Dina had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dina was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Dina will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tumaini group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Dina with her group members and the field officer on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Adilia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de  San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. De estado civil conviviente, su edad es 42 años y tiene 03 hijos, el mayor ya es independiente y los dos últimos estudian el nivel Secundario y Primario respectivamente.
Cuando vió la necesidad de seguir creciendo con la actividad que realizaba su esposo, el de renovación de calzados, decidió poner su granito de arena, para mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia,  con el primer préstamo que recibió del banquito comunal le sirvió para comprar materiales para la confección de calzados como zapatos, sandalias, que ella salía a vender ambulatoriamente y con el tiempo el negocio se volvió familiar, al implementar un local donde confeccionaban los calzados y lo exhibían, fue un gran éxito, y en la actualidad cuentan con el apoyo de su hijo mayor que se encarga de los diseños de nuevos productos como botas para diferentes ocasiones como actuaciones, presentaciones, etc. Es así como vienen trabajando para seguir creciendo, y atendiendo los pedidos de sus clientes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,  comprará  materiales como suelas, cuero, cartón, pegamento y bicuero, para cumplir con los pedidos que tienen pendiente por las fiestas Navideñas.
Adilia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,  que sueña con tener una fábrica de confección de calzados, para  de esta manera asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por las enseñanzas impartidas a las socias en el buen manejo del dinero con responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Adilia belongs to the “Mujeres de la Colina II”, communal bank, in La Banda de Shilcayo district, in the province of San Martín, in San Martín department.   She is 42, lives with her partner, and has three children. The eldest is already independent, and the youngest ones are in high school and primary school respectively.  

When she saw the need to keep her husband's shoe repair business growing, she decided to do her bit to improve the family's financial situation. She used the first loan she received from the communal bank to buy materials for making footwear, such as shoes and sandals, which she went out to sell as a street vendor. 

In time, it became a family business, when they set up a shop where they made and displayed footwear. It was a great success, and they currently have their eldest son's help, as he is the one responsible for the design of new products, such as boots for various occasions such as performances and shows.

This is the way they have been working to keep growing, and filling their customers' orders. With this loan of 2,000 soles she will buy materials such as shoe soles, leather, cardboard, glue and two-toned leather, in order to fill pending orders for the Christmas holidays. 

Adilia is an enterprising and hard-working woman, who dreams of having a factory for making footwear, to assure her children's future in this way. 

She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the instruction given to the members on managing their money responsibly.

loans.use: To buy materials such as shoe soles, leather, cardboard, glue, and two- toned leather.

loans.name: Mutwiwa

texts.en:
Mutwiwa is a 39-year-old business man.  He is married to Tabitha, and they are blessed with two children, aged 12 and 9 years, respectively. He has been running a retail shop for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

Mutwiwa is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mutwiwa will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking oil for his store.

loans.name: Lucia Margarita

texts.es:
Lucia, vive con sus abuelos, no tiene compromisos a parte de sus abuelos, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y mariscos, este negocio lo heredo de su abuela, y se ha hecho cargo del negocio desde hace un año.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de verduras y mariscos, papas, güisquiles, yuca, tomates, chiles, cebollas, también camarones, pescado, para mejorar el inventario y aumentar su negocio.
Este préstamo espera que pueda mejorar el crecimiento en el negocio, para que así también aumenten sus ganancias para ayudar a sus abuelos.
texts.en:
Lucia lives with her grandparents, and has no family to care for except for them. She works selling vegetables and seafood, and she took over this business from her grandma. She has been in charge of the business for a year.

She is asking for a loan to buy vegetables and seafood: potatoes, chayote, yucca, tomatoes, peppers, onions, shrimp, and fish, to improve her inventory and expand her business. She hopes the loan will allow her to grow the business, increase earnings, and help her grandparents.

loans.use: buy potatoes, chayote, yucca, tomatoes, peppers, and onions.

loans.name: Truc

texts.en:
Truc, a 46 year-old single woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community.

Truc requests a loan to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a smallholder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is married and has six children to raise and look after. In 2000, she decided to make better use of her husband's 3 acre farm and used it to start dairy farming. Today, her work brings home an important source of income. 
Sally applied for a loan because she wants to construct a shelter for her animals. Being out in the open, the cows are vulnerable to harsh weather conditions that eventually deteriorates their health and productivity. With your loan investment, Sally will be able to improve animal welfare on her farm through putting up a proper housing. 
She hopes that this investment will lead to reduced cost of veterinary interventions and increased milk production.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Reyna Emely

texts.es: Reyna de 37 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace mas de 15 años comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Reyna esta solicitando por tercera vez otro credito para la compra de semilla, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, ya que le va bien con sus cultivos y sus ganancias y asi podra tener mejores ingresos economicos.

loans.use: para la compra de semilla, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes y mejorar el terreno

loans.name: Mawulé

texts.en:
Ms Mawulé A. was born in 1975 in Aklakou. Married and the mother of two children, she is in the cereals business. Energetic, open, honest, and with a keen management sense, Ms A. runs her business very effectively. Currently, a strong demand for frozen food has arisen in Aklakou, and Ms A. quickly recognized an opportunity. She therefore wishes to serve her customers by opening a shop for selling frozen products.

This new project requires financial resources that Ms A. does not possess. For this reason she is asking for a $1,200 loan to acquire a freezer and to stock up with fish, chicken, and other frozen products for retail sale. This new activity is sure to increase her household income and will improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY/J.V. Guy-Bray.

Mme A. Mawulé est née en 1975 à Aklakou. Mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle a pour profession le commerce des céréales. Dynamique, ouverte, sincère et ayant le sens aigu de la gestion, Mme. A. maîtrise parfaitement son activité qu’elle gère avec efficacité. Aujourd’hui, une forte demande en produits congelés s’est révélée à Aklakou et Mme. A. l’a vite compris. Elle souhaite alors satisfaire sa clientèle en ouvrant une boutique de vente des produits congelés. Ce nouveau projet nécessite des moyens financiers que Mme. A. ne dispose pas. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de $1200 qui va lui servir à acheter un congélateur et à s’approvisionner en poisson, poulet et autres produits congelés pour la revente. Cette nouvelle activité augmentera à coup sûr le revenu du ménage de Mme A. et améliorera ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and a supply of frozen products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: I am a single parent, mother of 4. I sell groceries to earn a living for myself and my children. The loan will help me diversify and expand the business so as to be able to pay school fees for my children.

loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old and has 10 children. Her husband works preparing and producing coal. She makes bracelets and belts, which she sells to craftsmen at the tourist's market in San Cristóbal de las Casas. She would like to buy more reels of thread because if she buys them at wholesale price they'll be cheaper, cutting down her costs. Thus, Rosa will gain more profits from the finished products. She belongs to the group Nubes 7.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

ROSA TIENE 38 AÑOS , CASADA TIENE 10 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA PREPARACION Y PRODUCCION DE CARBON .ELLA SE DEDICA A CONFECCIONAR PULSERAS Y CINTURONES , LOS CUALES VA A VENDER A LOS ARTESANOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EL MERCADO TURISTICO DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS.TIENE COMO PROYECTO COMPRAR MAS HILO PORQUE ASI POR MAYOR ES MAS BARATO Y OBTENDRA MAS GANANCIAS DE LA VENTA DEL PRODUCTO TERMINADO .PERTENECE AL GRUPO NUBES 7.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Komilkhodjha

texts.ru:
S. Komilkhodjha is 29 years old; he sells food. He has a family, 3 children. Children go to school and kindergarten. He has been in business for 13 years. He started his business from 150$. Now his assets have increased to 1100$. During financing he bought refrigerator showcase. He gets his inventory from local suppliers. In the future he wants to open one more retail spot and expand the range of goods.

Translated from Russian by Asya Lisak, Kiva Volunteer.

Солиходжаев Комилходжа – 29 лет, занимается продажей продуктами питания. Семейный, имеет троих детей. Дети учатся в школе и ходят в детский сад. Вот уже 13 лет занимается торговлей. Начал свою деятельность с 150$. Сейчас его активы возросли до 1100$. В период кредитования приобрел холодильник-витрину. Товар берет у местных поставщиков. В дальнейшем хочет открыть еще одну торговую точку и расширить ассортимент продукта.

loans.use: increase assort ment and activity place

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Mrs. Le was born in 1977.  She lives with her mother-in-law, husband, and son. Everyday she sells vegetables at the local market while her mother-in-law sells pork.  When she finishes selling the vegetables, she stays to help her mother-in-law.  The family income is $13 per person/month.  She needs a loan of $75 to support her business.  Mrs. Le will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to sell vegetables and pork

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en: Kamila is a  mother of four  children and lives in the town of Khachmaz. She is 59 years old and has been breeding poultry for the past four years. Currently, she purchases turkeys and raises them for sale. Now, she needs a loan of $1200 to buy additional turkeys and fodder in order to further increase her income.

loans.use: To buy turkeys and fodder

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en: Bashorat T. lives in Khujand; she is married and has 3 children.  She is an active client of MicroInvest from 2006. The statistic indicator shows the permanent loan sum increase that says about the business development and business stability. She trades in Friday and Sunday bazaar. She has the good assortment and she is working in the woman suits and mantles selling. Working in this sphere she has the competitors so now she requires the loan in 1000 STJ for the good purchase and business development. She is attended to purchase the inter-season mantles that she is going to realize successfully.

loans.use: the good purchase

loans.name: Mulkadar

texts.en: A. Mulkedar is a 26-year-old young farmer who lives in Imishli region. His business consists of breeding calves and selling them to the local bazaar traders for mat production. Selling livestock is the only financial source in his family.  He is requesting a loan of $1200 to expand his business and build good conditions for his cattle.

loans.use: To expand his business and improve conditions for keeping his cattle

loans.name: Siti Nuriyah

texts.en: Siti, 52, is married to D. who does not have a regular income to support his family. Siti has to work hard to cover the family needs by selling clothing on credit, door-to-door such as sheets, blanket, etc., earning $20 a week with a small profit. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of $125 to buy more goods to sell. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Buy more goods

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es:
Irma Esperanza C. is the mother of 4 children and dedicated herself to the business of selling vegetables in the city of Jinotega specifically in the region of Yali. All her life, she has lived in this area and since she began her business 17 years ago she has looked for a way to better her economic situation to care for her children. It is necessary to stress that she has been a very strong mother and has instilled good values in her children. Her necessity these days is to acquire the vegetables to sell them and for this she uses the help of a financier that Ceprodel provided her to obtain her products. Nowadays all the credits that she has requested have been paid off in the established time and manner.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma Esperanza C. es madre de cuatro hijos que se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras en la ciudad de Jinotega específicamente en el municipio de Yali. Toda su vida ha vivido en esta localidad y desde que inició su negocio hace 17 años ha buscado la manera de superar su situación económica para mantener a sus hijos.

Es necesario destacar que ha sido una madre muy esforzada y con buenos valores inculcados a sus pequeños. Su necesidad actualmente es la adquisición de las verduras para comercializarlas y para ello hace uso del apoyo financiero que Ceprodel le brinda para obtener sus productos. Actualmente todos los créditos que ha solicitado han sido cancelados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a los establecido.

loans.use: To purchase baskets of vegetables

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
Catarina is a lively 25-year-old married women, with two children. Both her children go to school, the youngest to kindergarten.

Catarina grew up in Maputo, where she attended school until 6th grade. She stopped studying due to her family’s financial difficulties (they were 14 siblings and only some could attend school at the same time). In 1997 she met her husband, Paulo Miguel, who paid her tuition to attend 7th grade. Catarina got pregnant soon after, so she stopped studying again to take care of the house.

In 2005 Catarina started working as an assistant at a company in Maputo, and with their monthly income they were able to buy a house in the beautiful Matola neighborhood. In 2006, her father-in-law asked his son Paulo to take care of his driving school in Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland, so they moved there. In 2007 Catarina went back to school to complete 8th grade. However, as her father-in-law passed the property to his son, she was appointed to take care of the bar adjacent to the driving school.

Catarina makes around MTn 500 to MTn 1,500 per day at the bar. In addition she receives a rent of MTn6,000 from her house in Maputo. Catarina has one employee that helps her with the house duties, takes care of the boys and also works at the bar when necessary.

Both Catarina and Paulo are very business oriented. They realized that Namaacha district has no funeral service, nor a place to buy coffins. They have already a land near the cemetery where they are building a shop to sell coffins and other funeral items needed for services. As Paulo was already a Hluvuku client (he had a loan to buy a new car for the driver’s school – loan already concluded), Catarina decided to ask for this MTn 25,000 loan to buy the land where they will build the coffin manufacturing plant, just outside Namaacha village.

In the future, Catarina would like to go back to school. Her dream is to be a nurse or a doctor, so she still wants to go to university, no matter how long it takes.

loans.use: Buy land to build a coffin manufacturing plant

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.es:
Despite her age, Marcosa is in charge of looking after her household and her husband, who has retired. Five years ago, she worked at a vegetable stand in a local market. However, when her husband retired, their monthly income was not sufficient. Her husband’s pension was too small, and her vegetable business did not generate enough income, which is why she decided to open a general store in her home a year ago.

She has three grown-up children. For now, her plan is to expand her business and later set up another one, since the idea is to always advance.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

A pesar de su avanzada edad, Marcosa se encarga de mantener su hogar y a su esposo, quien es ya jubilado. Hace cinco años ella trabajaba en puesto ambulante de verduras en un mercado; no obstante, cuando su esposo de jubiló los ingresos mensuales de ambos no eran suficientes. La pensión de su esposo como jubilado era muy pequeña y su negocio de verduras no producía lo necesario. Fue por ello que decidió hace un año abrir una tienda en su casa.

Ella tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores. Por ahora su plan es crecer en su negocio y más adelante poner otro. Pues la idea siempre esta en progresar.

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Thúy, an active, quick and trustworthy woman, joins the TYM Fund in 2002. She uses funds from her loans to raise livestock and invest in her general stand. Her stand is popular. Some says she has her charm in trading. The family’s economy improves gradually. Life is better and her children have more for their education. Loan repayments are simple since she has income from the stand everyday. This time she would like to apply for a loan of 10,000,000 VND for her fish stand. The monthly income is 5,000,000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Năm 2002 tham gia vào Quỹ, Chị Nguyễn Thị Thúy là người phụ nữ năng động, vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán nhỏ, với bản tính nhanh nhẹn, thật thà nên công việc buôn bán của chị rất thuận lợi, khách hàng đến mua hàng của chị chỉ một lần là nhớ mãi, có một số người đánh giá chị là người có duyên bán hàng, măc dù công việc bán hàng của chị rất bận rộn nhưng chị cùng chồng vẫn chăn nuôi lợn tại nhà, cứ như vậy vòng vốn này qua vòng vốn khác anh chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và buôn bán, mô hình ngày càng mở rộng dần theo hàng năm. Kinh tế phát triển, các con đều được đi học, Việc trả vốn đối với Quỹ cũng thật giản đơn với gia đình anh chị, chị bán hàng thu nhập đều đặn hàng ngày. Vòng vốn này gia đình xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư thêm vào hàng cá. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Fish sale

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia is 23 years old and completed high school. She is mother of one son and her vision is to have enough capital to constitute a business of Embroidering and bag making, and for her son to become a professional.

Eulalia is a partner of the Las Kantutas de Wilkauta Common Bank, of Mulla Contihueco, in the Juli disctrict, Chucuito Juli province, Puno region, Peru. She makes and sells bags and embroiders cloth tapestries, in addition to farming and cattle raising.

She learned to embroider when she was 12 years old, thanks to her mother. When she married her husband, Nilton Condori Quispe, she began making cloth bags, while embroidering tapestries. Since they lacked more capital to improve production they took out a loan for $115 from the Common Bank to buy 8 kilograms of red wool to make tapestries, and as a result increased their production and earnings.

With this loan of $375, which will be returned over a 4 month period, she will purchase 15 kilograms of wool in different colors, 25 meters of zippers, 10 bags of key-chains, and 300 buttons, with which she can increase her supplies.

She and her husband are very happy since they have improved their income from sales and fabrication of bags and embroidered tapestries, dealing directly to the local markets, such as Cusco and Puno.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Eulalia tiene 23 años de edad, estudió hasta superior no universitario, es madre de un hijo y su visión futura es tener más capital para constituir una Empresa de confección de Mochilas y Bordados, y sea profesional su hijo. La señora Eulalia, es socia del Banco Comunal Las Kantutas de Willkauta del Centro Poblado Mulla Contihueco, del distrito de Juli y provincia de Chucuito Juli de la región Puno. Se dedica a la confección mochilas y Bordado de Panoramas de Bayetilla y como actividad complementaria es agricultura y ganadería. Ella aprendió hacer Bordados desde los 12 años de edad gracias a su madre, cuando formaron el hogar con su esposo Nilton Condori Quispe, iniciaron con la Confección de Mochilas de Bayetilla y al mismo tiempo Bordados de Bayetilla. En ese entonces les faltó más capital para mayor producción y accedieron al préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos del Banco Comunal para comprar 8 kilos de lana roja para confección de la bayeta, así logró incrementar su producción y ganancia. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, que cancelará en un plazo de cuatro meses, comprará de 15 kilos de lana de diferentes colores, 25 metros de cierres, 10 bolsas de llavecitas y 300 botones, con ello logrará incrementar su material de producción para confección. Ella y su pareja se encuentran muy contentas ya que mejoró sus ingreso económicos por la venta de productos de confección de mochilas y Bordados, comercializando directamente a los mercados regionales como Cusco y Puno.

loans.use: Purchase of wool and materials in bulk.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin T., 45, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband, Suon Soeun, and their two children. She and her husband are rice farmers who work in their rice paddy earning around US$2 each day. Their two daughters are employed in the local garment factory and their salary of US$3 each day is also contributing to help support the family.

Phin T. has asked for a loan of US$1000 to purchase seeds for her field to expand her crop inventory. High inflation has created a lot of difficulties for many Cambodians and the local farmers have not seen the returns on rising food prices. Phin T. believes this investment can truly help her business and can improve her family’s standard of living.

Phin T. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Suon Soeun, is pictured above.

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Mari Luz

texts.es:
Mari Luz tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años. Tiene que esforzarse a realiza sobre cargada labor como madre y como agricultora, para ello tiene que preparar los alimentos desde muy de mañana, para luego salir rumbo a sus terrenos de cultivo junto a su familia, en la chacra trabaja hasta altas horas en la tarde, retorna a su hogar muy cansada.Lo que sin lugar a duda le agrada, es que el trabajo junto a su familia, esto lo hace menos cansado y agotador, aunque hay días que por circunstancias del tiempo y clima tiene que lidiar con ello y realizar su trabajo con mayor rapidez.
Mari tiene un gran amor por sus pequeños, y son ellos los que la motivan día tras día a seguir esforzándose.
Ahora está pensando en invertir dinero en la compra de semillas, para ello, de la misma forma, tendrá que adquirir abonos para la siembra, espera que con el tiempo, se consolide su labor y tener la capacidad de producir en mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Mari Luz is 32 years old, she lives with her husband and two children who are 5 and 3. She tries very hard handle her heavy workload as a mother and as a farmer. To do this, she fixes meals early in the morning and later leaves for her fields with her family. She works on the farm until late in the afternoon and returns very tired to her home. Without a doubt, what she likes is working alongside her family, which makes it less tiring and exhausting. Although some days because of time and the weather she struggles to work faster.

Mari loves her little ones very much, and they are her motivation to keep working hard day after day. She is now thinking about investing money to buy seeds, and she will also have to buy fertilizer for the sowing season. She hopes that in time she will consolidate her work and will have the capacity to produce in greater quantities.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer in order to increase and improve production.

loans.name: Faisealofa

texts.en: Faisealofa V., 42, is married with six children. She has 1 year of experience in the buns and donuts business. She sells to the village people and public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD). SPBD loans are Faisealofa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar, yeast, plastic bags and other ingredients used in her bakery. Her older daughter helps her with the business.

loans.use: Faisealofa would like to purchase flour, sugar, yeast, icing and plastic bags.

loans.name: Thérèse Marguérite

texts.fr: Née vers 1966 à Abidjan en Côte d'Ivoire, dame Thérèse Marguérite B. est originaire d'Abomey. Elle n'a jamais été à l' école et fut placée comme domestique  pendant 10 ans à  Cotonou où elle travaillait à faire le ménage au quotidien. Puis, après son mariage , elle se mit à vendre de la farine de manioc. Elle a fini par préférer la vente de nourriture à savoir du riz, de la pâte de maïs , du haricot  et de pâte alimentaire . Elle cherche à mieux satisfaire sa clientèle  qui ne cesse de s'accroître. C'est pour se faire qu'elle sollicite troisième prêt de 150000fcfa. Elle est devenue veuve voici juste 06 mois et a 02 orphelins à sa charge: Jérémie et Sonia. Elle compte s'approvisionner en maïs, riz, huile végétale et autres.
texts.en:
Born around 1966 in Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire, Mrs. Thérèse Marguérite B. comes from Abomey. She never went to school and was hired out as a servant for 10 years in Cotonou, where she did daily housekeeping tasks. Then, after her marriage, she began to sell manioc flour. In the end, she found she preferred selling cooked food such as rice, maize porridge, beans, and pasta.

Mrs. B. is seeking to satisfy her ever-growing clientele. For that reason she has requested her third loan in the amount of 150,000 F CFA. She was widowed just 6 months ago and is raising 2 orphans: Jérémie et Sonia. She is intending to stock up on maize (corn), rice, vegetable oil, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 sacks of maize, 1 sack of rice, and 25 liters of vegetable oil

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny K., a group leader of four who all live in Kdol Village in Takeo Province, owns a small grocery store. Since it is doing well, she wants to expand the business and so is requesting a loan to buy more grocer goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Saom Touch, is a policeman who makes a small salary that helps to support the family. Vanny is the 40-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest is a one-year-old at home.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans and so are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocer goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Sévérine

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, dame A. Sévérine s'est mariée à monsieur WHENON Abel et mère de un enfant, agé de 6 ans et en classe de CP. Elle vend du riz à la deventure de sa maison et parèllèlement à cette activité elle distribue des savons et fais la collecte des fonds tous les soirs Pour agrandir ses activités ,elle a sollicité un pret auprès de notre institution, ce qui lui a été accordé.
texts.en:
Mrs. Severine A. is 32 year old and is married to Abel Whenon. She is the mother of a 6 year old child who is in the first grade. She sells rice from the front of her house and she also has a business distributing soaps and collecting payment funds every evening. To increase her business, she is requesting a loan from our institition (microfinance), which has been approved.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice, oil, and fabrication of benches and tables

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de  Chinandega el señor Luis Humberto J. se dedica a su actividad de agricultura y ganadería desde hace varios años. Es importante destacar que esta actividad ha sido el pilar por el cual ha apoyado a su familia llevando el sustento a su casa.


La razón por la cual hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de una yunta de bueyes para sacarle el máximo provecho y de esta manera continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar por medio del ganado que es su actividad económica.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chinandega, Luis Humberto J. has been farming and raising livestock for a number of years. Importantly, this activity has been the pillar that has supported his family. Now, he is asking Ceprodel for a loan in order to buy a pair of oxen to maximize his profits and continue to support his home by way of his livestock, which are the source of his income.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pair of oxen

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mr. Phat P., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Somaly Kong, 35, married in 1992 and have three children: two sons who attend school and one daughter who has full-time employment in a plywood factory. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phat and his wife have been growing vegetables for 10 years. Beside farming, they also sell firewood at their house. The couple hopes to expand their firewood business, that's why Phat is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a wood-cutting machine and to buy firewood for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase a wood-cutting machine and to buy firewood for re-sale

loans.name: Ana Jaime

texts.pt:
Ana jaime M. nasceu em namaacha tem 30 anos de idade vive maritalmente e estudou ate a 5 classe, poios foi  abandonada pela sua mae ainda crianca e passa a viver com a sua avo. E mae de 3 filhos com idades coopriendidas entre os 11 oas 6 anos de idade todos vao a escola.

Ana inicia muito tarde a sua carreira estudantil e quando frequentava a 6 classe esta fica gravida do seu namorado que a abandona alegando que o filho que ela esperava não era dele e teve que interroper os estudos. Entao a sua avo da lhe um fundo para fazer negocio, vendia clandestinamente no mercado do bairro(biscoitos e pasteis) 2 anos depois ela junta se com o seu 2 esposo este que a ajuda a cuidar dos seus negocios.o seu negocio foi crscendo e aos poucos construia uma barraca na sua residencia. Em 2007 consegue concluir a sua obra mas já não tinha fundo para comprar mercadoria, atraves duma conversa com as amigas teve conhecimento dos servicos da hluvuku assim solicitou um emprestimo e conseguiu comprar a mercadoria. seu melhor produto e o( açucar, arroz, sabao  e sal) compra o kilo a 20 e revende a 25, o saco a 500 e revende a 600, a caixa a 200 e revende a 275 consecutivamente pois na regiao onde se encontra vivem mais de produtos agricolas. Trabalha das 7h as 18h tem tido um rendimento mensal de 4.000.00mt e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt pois para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua avo manda do lhe uma sesta basica de 500mt mensalmente.

Este e o segundo emprestimo de ana na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. O primeiro de 7.000.00mt foram usados para comprar produtos de primeira necessidade para revenda e pede este segundo de 10.000.00mt para o mesmo fim esta confiante que vai reembolsar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo emprestimo para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Ana Jaime M. was born in Namaacha, is 30 years old, lives with her husband and was in school until the 5th grade as she was abandoned by her mother as a child and went to live with her grandmother. She is the mother of 3 children aged between 11 and 6 and they all go to school.

Ana began her studies quite late in life and when she was in the 6th grade, she fell pregnant and her boyfriend abandoned her claiming that the child she was expecting wasn't his, so she had to interrupt her studies. Her grandmother then gave her some money to start a business and she secretly sold biscuits and pastries at her local market. 2 years later she gets together with her husband who helps her take care of her business. The business began to grow and she slowly built a stall at her home.

In 2007 she managed to complete the construction of the stall but had no capital left to buy merchandise. Through a conversation with her friends she learnt of Hluvuku's services and solicited a loan to buy merchandise.
